loans.name: Genesis

texts.en:
Genesis P. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old and married, with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Genesis owns and operates a poultry business. Genesis has been engaged in his business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Genesis joined PMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genesis is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed and chicks to be raised. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his family's living conditions.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and chicks

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mrs. Oeun P., 47 years old, is a villager in Chuos village in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she grows rice to sell to support her family. She also makes Khmer cakes for sale on the side. Her husband, Mr. Kun Heng, is a construction worker. Their rice field is ready to be plowed but they did not have enough oxen for the job. So Mrs. Oeun P. decided to apply for a loan to buy an ox. Though these activities, the couple supports three children, one of whom is a laborer in Thailand, and the others attend the local public school. The picture shows Mrs. P. and her husband.

loans.use: To buy an ox for enough to plow the field

loans.name: Jose Freddy

texts.es:
José Freddy A., quien  Labora como Colector de Ruta en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo,  y  estos  se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cinco crédito con CEPRODEL durante cinco  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido los crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, cemento, hierro y piedra para la construcción  de un cuarto para sus dos hijos.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Freddy A. works as a collector at the Wholesale Market of Managua. He is married and has two dependent children who are in school. José Freddy has received five loans with CEPRODEL over a five year period and invested the proceeds in making improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, iron, and stone to build a room for his two children. His goal is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, iron, and stone to build a room for his two children

loans.name: Alec

texts.en:
Alec is a 35-year-old single man living with his parents. He has owned a car repair shop since 1991. He repairs all types of car and is well known in his region and its surroundings. Alec is pleased with his decision to take out his first Kiva loan from Ameen. He has been very reliable with his repayments and has actually repaid his loan in full several months early. 

Today, Alec is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a scanner machine in order to integrate this technology into his work, developing it to meet the requirements of the market and of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase a scanner machine

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando A. es un señor de 52 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años ella y su familia se han dedicado a la Agricultura. Principalmente el café, pero debido a los bajos precios de este producto don Fernando tuvo que cortarlo y ahora necesita Sembrarle pasto a la Finca para el cuido de ganado y caballos.
En estos momentos don Fernando  desea obtener un microcrédito  por  ¢605.000 (seiscientos cinco  mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto y los materiales necesarios para darle al terreno las condiciones aptas para empezar su nuevo negocio. Esto le ayudara a buscar otra forma de  generar los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su estilo de vida.

Don Fernando  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. El está muy agradecido por el acceso al crédito brindado por este tipo de empresas.
texts.en:
Sr. Fernando A. is a 52 year old man who lives with his wife and son in the community of Santa Fe in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community lies in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main business activities in the area are livestock breeding and farming, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Fernando and his family have been farming for several years. He grows primarily coffee, but since prices have been low, Don Fernando has had to stop production and now needs to plant grasses around his farm in order to care for his cattle and horses.

At the moment, he is requesting a micro-loan of 605,000 CRC in order to buy grass seeds and necessary materials needed to prepare his land so that he will have adequate conditions for his new business. This will provide him another means of generating the income necessary to improve his lifestyle.

Don Fernando is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and he hopes to keep developing on a personal and financial level. He is very appreciative that access to credit is provided to businesses such as his.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grass seeds & other materials to maintain his farm

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es: La Sra. Pamela es nacida en la cuidad de la Paz-Bolivia, pero actualmente vive en el barrio Araca de Noe de la cuidad de Santa Cruz, cuenta con casa propia aun no tiene las comodidades necesarias, pero de a poco se avanza "dice", ella tiene 26 años de edad vive con su esposo el Sr. Douglas, y sus tres hijos, ellos tienen un negocio familiar el cual es una pequeña colchoneria en la que hacen colchones para despues ser sacados a la venta, empezaron esta actividad juntamente con su padre pero, ahora ya son independientes y cuentan con su propio capital y conocimiento para elaborar los mismos, ademas cuentan con vehiculo propio para el transporte de su mercaderia, el prestamo actualmente solcitado sra para la compra de tela para la elaboracion de colchones. nuestro objetivo es llegar a ser mayoristas y entregar a las ferias y mercados, por cantidad ya que actualmente se comercia domicilio en domicilio, y que en algunos casos son dejados a credito. Estan Muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Pamela was born in the city of La Paz in Bolivia. She currently lives in the Araca de Noe neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz. She has her own house, even though she does not have the necessary amenities. But, she is slowly making progress. She is 26, and she lives with her husband, Douglas, and their three children. They have a small business of making mattresses, which they later take to sell. They started this business with her father, but they are now independent. They have their own capital, and they know how to make the mattresses. They also have their own vehicle to transport their merchandise. The loan they are now requesting is to buy fabric to make the mattresses. Their goal is to become wholesalers. They want to deliver to fairs and markets in large quantities. They currently sell door to door. In some cases they leave the merchandise on credit. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Lucilaminda

texts.en:
Lucilaminda R. is from the village of  Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Lucilaminda owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products. Lucilaminda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lucilaminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucilaminda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucilaminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
la señora Sofia D. tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, tiene la ayuda de su hijo para la venta del producto y el no se a  casado todavia y han podido salir adelante.

el credito lo necesitaria para la compra de tenis de marca ya que lo vende a buen precio y de esta manera obtiene mejores ganancias y asi de esta forma reponerse de los tiempos que han estado muy malos para las ventas
ya que la epoca de lluvia en esta zona a sido bien fuerte y practicamente los negocios que estan ubicados en calles peatonales cierran.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sofia D. is 50 years old and single; she has been selling clothing and shoes for several years. With the help of her unmarried son, they have been able to come out ahead. They are applying for this loan to buy brand-name sneakers, because they can sell then at a good price and in this way, obtain a higher income and make up for the recent dip in sales. Because the rainy season in this area has been quite brutal, the businesses located on pedestrian streets have had to close.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and footwear

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is a married woman with three children who all attend school.  She has been operating her business of selling second hand clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby for five years.  With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase a bale of clothes and clothing materials.

She faces the challenges of seasonality, especially the months of May and June during the rainy season when only heavy clothing are on sale. Zena hopes to build her own house someday in her life.

She decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to boost her business and improve her way of living.

Zena rents a house with electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes and clothing materials.

loans.name: Rita Faiva

texts.en: Rita Faiva N. is 36 and married with five children. She sells lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women). Rita has two years of experience in this business. Rita needs a loan of 1,000 Samoan tala to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or about $63 per week) to improve/expand the business. In 2008, Rita joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Rita's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Evening Light Group

texts.en:
Joel F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Evening Light. Joel is 34 years old, single and has one child who is 6 years old.  He is currently in college. 

Joel has been selling used clothes in Fiamah Market in Monrovia, Liberia for five years.  He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 43,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes.  He describes himself as a hard-working man.  His goal is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Value Group

texts.en:
Mamusu C. (shown on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city forty-five years ago and is a widow with five children, all of whom are now grown-ups.

For many years now, Mamusu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth), firewood and charcoal.

This is not the first loan that Mamusu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

Mamusu will use her SLL 800,000 share of the loan to expand her business: she will buy materials to produce more gara lappers (ink, caustic soda, powder, etc.) plus more firewood and charcoal to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy materials for making gara lappers plus more firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mihirbanum's Group

texts.en:
Mihirbanum B. is the leader of the group. She is 41 and she is married. With her husband, who works as a gas welder, they are parents of 3 children (a daughter and 2 sons). Two of the children are students, the junior one goes to kindergarten. For three years already, with the help of her friend, Mihirbanum has earned a living by selling fruits in the market. Today, this family's mother earns additionally by providing manicure and hairdressing services. At this point, with the help of their earnings, they have managed to obtain domestic appliances and to do partial house repairs. The family needs a loan in order to buy vegetables (potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers) to resell and to prepare canned stores for winter. In future Mihirbanum wishes to give a good education to her children, to give them a proper upbringing, to buy a new car and to open her own beauty shop.

Antonina K., 29, divorced. She is a treasurer of this group. By herself, she is bringing up a daughter. This unwed mother earns her livelihood by working as an operator in a playing club. The loan purpose is to buy building materials in order to finish house repairs. Antonina wants to marry, give birth to more children and to buy a car. 

Rustam K., 22, a bachelor. He works in “Abdysh-ata” company as a loader as well as in a military part of a boiler-house. His additional income comes from cattle breeding. He decided to start this business after having helped his friend in doing it. His mother helps him to run this business. During these years he has managed to purchase some household appliances. Rustam needs a loan in order to buy two calves for further fattening and to increase stock. Planning his future, Rustam wants to build a big house, to marry and to buy a car.  

Ainagul S., 58, is divorced. She has an adult son, who works in OsOO Abdysh-Ata as a common worker. Ainagul makes her living by working as an ambulance medical assistant. The loan purpose is to buy wallpaper and a chandelier in order to decorate a hall. In the future she wants to arrange her son’s wedding, to buy a flat and a car. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina O. is a 42-year old married woman who supports her family by selling vegetables and buying and selling scrap gold. She lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Tiling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1990 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP4,500. Adelina is borrowing PHP 24,000 to  purchase fertilizer for her vegetable plantation. This will be her 24th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Adelina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn Khem, 60, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for fertile farmland for growing vegetables. Khem decorates fabrics and grows fruit trees at home, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 8 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month. Khem is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland and more supplements to decorate fabrics. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland and more supplements to decorate fabrics

loans.name: Tumurbaatar

texts.en:
Tumurbaatar A. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His daughter attends university while the younger two children attend school and his oldest son works in a beverage company as a loader. His wife works in a local food market as a salesperson, and Tumurbaatar operates a 'ger'-bracing supply production business. He produces ropes, belts, and straps used in 'ger' construction. 

Tumurbaatar  started his business in 2005 and has gained much experience as a maker of these products. Over the many years of owning this business, he has built up a stable and successful operation and has gained many permanent customers and partners. For the future, he is planning to have his own workplace and sell his products both on the local and foreign markets of Kazakhstan. 

Tumurbaatar is a modest, honest and hardworking person. He is requesting an 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase horse manes and tails in order to produce ropes and straps.

loans.use: To purchase horse manes and tails

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma V. is a married woman who lives in Purok Ipil-ipil, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  food vending and general store businesses. Her husband Sunny V., who is 39 years old, works as a driver to earn his living.  They have two children who are 8 and 10 years old. 

Lerma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lerma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future to sustain their daily needs and to educate their children. Lerma V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for her business operation

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia K. is a resident  of Kisii Town in Western Nyanza. She is a mother of two children,  aged 18 and 12, and has been doing mixed farming for more than 20 years, producing maize, milk, beans and vegetables and selling them locally. She has two farmhands. She earns additional income from supplying stationery to local secondary schools.

She has requested a loan of 60000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. This is her third loan request after the first and second of 40000 KES each. The loan is for the purchase of a dairy cow. She believes the income generated will be enough to educate her children and acquire property to provide additional security. 

Her continuing challenges are bad debtors and poor roads.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

She has operated a timber-selling business for the past five years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she has a garage which contributes to her other source of income. Medina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase timber for sale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber for sale

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou  L. is a 39-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business. She lives in Kanipaan, San Carlos City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 15,000 PHP. Marilou is borrowing 23,000 PHP so that she can continue to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 20,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marilou  aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.es: La Sra. Jeanette se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan desde hace un año, actualmente Jeanette es soltera pero colabora en su familia con los gastos del hogar y también con los gastos de estudios de sus hermanos, actualmente vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus padres, de la elaboración se ocupa el panadero a quien ella contrato   y de  la venta se ocupa ella personalmente ya que  antes ella elaboraba y no le alcanzaba el tiempo para la venta y ya tiene mucha clientela, solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para la elaboración de pan ya que continuamente se esta incrementando el precio de los insumos motivo por el cual desea almacenar dichos insumos y comprar en cantidad, es una joven muy trabajadora y esta profundamente agradecida por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Jeanette has worked in the production and selling of bread for a year. She is currently single but contributes to her family's household costs, and also to her siblings' education costs. She currently lives in her parents' home. The bread is baked by a baker whom she hires, and she personally attends to the sales. Previously she did the baking and did not have much time for selling. Now she has many customers. She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies for baking bread, as the prices are continually increasing. Thus, she wants to stock up on these items and buy in bulk. She is a very hard-working youth and is profoundly grateful for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of tools for making bread

loans.name: Mujeres De Pachawacan 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Eufemia Gumercinda I., de 26 años de edad, es una señora casada tiene dos hijos, una nena y niño, doña Eufemia trata de apoyar económicamente a su familia y prepararle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales, con esa actividad ella  ha podido  mantener,  a su familia, actividad que ha venido realizando desde hace más de 5 años, doña Eufemia se dio cuenta que necesitaba comprar  mas animales para poder mejorar las ventas, y tratar la manera de apoyar a su comunidad vendiéndoles huevos de la gallinas, y así de esa manera ella puede obtener un poco mas de ganancias, por lo cual ella reunió a algunas vecinas que conocía desde hace mas de  ocho años, para poder conformar un grupo ya que ella trata de apoyar no solo a su familia si no que también a las personas de su aldea, el cual cada una de las señoras  se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como: venta de frutas, crianza de animales, elaboración de camisolas y pantalonetas, pants blusas, venta de mercería, entre otros.
texts.en: Doña Eufemia Gumercinda I. is 26 years old, married and has two children, a girl and a boy.  She tries to support her family financially and provide a better future for her children.  She has been raising animals for a living for more than 5 years and has been able to support her family with this activity.  Doña Eufemia realized that she needed to buy more animals to improve her sales.  She also brings in a little more income selling eggs which also helps to support her community.  She met with some neighbors that she has known for more than eight years to invite them to form this group as she tries to support not only her family, but also her community.  All the women earn a living working at various different jobs such as fruit sales, raising animals, seamstress, merchandise sales, etc.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester is currently in a business of selling bread.  She is 25 years old, and married with 2 children. One goes to school. Ester asked for a loan to stock more bread to sell.  She hopes to pay the tuition for her children's school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Eduvijes

texts.en: Eduvijes is a 58-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a sari sari (general) store.  She lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her sari sari (general) store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  Eduvijes is borrowing PHP 24,000 to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Eduvijes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children living in his own house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in second-hand clothes for three years starting with a capital of 400,000 shillings and increasing to 3,000,000 shillings. His vision is owning a big boutique. Peter needs the loan to buy second-hand clothes.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Madame KHADY N. est une femme de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis le 01 mars 2002. Elle fait partie des membre du comité de gestion. Et elle garde une bonne image dans le Banc Villageois.

Elle fait de la couture. Elle achète des tissus et fait la confection sur mesure.

Ce crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité importante en tissus afin de constituer un bon stock pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

Son principal objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne en vue de réfectionner sa vieille maison
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady N. is a 53-year old woman. She is married and the mother of 10. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Thilmakha since March 1, 2002. She is a member of its Executive Committee, and enjoys a good reputation with the Banc Villageois. 

She is a seamstress. She purchases fabrics and sews made-to-measure outfits. This loan will allow her to purchase a big quality of fabrics in order to have a good stock and better meet her clients’ needs. Her main goal is to bolster her level of savings and eventually have her old house renovated.

loans.use: purchasing fabrics to make outfits for sale

loans.name: Lorenzo Leobardo

texts.es: El señor Lorenzo Leobardo se dedica a la compra de carros usados que ya no funcionan con el fin de obtener alguna ganancia, el trabajo que realiza  Leobardo es quitar pieza que sirve para venderla a otras personas a un bajo precio que necesitan una parte para su automóvil que esta descompuesto y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar una nueva. Por tal motivo Lorenzo recurre a esta institución para comprar un automóvil que le ofrecen para seguir con su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Mr. Lorenzo Leobardo buys used cars that no longer work in order to make an income. He removes the parts and sells them at a low price to those who need the parts for their broken-down cars and do not have enough money to buy a new one. Lorenzo has turned to this institution in order to buy a car, which will allow him to continue with his business and make a better income.

loans.use: to purchase a car to sell its parts

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice N. W. is a 33-year-old married woman with three children.  

She has grown cabbages for five years. With hard work on her farm, her business has grown.  

Apart from growing cabbages, she runs a boutique for extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business. 

She hopes to expand her farm together with her boutique for better income. She needs 40,000 KES to buy clothes for her boutique and improve her farm.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her boutique and improve her farm.

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a cultivar chile y maíz, también tiene ganado,  tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos de 9, 11, 18 y 20 años de edad, él desde pequeño se dedica a esta actividad.
Actualmente iniciara la siembra de chiles, para lo que planea comprar 2000 plantas, abono y tratamiento para plagas, para esto solicita un préstamo que le ayude a cubrir el gasto en el que incurrirá.
Su objetivo es mejorar económicamente con su familia, para hacerlo es necesario trabajar fuertemente.
texts.en:
Jose lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. He cultivates chili peppers and corn. He also has a herd of cattle. He is 40 years old and he lives with his wife and 4 children, aged, 9, 11, 18, and 20. He has been in this business since he was a boy.

He will start his chili plantation, planning on purchasing 2000 plants, fertilizers, and pesticides. He requests a loan to be able to cover the expenses that he will incur. 

His goal is to improve the family's economy and to achieve his goal it is necessary to work very hard.

loans.use: to purchase 2000 chili plants, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Florinda Fabiao

texts.pt:
Florinda Fabiao nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Provincia de Maputo,Sul de Moçambique, solteira estudou ate a 6ª classe não continuou com os estudos porque o seu marido naõ o deixou tem 4 filhos dos quais os 3 mais velhos vaõ a Escola. Vive na casa propria e naõ sustenta mais ninguem para alem de seus filhos. 

Saiu de Manhiça para Maputo com os seus pais quando estes foram transferidos pela empresa onde trabalhavam. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de cobertores ha mais de 10 anos, naõ possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 4.000.00mts por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria

Nunca  teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conhece a Hluvuku atraves de um colega que era cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.000mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção( cimento, areia, portas e e outros) para continuar com o melhoramento da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt e todos para o negocio.  

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para acedera outros créditos no futuro.
Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para concluir a sua casa e construir um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Florinda Fabiao was born in the district of Manhica in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is single and studied through sixth grade.  She didn’t continue with school because her husband didn’t let her.  She has 4 children, and 3 of them go to school.  She lives in her own home and doesn’t support anyone financially besides her children.  She left Manhica for Maputo with her parents when they were transferred by the company for which they worked.  She has had her own business selling blankets for more than 10 years.  She doesn’t have any employees, and she makes a monthly income of 4,000 meticals, which she puts towards her household’s expenses and also saves some in her bank account.

She has never had a loan with another bank, and she became familiar with Hluvuku through a colleague who was a client of the institution.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 26,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, doors, etc.) to continue making improvements to her home.  Her previous loans were in the amounts of 5,000, 10,000, and 20,000 meticals and were used for her business.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can receive more loans in the future.  She plans to request more loans to finish her home and to construct a commercial location for her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina tiene  31 años de edad y vive en una casa de propiedad de su hermana vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio Morros Blancos de la ciudad de Tarija. Martina es madre soltera de tres hijos, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Martina se dedica desde hace mas de 4 años a trabajar como envasadora de medicamentos naturales productos que los venden a nivel nacional. Medicamentos que son muy consumidos por las personas que conocen el producto. Siendo muy conocida por sus clientes que le solicitan los medicamentos por ser estos preparados de forma natural,  Martina quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con sus hijos, pero ella nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar estos medicamentos para poder revenderlos. Ya que tiene un pedido de medicamentos para varias personas, 

Martina tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, ella solicito el crédito para abastecerse de sus productos, y poder cumplir con la gran demanda que tiene de este modo incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Martina nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Señora Martina is 31 years old and lives in her sister's house in the Morros Blancos neighborhood in the city of Tarija.   Because of life circumstances she is a single mother with three children and has to work to provide for her children.  For the past 4 years Martina has been packaging natural medicine products that are sold nationally.  These medicines are in high demand among the people that know the product because they are naturally prepared.  Martina wants to increase her income to get her family ahead.  She has to purchase the medicines first before she can sell them.   She has an order for several people.  Martina has a lot of experience in this job. 

Martina is requesting a loan to stock her products so she can meet the high demand, and thereby, increase her income.  She tells us that she wants to improve her living conditions and that the next loan that she requests will be used to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: purchase natural medicines to stock her business.

loans.name: Neh

texts.en:
Net, 32 years old, is a broom seller. His mother-in-law is also a broom seller and stays with his family. His wife is working in the factory, and their income is $8 per day. They have three children. Two are studying and one is too small to be in school. 

Every month, he has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $20 on transportation and $15 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike to use in his broom selling business. He wants to extend his business to make more income. And he also wants all of his children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his broom selling business.

loans.name: Suiumkan

texts.en:
Suiumkan, age 55, is a resident of Tup a small nice village in Isykul region.  Unfortunately Suiumkan is a widow.  She has raised three daughters and a son.  The older son and the first daughter are married and live separately with their families; the other two daughters study at the university. 

Sixteen years ago, Suiumkan, with an initial investment of 1,000 soms started to sell foodstuffs at the market.  At the moment she owns a butcher shop. With money received from the loan Suiumkan wants to purchase seven sheep for breeding and fattening.  In the future, with the profits gained from her business she wishes to build a big house for the children.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov is a security guard. His wife stays at home. A granddaughter also stays with his family. His income is $5 per day. Every month, he has to spend around $70 on family expenses. He would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. When he gets a motorbike it will help him to not be late for work as he will be able to travel to work by himself. In the future he expects to get a souvenir shop for his wife to help earn money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for traveling to work

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 46 years of age and a farmer in Cagayan province. He does farming to provide a good life for his beloved family. His wife also helps him supply their everyday needs by raising hogs. Together, they help each other to grant the requirements of their children in school. Leonardo and his wife want their children to complete their studies someday. He works hard to keep them in school. 

He goes in the field everyday to maintain his crop to grow well so he can get a better yield. However, typhoons and drought are not controlled so he only gets a small harvest during the occurrences of these calamities. He is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticide to maintain his crop growth. This produces a higher net income for the coming harvesting season. He aims to expand his venture so he works harder to achieve his set goal.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Mikpamahu Tegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIKPAMAHU TEGBE est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la première fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Huguette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Huguette est âgée de 35 ans et vit au  Bénin. Huguette est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Daniel. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Huguette mène comme activité depuis trois ans la vente de produits cosmétiques. Huguette s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Huguettee sollicite  ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe  MIKPAMAHU TEGBE, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group MIKPAMAHU TEGBE is composed of three persons who live in the same house. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating their level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Huguette, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to an entrepreneur by the name of Daniel, and they have four children, who are all in school and in their care. 

To support herself and her children, Huguette has been running a cosmetics business for three years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets of Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she and the other members of the group MIKPAMAHU TEGBE are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Merily

texts.en: Merily works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Merily requested a loan of PHP 12,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Merily has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Duo Seguidoras Del Exito Group

texts.es: Para  estas dos hermanas  integrantes de este dúo, quienes  se dedican a la  crianza de gallinas ponedoras y venta de huevos la líder doña  Ana María se  dedica desde hace 20 años a este negocio que aprendió de sus padres desde pequeña , en su domicilio es donde tiene en gran cantidad de estas gallinas ponedoras,y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas gallinas ponedoras para seguir con su venta al igual que su hermana Miriam Elizabeth es quien distribuye los huevos, la ilusión de las dos es  ahora de  criar  pollos de engorde y luego venderlas en pie o destazado, ya que cuentan con la experiencia y  equipo para realizarlo, y asi lograr sus propósitos como pequeñas empresarias.
texts.en: Two sisters  make up this partnerhip. They work breeding laying hens and selling eggs. For 20 years the leader, Ana María, has been running this business, which she learned from her parents when she was little. She has a great number of laying hens on her property. She is asking for this loan to buy more hens to continue her sales. Her sister Miriam Elizabeth is the one who delivers the eggs. Their dream is to now raise broiler chickens and later sell them or butcher them. They have the experience and the equipment to do it and achieve their goals as small business-women.

loans.use: to buying laying hens

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jeny; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de costurera, ella cose pantalones, blusas y ternos, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y los trabajos los hace a pedidos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de costurera, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de costurera. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como telas, botones, agujas, tijeras y plancha.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Jeny, 24, is a member of the “Kanchary” communal bank that’s located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  She has a spouse and a son.  She alternates her daily activities with a sewing shop.  She makes pants, blouses and dresses.  She works from 8am until 7pm.  Her work is done to order.  She wants to expand and improve her sewing shop and is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric, buttons, needles, scissors and an iron.  She is happy for the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, needles, scissors and an iron.

loans.name: C 7904 Duteraninkunga Group

texts.en:
Evariste is 41 years old with five children aged between 13 and 17 years. He owns an agriculture business. His business is open from 6 am until 12:30 pm every day--he has 24 years of experience. Evariste is the leader of the group which is called "DUTERANINKUNGA" in the local language. In the photo, he has raised his hand. 

Evariste and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fertilizer for their field. They hope to grow their rice business. With any profits, he and his team expect to save money for their future and to pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to cultivate more rice to sell.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly and her husband, Phat, live in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1992 and have two sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker, another is learning sewing machine repairing skills and another stays at home.

Somaly and her husband are vegetable farmers. They used to sell firewood, but they quit the business. Somaly is asking for a loan of $500 to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. She will also use a part of the loan to pay school fees for her son, who is learning sewing machine repairing skills.

Photo: Somaly is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and pay school fees for her son who is learning sewing machine repairing skills.

loans.name: Juan Gilberto

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su familia, es padre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad, ellos viven en una casa pastoral, él se dedica a la venta de pescado, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 2 años, trabajando de lunes a viernes de 6:00am a 12:00md, surgió la idea del negocio como un medio para obtener ingresos.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pescado fresco, curvina, guapotes, sardina, boca colorada, además comprara verduras como papas, güisquiles, zanahorias, tomates, cebollas; la compra le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ofreciendo productos frescos a la clientela en verduras y pescado.
Su aspiración es convertirse en un microempresario, con mucha clientela y con experiencia en el comercio.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his family, and is the father of four children, all minors. They live in a simple home.  He sells fish, and has been in this business for two years, working Monday to Friday from 6:00am to noon. The idea for the business came about as a means of earning income. 

He is applying for a loan to buy fresh fish, such as sea bass, guapote, sardines, and snapper.  In addition, he will buy vegetables such as potatoes, güisquiles (pear squash), carrots, tomatoes, and onions. This purchase will help him improve his business, offering fresh fish and vegetables to his customers.  

His ambition is to become a small entrepreneur; with many customers and with experience as a business owner.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, such as sea bass, guapote, sardines, and snapper.

loans.name: José Israel

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 27 años de edad, es acompañado con dos hijos.

Él desde pequeño ha trabajado en la agricultura y actualmente es empleado de una empresa en donde realiza  reparación de carreteras, también realiza actividades agrícolas de la cual se beneficia.

Sale de su casa a las 4:00 a.m. para su trabajo y ahí pasa todo el día, el día libre lo dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas, ya que es un hombre que lucha por su vida y la de su familia.

José es un hombre emprendedor y hoy desea instalar una tienda en su casa, por eso el préstamo que solicita es para comprar productos como fríjol, azúcar, arroz, jabón, entre otros más y para comprar dos silos(deposito para guardar granos básicos) para almacenar la producción de maíz.

Con la inversión él tendrá seguro su maíz, para poderlo vender en otro momento en que el precio sea mejor. Con la instalación de la tienda dispondrá de otra fuente de ingresos, para su familia y su esposa se encargara de tratar con los clientes, mientras él realiza las otras actividades. Así José espera proporcionarle todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. José is 27 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children.  He began working in agriculture from a very early age and now he is employed at a company that repairs roads.  He also carries out agricultural activities for an income.

He leaves for work at 4:00 a.m. and stays there all day.  On his free days he works in agriculture as a way of helping his family get ahead.

José is an entrepreneur who wants to set up a store in his house.  He is requesting a loan to buy products such as beans, sugar, rice, soap, etc. and to buy two silos (to keep basic grains) where he will store corn.

With the investment he will insure his corn and be able to sell it at the right time to get the best price.  The store will add extra income for his family.  His wife will attend to customers while he is involved in other activities.  José hopes that through this he will be able to give his family all they need.

loans.use: To buy products such as beans, sugar, rice, soap, etc. and to buy two silos.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells slippers, bananas and plantains at Besease near Elmina. She has been selling these items for seven years. Abena is married to a farmer and has five dependents. Abena uses her income to help her husband provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more slippers to sell. With the profit, Abena plans to acquire a shop in which to sell her slippers

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell.

loans.name: María Livia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy hábil con sus manos y el arte de la joyería tiene vida propia, la gastronomía variada cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 13, 9, 7, 2 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y dos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la manufactura y elabora ropa deportiva, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña María al igual que su esposo trabaja en la confección de ropa deportiva, actividad en la que se encuentran hace 10 años, como es negocio propio trabajan de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima como telas, hilos, botones, cierres, etc. para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un taller grande con varios operarios
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Despertad” (Awaken) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that since 1999 has been a cultural heritage of humanity.  Its people are very skilled with their hands and the art of jewelry making has a life of its own; cuisine is varied and enchants the palates of visitors.  Its residents maintain the culture and traditions of its peoples.

María is 30 years old living in a common law relationship and has had five children who are 13, 9, 7, 2 and 1 years of age.  Her oldest son is in secondary school and two of them go to the local elementary school.  Her husband manufactures sportswear.  They do not own a house, they are renters.

María, like her husband, makes sportswear, an activity they’ve been doing for ten years.  Since it’s their own business they work Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.

This is the third loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she will use it to buy raw materials like fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc. to continue with her business.  Her goal is to have a large workshop with several employees.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Irma Amada

texts.es:
La señora Irma esta solicitando un crédito con nosotros ya que a su casa le hace falta la barda de material, ya que ahorita cuentan con una cerca de madera; por lo cual esta solicitando este crédito para comprar el material.
      La señora irma trabaja en un en un centro comercial y su esposo es velador, ellos tienen 3 hijos por los cuales se esfuerzan por hacer bien su trabajo para poder brindarles lo mejor posible. Estan solicitando el credito para la construccion de una barda por temas de seguridad ya que como tiene hijos pequeños y no se siente comoda al dejarlos solos en casta al irse a trabajar.
texts.en:
Irma is asking for a loan from us because her house needs a solid wall, as they currently have a wooden fence.  As such, she is asking for this loan to buy materials.

Irma works in a mall and her husband is security guard.  They have three children for whom they work hard at their jobs to be able to give them the best they can.  She is asking for this loan to build a wall for security reasons since she doesn't feel comfortable leaving her small children home alone when she goes to work.

loans.use: to build a wall around her house

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 44 years old and has 2 children. She is married and has 1 child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leyla Pamela

texts.es: Leyla , es un señorita de  23 años de edad, es soltera, la cliente trabaja en una empresa de distribuidora de carga pesada, donde la empresa queda a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente  vive por la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 7  1/2 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive es de sus padres, ella vive con sus padres y sus hermanos y el destino del crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercadería, (capital de operación), ya que quiere realizar un negocio donde tendrá más ingresos y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su familia, ya que en este momento su trabajo no le genera un buen ingreso. Este crédito le ayudará bastante y ella está muy contenta de poder acceder a esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Leyla is a 23-year-old, single young woman. She works in a heavy load distributing company, located 10km away from the city of Cochabamba. Currently, Leyla is living in the southern part of Cochabamba, approximately 7 1/2 km from the heart of the city. She lives in her parents' house along with her siblings.

Leyla is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise (operating capital). She wants to increase her earnings and, in some way, help to meet her family's needs. Since her earnings at the moment are lacking, this loan will be extremely helpful as she improves her business. She is very happy to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a forty-eight-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

His main business is cattle rearing and selling, alongside working on building contracts where he earns an extra living. He started this business to look after his family and educate his children. 

He has a hardship of seasonality changes, especially drought, whereby animals lack grass and water. However, his vision is to have a model cattle farm in Kamwenge. 

Charles intends to use the loan to buy more cattle for rearing and selling.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Fumi

texts.en: Mrs. Fumi E. is a young dynamic woman of 32 years old of age; she is married with six (6) children, lives in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria started in business in the year 1985. She hopes to get the above amount to enable her improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase of more gallons of oil for sale

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Madame L. sells cooked rice and stew in her locality. She wants to prepare more food for sale.

She is seeking a loan of $700.00 from Kiva to enable her to do so.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Pastor

texts.en:
Pastor lives in his parent's home on 5th of August Street in the Tembladerani neighborhood in La Paz. He is 36 years old and is separated from his wife. He has been caring for his children for two years. He travels to Desaguadero to buy items like plastic washtubs and laundry baskets to resell. Depending on the season, he also sells pots and pans and electric appliances at economic prices. He is asking for this loan to increase his capital and be able to expand his inventory and increase his income. He has not borrowed from IMPRO before, but his profits are good and he should be able to repay without problems.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Pastor vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 5 de agosto de la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz; tiene 36 años de edad, esta separado de la esposa y mantiene a sus dos hijos desde hace dos años. El es comerciante minorista y realiza viajes a Desaguadero, lugar donde se provee de productos de plásticos como ser bañadores, cestos de ropa, bañeras etc. Además de estos productos también vende ollas, artefactos eléctricos, según la temporada, a precios que sean mas económicos y es mas accesibles al consumidor. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y traer mayor cantidad de mercadería y mejorar sus ingresos. No tiene antecedente con Impro, es cliente nuevo, pero su rendimiento es bueno y eso lo califica para obtener un crédito y poder pagarlo sin problemas.

loans.use: To buy washbasins, pots and pans and other housewares.

loans.name: Víctor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor Hugo is 24, single without children, lives with his parents and is one of 9 children in the family. He started working at an early age. When he was only ten years old he sold natural herb remedies in the street and then started working as a salesman in a shop. And so as a natural businessman he started to save some money to start his own business.

With the limited but valuable money that he was able to save through much sacrifice, he took the first step and bought his first goods to sell. He was then able to become independent by renting a stall in the local market, almost right next to where he used to work, where he now sells embroidered bedspreads, blankets, local clothing and hammocks.

His business started to be profitable and he knew how to advantage of his success. He expanded his store and started to take out loans that he paid back on time.

Having passed a critical stage in his business and realizing that his business could not continue to grow where it was, he decided to close his store to look for new opportunities in order to increase his market. He then began a style of business that is well known in his area, called ‘macate’ (traveling sales on credit from house to house) selling the same products that he sold in his previous business. He started to travel to other richer cities and was able to build a larger clientele so that his business now expands more every day.

Thanks to his efforts he has already bought a motorcycle that he uses as a key element in his work. Víctor hopes to obtain a new loan with which he will buy more wholesale cotton thread in different colors to make bedspreads. He will then give this thread to his family and other people who he will pay to make bedspreads, starting a chain reaction of development in his family and his neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor Hugo; tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y sin hijos, vive con sus padres y es uno de los 9 hijos de esta familia. Desde muy temprano se inició en la vida laboral, ya que a los diez años ya vendía remedios yuyos (hierbas naturales) por las calles y luego entró a trabajar en una mercería como vendedor; y así con su espíritu innato de emprendedor empezó a ahorrar un poco de dinero para poder iniciar su propio negocio.

Con el poco pero muy valioso dinero que con tanto sacrificio había juntado, dio el primer paso, compró con eso las primeras mercaderías con las que logro independizarse alquilando un puesto de venta en el mercado municipal prácticamente al lado de donde estuvo trabajando, vendiendo allí todo tipo de colchas de hilo bordado, frazadas, ropas típicas y hamacas.

Comenzó a dar frutos su emprendimiento, Y lo supo aprovechar, creció su negocio y se animó a tomar sus primeros créditos que los cumplió con pagos excelentes.

Habiendo pasado una etapa crítica y dándose cuenta que en el mismo local ya no era posible seguir creciendo, decidió cerrar su negocio para buscar nuevos horizontes y así ampliar su mercado, llegando a adoptar un estilo de negocio muy conocido en la zona que es el macate (venta ambulante y a crédito casa por casa), vendiendo los mismos productos que vendía en su negocio anterior. Empezó a viajar por otras ciudades con grandes bolsones llenos de mercaderías llegando a conquistar una excelente clientela que hoy día hace que el negocio progrese cada día más.

Gracias a su esfuerzo ya compró una motocicleta que la utiliza como una herramienta importante de trabajo. Víctor desea solicitar un nuevo crédito con el que desea comprar hilos de algodón de diferentes colores y al por mayor para la fabricación de colchas, estos materiales él los entregará a su familia y a otras personas a quienes él paga por la confección de sus colchas creando toda una cadena de desarrollo en su familia y en su barrio.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale cotton thread in different colors

loans.name: Kung Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Kung Sam O., 36, and her husband run a small business which recharges vehicles batteries. They earn approximately $10 a day from this. The couple has 6 children - 3 of whom are married, one is a garment worker and the others are students. They would like to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to assist in transporting the batteries from their clients' homes to the business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to assist in transporting their goods

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Hoàng Thị Nhiên is 42 years old. She lives in the village of Hưng Trung, Hưng Nguyên district. She became a member of TYM fund in September 2002. Her first loan was 75 USD and she invested in livestock. After 2 years, with her savings and another round of loan, she opened a general store selling all kind of goods: cookies, candies, shoes, beer, alcohol ...etc. Her money was well invested: the revenue from her store is 150 USD / month. She's requesting a new loan of 950 USD to buy more goods for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Nhiên, 42 tuổi, hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 5 con tại xã Hưng Trung, huyện Hưng Nguyên. Chị tham gia vào quỹ từ tháng 9 năm 2002 với mức vay đầu tiên là 75 USD chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Với kết quả khả quan thu nhập từ chăn nuôi, vốn vay từ năm thứ 3 chị đã đầu tư vào mở cửa hàng buôn bán các mặt hàng hóa bánh kẹo bia rượu, giày dép .v.v... chị đã sử dụng đồng vốn rất có hiệu quả với mức thu nhập 150 USD/tháng dự định chị sẽ xin vay 950 USD để mở rộng các mặt hàng kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy goods for her general store

loans.name: Aan

texts.en: Aan is 40 years old and has a 12 year old child. She sells vegetables using her  motorcycle for transportation. She can earn US$10 per day. In the  evenings, her husband A. earns more money transporting people on his motorcycle and usually earns US$2 per day. She needs a loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shamsieva

texts.en:
Shamsieva G. lives in Nausky rayon; she is married and has 5 children.  She has been an active client of MicroiInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as an executive and reliable client who trusts the MicroiInvest loan procedures.

She trades in the bazaar where her trade outlet is located.  She is engaged in the special material for the national dress selling industry.  She is very experienced in this business (about 13 years).  She works with a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.  

Working in the bazaar she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It permits her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Now Mrs. Shamsieva requests a loan of $925 to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business.

loans.use: to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business.

loans.name: Basheeran's Group

texts.en:
Chichawatni is my birth town and I have spent all my life here. It is a small town in Southern Punjab, a large province in Pakistan. I am married with five kids. One of my son operates a leather store and is in need of a loan.

I am borrowing for the second time in my loan group. My group members are: Imtiaz B., who wants a loan for their family’s rickshaw; Munira B. who requires a loan for their chicken butcher's shop; Nosheen B. who is also borrowing for her business; and Nasira B. who sells flowers.

loans.use: Expand our current business

loans.name: Xtan's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Xtan K.. She is currently in the business of vegetables selling and is requesting a loan to expand the existing business. Xtan is 60 years old and is a widow. She has 3 children ranging from age 25 to 30 who are living in separate households. Each week, Xtan makes approximately 210 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to rebuild her house.

Xtan is joined in her small group by Rose S., Lucia T., Anurina K., and Mary J.. Rose S. has a business in home-based brewery and wants to improve the production process. Lucia T. is currently working in a brewery and wants a loan to start a new brewery in her house. Anurina K. operates a grocery and wants to construct a shop. Mary J. is currently in the business of making cakes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand vegetable business

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Mr. Vidal Caceres is the father of two children, one of whom starts grade school this year. Vidal used to live with relatives, but since his business has gone so well, he is now building his own home.

Vidal is a long-time businessman in our city. He sells articles of clothing, and also sews and sells aprons to butcher shops, meat lockers and supermarkets. Vidal personally delivers the merchandise by motorcycle within the Misiones area; he sometimes travels by bus to deliver large orders. Vidal says that he requests loans exclusively from our institution.

He is asking our institution for this loan so that he can purchase fabric, due to the high demand for his aprons from meat lockers and supermarkets.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Vidal C. padre de 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos empieza este año sus estudios primarios. Años anteriores el Sr. Vidal vivía en la casa de unos familiares y debido al buen resultado obtenido en su negocio esta pudiendo edificar para su propia vivienda.

Vidal es un comerciante antiguo de nuestra ciudad, se dedica a la venta de artículos de ropería como así también a la confección y venta de delantales para carnicerías, frigoríficos y supermercados. La venta de sus mercaderías lo realiza el mismo cliente en su moto dentro del Dpto. De Misiones o en ocasiones viaja en bus cuando realiza la entrega de sus pedidos grandes, Vidal cuenta que opera únicamente con nuestra institución para la solicitud de créditos.

Solicita este préstamo en nuestra institución para compra de telas debido a la gran demanda de delantales que posee de frigoríficos y supermercados.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Tuo's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Tuo is 30 years old and is a married woman with a 5-year-old child. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 15 and 17 years old. Tuo makes and sells batik. She started in 1999. Every day, she works from 7am to 5.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Bernadetha, Tabia, and Happyness, who sell batik, clothes, and food.

loans.use: To buy more clothes item for her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 44years and a mother of three children. Her children are currently in school. She sells jewels, lace cloths and other cloths in the local market.

Agnes wants to use this loan to buy more jewels as the demand for jewels from women is very high. She hopes this loan will help her to save for her children’s education. She is a member of the group called Vineyard. Members in the group agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and lace cloths.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai Y., 24 and the mother of a preschool aged child, lives in Doek Peang Village in Kampong Speu Province, selling grocery goods and breeding pigs. Her husband, Mr. Meng Bun, works in a rice mill where he can make only a small income to support his family. Despite her business activities, Mrs. Mai Y. still does not have enough money to purchase more grocery products for her customers, so she is requesting a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Mai Y. obtained a loan to start her pig-breeding business. Mrs. Mai Y. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her customers.

loans.name: Hadija's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 25 years old, married, and has a child. She earns income selling charcoal. She works every day, making a monthly profit of about US$90.

Hadija now hopes to receive a loan to buy more charcoal for sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Kibibi, Mwanahamis and Hidaya.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal to increase inventory

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
This is the second time that Mrs. Vann C. has asked for a loan to improve her business activity. She is a rice wine maker who uses rice to make wine in Preak Tanop Village in Kandal Province. Previously, Mrs. Vann C. obtained a loan of US$ 150 to buy rice to start her business. She has fully paid it back.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Vann C. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to make rice wine. She is a 28-year-old widow without any children. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. The place which Mrs. Vann C. makes rice wine is in the picture.

loans.use: to buy more rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Bisera

texts.en:
Bisera K. lives in Gračanica, one very entrepreneurial town. She was born in 1957 and has been employed her whole life. She has also always had her little business at home. Bisera is married and lives together with her husband and two grown-up sons. Her sons are not employed, so Bisera and her husband are compelled to provide for them.

Bisera makes cakes at home. She has constant clients and receives more orders during the holidays. She wants to be prepared for increased orders by buying reserve materials and some new dishes. She is requesting her first loan from Women for Women International for 500 KM. She hopes to make a much better presentation of her products and increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy materials and dishes for to make cakes.

loans.name: Hati's Group

texts.en:
Hati A. has been selling charcoal in Zanzibar for four years. Currently able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $120, Hati is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy more charcoal and expand her business. She will use her increase in profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Hati is 34 years old, married, and has two children, aged 12 and 14. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya and Mwatum.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Cette dame est depuis des années dans le commerce des tissus. Elle habite le grand quartier de Néma . Cette brave dame mariée et mére de 4 enfants soutient son époux avec les revenus tirés de son commerce. Elle demande ce crédit pour augmenter ses revenus en renforçant son stock.
texts.en:
Mrs. Awa Ndiayen has been in the fabric business for many years. She lives in the large district of Nema. This enterprising woman is married and has four children. She supports her husband with income earned from her business. Awa is requesting this loan to increase her stock and revenues.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
According to Violeta, the name of their village, Minallo Naguillan, was derived from the Ilocano term “Minalo” (meaning hit by a hard object). Their village is an agricultural area where rice and yellow corn are the major crops of the villagers. She is married to Leny, a carpenter, and they have a four year old son named Mark Justine.

Violeta is engaged in the food vending business, and she sells barbecued pork to her villagers. Her income is too small to support the needs of her family that is why she is planning to venture into a backyard piggery business for extra income.
