She is requesting a loan that will be used to buy two piglets for her backyard piggery. Part of the loan will also be used in her food vending business.

“I always believe that time is valuable.  I grab every opportunity that knocks and take all the risk just to have an income not just for our daily living but also to prepare for the future needs of my family and for my son,” says Violeta.

Violeta also dreams of having her own stall in the public market for her food vending business to provide a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her backyard piggery and buy meat for her food business

loans.name: Mrs. Phary Uy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-one people in AnL. Romeit Lech village in Kandal province form this village bank, and Mrs. Phary U. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She is a 66-year-old widow with a child who gets sick frequently; unfortunately, Mrs. Phary U. does not have enough money to cure her child. Thus, Mrs. Phary U. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and she hopes her child can be well soon.

Two members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to cure her sick child

loans.name: Valerie Alida

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
D. Valerie Alida s’est mariée avec BOSSOU Nicolas. Ils ont 3 enfants :  Audrey, Franky et Chilsain. Deux sont scolarisés et un n’a pas encore l’ âge d’aller à l’école. Depuis 20 ans il vend les chaussures et le charbon de bois. Les revenus de ses autres crédits lui ont permis d’aider dans les charges du foyer. Dans le futur elle voudrait ajouter la vente de plastiques à ses activités.
texts.en:
Valerie Alida D. is married to Nicolas Bossou. They have 3 children: Audrey, Franky, et Chilsain. Two are enrolled in school and the third is still too young to go to school. For 20 years, she has been selling shoes and charcoal. The profit from her previous loans has allowed her to help support her family. In future, she would like to add plastics sales to her business. The loan that she is requesting is through Kiva field partner, Alidé.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El señor Félix Rubén M. habita en el Kilómetro 10 ½  Carretera a Masaya junto a su esposa e hijos, la esposa trabaja como conserje en el colegio San Antonio Sur  para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, el Sr. Felix M. desde hace quince años es docente del mismo colegio imparte clases a niños de primaria  por las mañanas y por las tardes es profesor de educación física del mismo. El esta contento ya que tiene cuatro ciclos trabajando con Afodenic y ha logrado darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia, poco a poco con el financiamiento ha logrado hacer parte de la vivienda y con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción  para hacer división de cuartos. Y poder tener más privacidad. a futuro espera seguir aumentado su casa.
texts.en:
Mr Felix M. Ruben lives at Kilometer 10 ½ on the highway to Masaya together with his wife and children; his wife works as a janitor at the school San Antonio Sur. To support the household expenses, for the last 15 years Mr. Felix M. has taught at the same school teaching classes to children in primary school in the mornings and in the afternoons he teaches physical education. He is happy because he has had four cycles working with Afodenic and has managed to give a better life to his family, little by little with the financing he has been able to make part of the house and with this credit he will buy building materials to make a room divider and to have more privacy. In the future he expects to further enhance his home.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to make a room divider

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan S., 39, is married with five children and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She sells vegetables and grocery items and is able to make US$15 in revenue every day. Her husband stays at home and helps his wife sell groceries. Four of the children are in school. Tan S. is asking for a loan to diversify her grocery items and build a bathroom for her family.

loans.use: To diversify grocery products and build a bathroom.

loans.name: Wais

texts.en: Wais M. is an experienced farmer and the son of Faqir M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has seven children. He is a hardworking man and always tries his best to better support his family members. He would like to move his business forward and needs to purchase seeds and tools. Thus, he is requesting an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months. He is glad that there is a useful partnership with Kiva in Afghanistan for the support of the poor.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling candy

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 34 años, es una persona muy alegre, junto a sus tres hijos y su pareja tratan de progresar y conseguir pronto una casa propia, mientras tanto, seguirán en la casa de sus padres con quienes vive. Desde hace más de 3 años se desempeña como contadora para una empresa, pero su horario de trabajo le está quitando la oportunidad de compartir momentos con sus seres queridos, y a pesar del beneficio de su remuneración, Martha trata de incrementar sus ahorros para invertirlos en la compra de un puesto donde pueda dedicarse a la venda ropa, por lo que está a la espera de realizarlo pronto, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja. Sin embargo, a pesar de no tener un local, ya está empezando a recibir algunos pedidos de prendas por parte de sus compañeras de trabajo, y Martha está segura que al iniciar de esta forma su negocio, podrá lograr poco a poco lograr su objetivo. Ella es una de las fundadoras de su grupo, y recuerda sus primeros créditos como la oportunidad de salir adelante, y a pesar de haber salido por gran tiempo del grupo, hoy sus compañeras le abren nuevamente las puertas de su banco comunal porque es una mujer responsable. Con el crédito de 2000 soles comprará los pedidos  que le han hecho, y así iniciar su negocio con el pie derecho.
texts.en:
Martha is a very happy 34-year-old woman. Alongside her partner and three children, she tries to progress and would like to have her own home very soon. In the meantime, they will continue to live in her parent’s house. She has been working as an accountant for a firm for more than 3 years, but her work schedule is taking her away from her loved ones. Even though she benefits from a salary, Martha will try to increase her savings by investing in the purchase of a stand where she can sell clothing. She is close to doing this because of her partner’s support. However, even though she doesn’t have a place to sell from, she’s already beginning to receive requests for items of clothing from her colleagues at work. Martha is certain that by starting her business in this way, she will be able to reach her goal bit by bit. She is one of the founders of this group and remembers how her first loans were an opportunity for her to get ahead. In spite of having left the group for some time, today her friends are opening the doors of their communal bank to her because she is a responsible woman. She will purchase the clothing that has been ordered with this loan of 2000 soles and in this way begin her business on the right foot.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru: Орифа женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест с 20020года. Она использует каждый свой кредит на увеличение товарооборота. За период кредитования она расширила свой ларёк, т.к. ассортимент с каждым займом становится разнообразным. Она следующий кредит хочет получить для завоза несколько разновидностей кипятильников и электроприборов. Орифа одна из честных и добросовестных клиентов Фонда.
texts.en:
Orifa has been a borrower at MicroInvest since 2002. She uses each one of her loans to increase her goods turnover. Over time, with each loan, she was able to expand her store by adding variety to her merchandise selection. Orifa wants to obtain her next loan in order to bring in several types of electric appliances. Orifa is one of our honest and sincere clients.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is fifty years old, is married, and has given birth to nine children: three sons and six daughters. All are still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer.

Adwoa is a food vendor and has been in business for three years. She prepares and sells rice and stew, selling on a table by the roadside in the mornings. She buys her goods from Kumasi and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Nab

texts.en: Nab L. is a modest widowed woman of 53 years. She was married, but her husband died of senility years ago and she now has two children (one daughter and one son). Her daughter is married and lives separately, while her son is still single and works driving a motor taxi. Nab L. presently sells various fish in the market to earn a living. She is managing her investment very well and has attracted many regular clients because she is skilled at communicating with people. Nab L. is taking out this Kiva loan to help replace her son’s unattractive motor taxi and to buy additional fresh fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motor taxi & buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 47 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, ya que siente que el progreso de su familia es su responsabilidad como cabeza del hogar, por lo cual ha tratado de brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su bienestar. Desde joven se especializó en la reparación de electrodomésticos, posteriormente adquirió experiencia trabajando en diversos talleres, hasta que consiguió implementar su propio taller de reparaciones. Víctor tiene su pequeño local en una zona céntrica de su localidad, donde atiende desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sin embargo, los 20 años que lleva  trabajando en la zona le permitieron ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, debido a su capacidad y profesionalismo, además de su gran sentido del humor. Ahora se está proyectando para alquilar un local más amplio, pero para ello tiene que incrementar sus ingresos, ya que los pagos de alquiler serán mayores. A través de su banco comunal ha trabajado 10 préstamos con Microfinanzas PRISMA, donde junto a sus compañeros han sabido desarrollar y potenciar sus capacidades, pues realizan actividades a favor del progreso de su grupo. Los 2500 soles que solicita le permitirán adquirir algunas herramientas que requiere para agilizar las reparaciones de los equipos que le llevan diariamente a su local.
texts.en:
Victor, 47, is a very hard working man. He feels that the progress of his family is his responsibility as head of the household. Therefore, he has tried to give his family the necessary living conditions for their well being. Since he was a young man he has specialized in repairing domestic electric appliances. He previously gained experience working in various shops until he was able to set up his own repair shop. Victor has his small shop in a central area of his region. He works from nine in the morning until eight at night. His 20 years of working in the area have allowed him to win his customers’ confidence due to his professional capacity and his great sense of humor. He is now planning to rent a larger place, but he will have to increase his income because the rent will be more. Through his community bank he has had ten loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA. Together with his colleagues they have know how to develop and improve their capabilities. They engage in activities that help the group progress. The 2,500 PEN that he is asking for is to buy some tools that he needs to speed up the repairs on the appliances that are brought to his shop every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Csac Group

texts.en:
These are board members of Comfort, Support and Care (CSAC), a community- based organization. These board members came to SMT/Kiva to seek a loan of Le 7,000,000 after several unsuccessful attempts from other NGOs within and outside of Makeni town. They have planted a rice farm of 120 acres of land in a village called Rulakoh, about seven miles from Makeni, but are currently in need of labor to help them in the weeding, bird scareing and harvesting. Thus with the Le 7,000,000.00, they will be able to achieve this. 

CSAC is a community based organization registered in 2004 to help ensure the well being of the disabled and their children in the Bombali district. The organization has a membership of 1000 disabled drawn from four different categories of the disabled: leprosy victims, polio victims, amputees and the blind. CSAC carries out agricultural activities and provides free schooling for the children of the disabled.

Alimany Edward K. is the founder of this organization. He has lived in New York for over twenty-four years but had never seen the disabled begging for a living. But back home in Sierra Leone, the disabled, together with their children, go out begging for a living. This was appalling to Alimany, especially so for the children who were not handicapped. Without any form of empowerment for these children, their plight will be miserable in the future once their parents have passed away – begging will no longer help them since they are not in any way handicapped. Thus Alimany K. decided to form this organization to help the handicapped by engaging them in agriculture and setting up of a school for their children. 

So far, CSAC has been able to give education to over 200 children of the disabled. They also give medical and feeding assistance to the most vulnerable of the disabled. However, their two main challenges are 1) labor vacuum – because of their disabilities, they can not work efficiently on the farm and 2) inadequate funds to ensure proper implementation of their programs. However, with this loan, SMT/Kiva will salvage the issue of labor vacuum.

James S. K. (left), a non-disabled himself, is currently acting as Director of the Organization. He was born in Makeni forty-nine years ago. He is married with two children.

loans.use: Pay labor for weeding, bird scareing and harvesting

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.en:
Nemesio S. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 51 years old. Nemesio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nemesio owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcab services to local community members. Nemesio has been engaged in his business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Nemesio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemesio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5200 PHP from GDMPC. Nemesio is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nemesio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Virgen Del Socavon Group

texts.es: El grupo “Virgen del Socavón”  esta representado por la señora Maria Elena y conformada por 12 miembros que van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando ganas D. trabajar y responsabilidad en sus pagos. La mayoría D. las socias se dedica a  la venta D. comida, refrescos, elaboración D. helados y a la venta D. lácteos, en cuanto a la competencia que tienen en el mercado una mayoría tiene años trabajando en el mismo rubro por lo que ya cunetas con experiencia y clientes fijos. El destino del financiamiento servirá para la adquisición D. maquinA. nuevas como freidoras D. pollo, cortadora automática D. papas para el mejoramiento D. sus habientes D. trabajo y para compra D. mercadería e insumos que les ayudara a mejores ingresos puesto que una gran parte D. los miembros del grupo son el jefe D. sus familias y por enD. el sustento D. su hogar. En general los socios ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a su crédito anterior con la Fundación Agrocapital que esta dispuesto a apoyar a sus grupos siempre y cuando estos tengan deseos D. salir adelante
texts.en:
Maria Elena represents the Virgen del Socavón group, which is comprised of 12 members who are in their second loan cycle with the Institution. They demonstrate the desire to work, and they are responsible in their payments. Most of the members sell food, soft drinks, make ice cream, and sell dairy products. Regarding the competition that they have in the market, most of them have years of working in this field, experience, and regular customers. The loan is to acquire new machines like chicken fryers and automatic potato cutters to improve their work environment. They will also buy merchandise and supplies that will help them get greater earnings. Many of their members are the head of their families, and they support their households. In general, the members have experience in solidarity groups, thanks to a previous loan with the Agrocapital Foundation. The Foundation is always willing to support groups when they have the desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel O. has been in the welding business in Naivasha town for the last four years. He is 32 years old and married to Christine Atieno. They have one school going child.  

Daniel was introduced to KADET by his friend. This will be his first loan and he plans to buy a new welding machine.

He still sees himself in welding in the near future since it’s a profitable business.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To buy a new welding machine.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is 39 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions, clothes and drinks. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more provisions, clothes and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena P. is from the village of Valencia City. She is 55 years old. Elena is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe E. is from the village of Grace Village, Sto. Nino, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Fe is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fe owns & operates a specialized retail business buying and selling of rice in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nchampi

texts.en:
Nchampi L. is a 49-year-old single lady with three children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables along one of the streets in Naivasha for the last two years.

This is Nchampi’s first loan from KADET. She has never borrowed from any micro finance institution before. she learned about KADET through a friend who is already a client.

With this loan, Nchampi plans to rent a shop for her grocery. This will enable her to make more sales and hence more income. She aspires to be a vegetable supplier to big hotels in Naivasha town and the outskirts.




About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living

loans.use: To rent a shop for her business

loans.name: Osahon

texts.en:
Osahon is 39 years old and is married with four children. His children are excelling in school.

Osahon owns a chemist store (pharmacy) where he sells different types of medicines at retail prices. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes to own a maternity home in the future.

Osahon is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Osahon is a LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. ROSARIO, TIENE 42 AÑOS, ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 5 HIJOS, POR LO QUE ELLA SE VE MUCHAS VECES EN LA NECESIDAD D. APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES, ELLA ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y SE DEDICA A LAS VENTAS, COMO PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA QUE OFRECE A SUS FAMILIARES Y AMIGOS, ANTICUCHOS EN LA PUERTA D. SU CASA PÒR LAS NOCHES Y VENTA D. GAS.
LA SRA.ROSARIO INTEGRA EL GRUPO "MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS" HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS 6 COMPAÑERAS COMO LA TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO. LA MAYORÍA D. LOS INTEGRANTES RESIDEN EN LA ZONA D. SAN JUAN BAUTISTA EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ PARA INCREMENTAR SU NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. GAS.
texts.en:
Senora Rosario is 42 years old, is married and has 5 children, for which reason many times she finds it necessary to support her husband with the household costs. She is very hard-working and works selling beauty products which she offers to her family and friends; anticuchos (kebabs) in the doorway of her house at night; and also sells gas. Senora Rosario is part of the group 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' and has been elected by her 6 colleagues as the treasurer of the joint directive of the group. The majority of the members live in San Juan Bautista zone in the Comas district. The loan being sought will be invested to increase her gas sale business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of gas bottles

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose Paller, Jr. is from the village of Langcata-on, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Jose is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Jose owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jose has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jose opted to request a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jose from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es: Leticia C. G. tiene una papelería y mercería llamada “Papelería Ángel” este negocio surgió por que ella no quería salir de casa pero si generar ingresos para apoyar con los gasto a su esposo. El motivo de que ella no quería salir a trabajar fuera de casa es que tiene 3 hijos y uno de ellos esta discapacitado los cual necesita toda la atención para cuidarlo. Así es de la manera que no tiene que descuidar a su hijo para darle las atenciones necesarias y  no pagar a otra persona que se lo cuide. La papelería ya tiene un año y poco a poco ha ido progresando, es por ello que quiere comprar más mercancía como muñecos para hacer regalos, papelería y artículos escolares.
texts.en:
Leticia Castaneda Garcia has a stationery store called "Papeleria Angel". This business came into being because she wanted to be able to not leave her home, while still generating an income to help her husband with the expenses. The reason for not wanting to work outside of her house is that she has 3 children, one of whom is disabled, and he needs to be cared for with a lot of attention. Therefore, in this way she can avoid neglecting her son, and she doesn't have to pay another person to take care of him. The stationery store has been in business for a year, and little by little has been making progress. For this reason, Leticia wants to purchase more merchandise such as dolls for gifts, as well as stationery and school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin Y., age 56, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has five children. He has a business of selling fish with his wife, earning an income of approximately $4 each day. By doing so, he is able to cover his family expenses, especially the children’s education. 

He has been in this business since 1995. Their standard of living has been improved since Y. started this business, so he wants to have a loan to expand his business. Y. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to transport fish for sale at the market. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. (Y. is pictured with his wife.)

loans.use: Buy a motorbike to transport fish for sale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita D. is from San Fermin, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 48, married, and has 4 school-aged children. Carmelita owns and operates a food stall in the community. Carmelita has been involved in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Carmelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting her fifth loan, for 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Big

texts.en: Big Y. is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has three children. She and her husband grow vegetables to sell, earning an income of USD 2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. This couple tries to work hard everyday to ensure a good standard of living for the family. Y. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ELIZABETH VIVE EN ALQUILER CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS TRES HIJITOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, ELLA NUNCA TRABAJO SOLO ESTABA DE AMA DE CASA Y CUANDO A SU ESPOSO LE DESPIDIERON NO SABIA DE DONDE SACAR EL DINERO Y TUBO QUE PASAR EPOCAS MUY DIFICILES, SU ESPOSO NO CONSEGUIA TRABAJO Y ELLA TAMPOCO, PERO NO FALTO UNA MUY BUENA AMIGA QUE LE DIJO QUE HAGA ALGO POR SUS HIJITOS YA QUE ELLOS ESTABAN SUFRIENDO SU AMIGA BERTHA LE AYUDO BASTANTE YA QUE LE ANIMO PARA VIAJAR Y TRAER EDREDONES  Y ES ASI COMO ELLA ACTUALMENTE TRABAJA ENTREGANDO LOS MISMOS A TIENDAS Y SEÑORAS AL CONTADO AL FIO AHORA ELLA ESTA FELIZ PORQUE TIENE INGRESOS Y YA NO TIENEN QUE ESTAR SUFRIENDO NI PREOCUPARSE DE LA COMIDA COMO MUCHAS MUJERES ELLA SALIO ADELANTE Y NO SE QUEDO ATRAS. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA POR MAYOR. LA SRA. ELIZABETH ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA YA QUE ELLOS LE TENDIERON UNA MANO EN LOS MOMENTOS DIFICILES PARA ELLA YA QUE GRACIAS AL CREDITO LOGRO SALIR ADELANTE.
texts.en:
Elizabeth rents the place where she lives. She lives with her husband and their three school age children. She never worked. She was only a housewife. When they fired her husband, she did not know where to get money, and she went through some very difficult times. Her husband did not find work, and neither did she. But, she did have a very good friend who told her to do something because her children were suffering. Her friend, Bertha, helped her a lot. Bertha motivated her to travel and get comforters. That is the work she now does. She delivers the comforters to stores and women for cash or credit. She is happy now because she has income, and they do not have to suffer or worry about food like a lot of women. She got ahead, and she was not left behind. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. Elizabeth is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva. They gave her a hand in the moments that were difficult for her. Thanks to the loan she was able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy comforters and clothes

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es: La señora S. B., trabaja como profesora de educación primaria en un colegio de Nagarote, tiene una hija que estudia en la universidad, solicita este nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la reparación de la cocina de su casa, ya que se le pasa el agua y requiere darle mejores condiciones. Con los ingresos que recibe de maestra es difícil realizar esta inversión por lo que recurre a CEPRODEL para realizar esta mejora.
texts.en:
La señora S. B., trabaja como profesora de educación primaria en un colegio de Nagarote, tiene una hija que estudia en la universidad, solicita este nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la reparación de la cocina de su casa, ya que se le pasa el agua y requiere darle mejores condiciones. Con los ingresos que recibe de maestra es difícil realizar esta inversión por lo que recurre a CEPRODEL para realizar esta mejora.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparación del techo de la cocina de la casa, compra de hojas de zinc, madera, clavos y otro.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase hair accessories, shoes and sandals, underwear, children's clothing

loans.name: Erkin's Group

texts.en:
Erkin T., 48, is the leader of the group. Her husband works as a mechanic and his monthly wage is 5000 soms ($108.81). They have two daughters and two sons. The first son works in Bishkek at the furniture factory, and the second one works at a school for electricians. The older daughter is 22, married, and lives separately with her family. The younger daughter studies at school. Twenty years ago, Erkin started to breed and sell cattle; the initial investment in this business activity was 1000 soms ($21.76). Now she earns 5000 soms ($108.81) per month. That profit made it possible for her to purchase home furniture, a vehicle and contribute some money to her son and her daughter's weddings. With money received from this loan Erkin wants to purchase five animals at 4000 soms ($87) per animal. In the future, she wants to expand her business so that she can build an adequate washroom for her family.

Rahima S. is the treasurer of the group, she is 41. Her husband is a farmer. They have three daughters and a son. The older daughter studies in Germany and also works there. The other children study at school. Rahima and her husband have been breeding and fattening cattle for 15 years. They also cultivate fruits and vegetables. Then they sell them at a higher price. In this way Rahima makes 8000 soms ($174) per month. Now she wants to get a loan to pay a tractor driver for his services and purchase 100 liters of fuel, which is needed for the summer season sowing process.

Balbubu B. is 52 and is married. She has raised four sons and two twin daughters. All of them are working, except for the youngest son, who goes to school. Seven years ago Balbubu got a loan of 4000 soms ($87) and started her business activity. Balbubu and her husband breed cattle and cultivate fruits and vegetables. Today, she wants to get a loan to purchase 100 litters of fuel, which is needed for sowing process and to pay the tractor driver for his services.

Zeinur T. is 48 and she is married. She has three daughters and a son. Two daughters work in a factory, the others study at school. Zaeinur and her husband have been breeding and selling cattle for five years. They started this business with the initial investment of 5000 soms ($108.81) and now they earn 5000 soms ($108.81) a month. Zeunir applied for a loan because she needs money to purchase sugar to produce jam.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products and services.

loans.name: Claudia Banessa

texts.es:
la sra. Claudia Banessa G. tiene 28 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, vive en casa de los suegros. su esposo trabaja en aduana quien le apoya economicamente todo los meses y ella se dedica  a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas. tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, anteriormente se 
dedicaba a la venta de golosinas y refrescos. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar leña, cal, harina de maiz y agua desea tener una mayor produccion ya que estos ultimos meses esta vendiendo mucho mas de lo normal y no cubre con todas las exigencias de sus clientes. 
su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Claudia Banessa G. is 28 years old, she has 4 children and she lives in her parents-in-law’s house. Her husbands works at Customs and monthly helps her economically, while she dedicates herself to preparing and selling tortillas. She has been running this business for 4 years; previously, she dedicated herself to the selling of sweets and soft drinks. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wood, cooking lime, corn flour and water. She wishes to increase her production, as in the past few months she has been selling a higher quantity of products and she cannot fulfil all of her customers’ requests. She dreams to have a house of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, cooking lime, corn flour and water

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Dah de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali, qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, 6 enfants et  cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
KARYA K. utilisera son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants,  au grand marché de San ville. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Dah, San et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI 2 is a group of married women of the village of Dah of the prefecture of San, area of Ségou, fourth administrative area of the republic of Mali, who live in large traditional families. They are on average 35 years old, with 6 children and cultivate peanuts. With the aim of making their farms profitable, the members of the group have decided to incorporate the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso starting 3 years ago. After having correctly refunded the preceding loans, they are on their third countryside loan. KARYA K. will use her loan to buy, a sufficient quantity of peanut seed, small equipment and seeders, at the large market of San city. After the wintering, harvests are stored during a certain time so that they reach best value before being sold at the large market of Dah, San and in the surrounding markets, in small lots (often large lots), for cash to customers generally from the big cities. The members of the group expect to each realize, after the flow of their agricultural product, a benefit of 35.000 FCFA which will be used to refund the interest of the loan and the current expenditure of the family.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of seeders, seeds and small equipment

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, widowed and has 5 school-aged children. Jocelyn owns & operates a service business, providing manicures and pedicures. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Jocelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Chhut

texts.en: Mr. H. is an old man whose wife appears in the photo shown here. H. is a civil servant officer in a ministry and earns a formal salary. He is married without any children. H. has another financial earner in his wife who owns a medium-sized workshop from which she sells all kinds of merchandise. Recently, one part of the stock inventory has been exhausted, and H. wants to resupply. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, HKL, to purchase beer, wine, cooking ingredients and a variety of other miscellaneous items for his wife to continue selling.

loans.use: To purchase beer, wine, cooking ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Karin

texts.es: Karin tiene 31 años de edad, es separada, pero vive con sus dos pequeños hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a atender su puesto de venta que es una cevicheria, donde ofrece diferente productos marinos y bebidas, en el mercado de Ventanilla uno de los más concurridos de su localidad. Para suerte suya, trabaja con su hermana, juntas trabajan en este negocio, teniendo cada uno su propio negocio. Karin atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, tiempo en el que ya termina por vender todos sus platillos. En un futuro quiere tener una gran cevicheria en alguna zona muy concurrida donde pueda ofrecer con mayor tranquilidad sus ricos platillos. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una congeladora que le permita tener su mercadería en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Karin, 31, is separated but lives with her two small children in her own home. For the last 6 years she has had a ceviche (marinated fish cocktails) stand where she sells various seafood items and beverages in the Ventanilla Market, one of the busiest in her area. Fortunately for her, she works with her sister. They run the business together although each has her own business. Karin works from 8am until 5pm which is when she stops working because all her dishes have sold out. In the future, she’d like to have a ceviche stand in some other very busy area where she can offer her delicious dishes in a more carefree manner. This is her first loan request with MFP and she pledges to be punctual with her repayment. She will use the requested funds to buy a freezer so that she can keep her merchandise in good condition.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Venus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Venus está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras  una de ellas es Christian Argentina S. M. quien hace cuatro años inicio con la venta de comida junto con su madre y por medio de los préstamos invirtió en hamburguesas y licor negocio en el que le va muy bien. 

Esta joven de 22 años  tiene la meta aumentar su negocio por lo cual con el crédito piensa surtir especialmente en licor y estudiar secretariado.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ligia del Socorro P. P. comerciante de prendas, Nuejara María G. Berrio  vende ropa desde hace dos años y Margarita de Jesús M. distribuidora de productos Avon, Romamel, Safiro y Arabela.
texts.en:
The Venus Group is comprised of four working women. One of them is Christian Argentina S. Mendoz who began selling food four years ago with her mother. With the help of loans that they invested in hamburgers and liquor, their liquor business is doing very well. 22-year-old Christian’s goal is to increase their business by using the loan to purchase liquor and to support her studies to become a secretary. The other members of the group are Ligia del Socorro P. P., clothing merchant, Nuejara María G. Berrio, clothing seller for two years, and Margarita de Jesús M., distributor for cosmetics such as Avon, Romamel, Safiro, and Arabela.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase liquor

loans.name: Batmolom

texts.en:
Batmolom D. is a 44-year-old married man with three children. His oldest two daughters attend university while his youngest child attends a local high school. His family lives in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent in the province of Huvsgul in Mongolia. His wife operates a construction material trading business in a container at a local construction market while Batmolom runs a household electrical appliances shop at a stall in his town.

Batmolom and his wife have been selling construction materials since 2000 and have since expanded their business by increasing their product line. Both his and his wife’s businesses have enabled them to improve the family’s quality of life. Over the years of successful operation, Batmolom has been able to pay his children's tuition fees. Batmolom is requesting an 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of spare auto parts for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of spare auto parts

loans.name: Nelly  Ndunge

texts.en:
Nelly Ndunge is a 41 year old single mother of one child, Winnie Mwendwa, who is 15 year old and in secondary school. Nelly runs a salon in Umoja estate, just few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. Umoja is a very busy place and most of her clients are her neighbors. She has been in this business for three years and earns KES10,000 as income every month. She also sells cereals, as another source of income.

Nelly has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend. She is now applying for second loan of KES30,000 to buy a hair drier worth KES20,000 and chemicals for her salon worth KES10,000. The profit generated from the expanded business will be used to further develop her business.

In the future, Ndunge hopes to educate her daughter and to be able to provide the necessary basic needs for her family.

loans.use: To buy a hair drier worth KES20,000 and chemicals for salon worth KES10,000

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is from the village of Tipan, Oroquieta City, Mis. Occ . He is 56 years old, married and does not have any children. Reynaldo is involved in a bamboo sunlight breaker business, popularly known as venetian blinds. He has been doing this for about 8 years and earns approximately  6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2000 Reynaldo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has paid his previous loan of 14,900 and is now requesting a new loan of 25,000 to provide additional capital for his business and to financially support immediate family members. He is an outstanding member of PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide additional capital for his venetian blind business

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in Kasur, which is a mid-sized city known for its leather industry in Pakistan.
She is divorced and lives with her brother. Her brother is a painter by trade and paints doors and windows for his clients. He does this work for daily wages.

Azra spends her time by operating a clothes-selling business. She buys clothes from Multan, a city that is famous for its variety of clothes, and sells them in the local market in her community. She deals with a good number of clients and receives regular orders.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk quantity, which will cut her cost of traveling in addition to adding more variety to her stock to attract more customers. She is hopeful that this investment will be profitable for her business and provides her a regular income in the future. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Azra.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk quantity for clothes-selling business

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is a forty-eight-year-old man, married with ten children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda in his own house. He has been able to support the family of twelve with the help of his wife who is a commercial farmer, and he has a dream of educating his children to higher levels of education. 

Benon has been a professional tailor for the last twenty-eight years and with this business he has been able to educate three of his children until they finished tertiary level. He needs the loan to buy cloth for his tailoring business.

loans.use: Buying cloth for his tailoring business

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou M. est une femme de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NDONDOL depuis le 25 juin 2002. 

Elle fait du ^petit commerce et ses activités sont diverses. Elle fait la vente de draps de lit, de céréales, d'huile de palme etc. Elle vend soit au comptant soit à crédit.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement afin de réaliser plus bénéfices

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou M. is a 56 year old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Ndondol since the 25th of June, 2002. She has a small business and sells a diverse array of goods. She sells bed sheets, grains, palm oil etc. She sells the goods for either cash, or credit.
With this loan, she intends to grow her supplies in order to make more profits. Her goal is to be able to help her husband take care of their family's needs.

loans.use: To develop her small business

loans.name: Lázaro Antonio

texts.es: El señor Lázaro Antonio E. G., tiene la edad e 31 años es soltero pero tienen 2 hijos a los cuales apoya económicamente ellos se dedican a los estudios y son bastante unidos, el señor Lázaro es Maestro de Obra, pero sus contratos no son estables económicamente, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo ya que sus limitados ingresos no le permiten remodelar la fachada de su casa, es para esto que solicita un préstamo para la compra de matariles de construcción que favorezcan la obra y mejore las condiciones en la que actualmente habita y que sus hijos convivan en un ambiente agradable para su desarrollo social.
texts.en: Mr. Lázaro Antonio E. G., 31, is single but has 2 children in school that he supports economically and with whom he is close. Mr. Larzaro is a foreman but his contracts are not economically stable and for this reason he is asking for a loan since his limited income doesn't allow him to remodel the facade of his house. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy construction materials useful for the work and to improve his current living conditions so that his children can live together in a pleasant environment for their social development.

loans.use: To build a wall

loans.name: Andresita

texts.en: Andresita D. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by buying and selling lobster and with a small pharmacy. She lives in Brgy. Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Andresita is now borrowing 29,000 PHP so that she can continue to purchase stock of lobster fingerlings. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 26,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Andresita hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: As additional working capital for lobster fingerlings

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa P. García es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 56 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa el cual inicio de granito en granito es decir con unos cuantos estilos de ropa en la actualidad compra y distribuye mayor cantidad de este producto. P. es casada y tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad quien le ayuda en el negocio.

Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería como camisas, pantalones, blusas, jeans, camisetas, en especial uniformes ya que inician las clases.
texts.en:
María Elsa P. García is a hardworking and enterprising 56-year-old woman who puts a lot of effort into her work. She works selling clothing which she started little by little with a few styles of clothing, and currently buys and distributes a larger quantity of merchandise. Mrs. P. is married and has an adult son who helps her in the business.

She will invest the loan in merchandise like shirts, pants, blouses, jeans, T-shirts, and uniforms especially because classes are beginning.

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Ana Mayela

texts.es:
Ana, reside en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, tiene su propia casa donde vive con su madre; Ana se dedica a la venta de productos plásticos y ropa, este negocio lo inicio su abuela quien se lo heredo, el horario de venta es de 7:00am a 5:00pm, en el mercado municipal.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo, pues necesita realizar algunas compras para fortalecer el negocio, la inversión será en faldas, blusas, trajes para niños, también ollas de aluminio, candelas, guacales, todos estos artículos serán puestos a disposición de los clientes ya que en ocasiones se le agotan y las personas regresan buscando el mismo artículo.
Para Ana el propósito con la inversión es tener un mayor flujo de dinero que ayude a salir de situaciones o problemas de liquidez, también ayudar a su madre en todo lo posible.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Jucuapa,  departament of Usulután. She has her own house where she lives with her mother. Ana sells plastic products and clothing. Her grandmother started this business, which she inherited.  The sales hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. in the municipal market. 

She is asking for a loan, which she needs to make some purchases to strengthen her business. The invetsment will be in skirts, blouses, children's clothing as well as aluminum pots, candles, and crates. All of these items will be offered to her customers, since at times she runs out and people come back seeking the same item.  

For Ana, the reason for the investment is to have a better cash flow, which will help her get out of situations or problems with liquidity, as well as to help her mother as much as possible.

loans.use: To buy: skirts, blouses, children's clothing as well as aluminum pots, candles and crates.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is currently in a business of selling goods, such as sugar, in a shop. She is 31 years old, married to a driver, and has 3 children. All of her children go to school. Sarah borrowed a loan to stock more goods to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell.

loans.name: 'try God' Group

texts.en:
Tete W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Try God'.  She is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children who are between the ages of 16 and 27 years. Due to financial constraints, Tete was only able to attend school through 5th grade. She cares for two siblings.

For 5 years, she has been selling fish in Banjour Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,500 LRD portion of this 37,500 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of fish.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman whose goals are to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Jenny Maria

texts.es:
la joven Jenny P. es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su negocio, el cual es la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, y este es un lugar estrategico, la afluencia de personas es grande. Jenny todos los dias abre su negocio a las 6 de mañana para 
satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes y lo cierra hasta las 9 de la noche.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio.
su meta es crecer con su negocio y lograr en un futuro tener una buena casa y un buen negocio.
texts.en:
The young Jenny P. is an enterprising woman and she is very dedicated to her business. She sells every day products and she has a small convenience store located in her house. She is located in a strategic place which is highly populated. Jenny opens her business every day at 6 in the morning in order to satisfy the needs of her clients. She doesn't close until 9 at night. 

She will use her loan to purchase merchandise in order to stock her business. 

Her goal is to make her business grow and to have a very nice house and a good business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Aracely Maribel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Araceli, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 años y de  9 meses de edad. Su esposo es pintor, ella estudia enfermería, está en el cuarto año en la Universidad Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta.

Con este crédito ella va a comenzar  un negocio de venta de ropa, antes vendía productos Yanbal pero se retiro de este tipo de negocios porque le quedaron mal con unos pagos por eso comienza este nuevo negocio ya que tiene algunos pedidos que le han hecho sus amigas y clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta  la forma de trabajar de la institución.

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y trabajar en su especialidad.
texts.en:
In the Eloy Alfaro parish, in the city of Manta, the Mujeres Con Esperanza (Women With Hope) Communal Bank meets every two weeks. This place is known for its beautiful beaches which are often visited throughout the year by local and foreign tourists. It’s one of the most important ports for the country and for America and it is located on the Pacific Ocean. 

Here we meet Araceli. She is 26 years old and married. She has two children from this relationship; they are five years old and nine months old. Her husband is a painter. She is studying nursing. She is in her fourth year at the Laica Eloy Alfaro de Manta University. 

With this loan, she will start a clothing business. Before she was selling Yanbal products but she withdrew from this business because things went poorly with some payments. For this reason, she is starting a new business now that she has a few orders from friends and other customers. 

This loan will be used to purchase pants, t-shirts, blouses and children’s clothing. She has been a part of this Communal Bank since the beginning and she likes how the bank works. 

 Her dream is to finish her studies and work in her specialty.

loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothing

loans.name: Leslie

texts.es: La señora Leslie es comerciante: se dedica a la venta de ropa. El crédito lo necesita para adquirir ropa de niños. Es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. Es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de su madre  ubicada en la zona de las Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito con IMPRO.
texts.en: Sra. Leslie is a merchant who sells clothes.  She needs a loan in order to acquire children's clothing.  Her business is the source of income by which she is able to support her family.  Leslie is single and has no children.  She lives at her mother's house which is located in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz.  This is the first time she has received a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: To acquire children's clothing.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 43 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa y sus 03 queridos hijos; a quienes desea brindar una buena educación. Antonio es un hombre muy responsable, la vida le enseñó tropiezos pero no se amedrantó, al contrario  trato de sobresalir y trabajó con mucho ahínco en los cultivos de cacao y plátano, productos que actualmente los comercializa en la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad que obtiene de estos frutos, no dudan en comprarle todo lo cosechado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva  20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en épocas de lluvia porque perjudican el rendimiento de su trabajo. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras.Este es su 12avo  crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar  todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario y responsable. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como la poda y el desmonte de malezas.
texts.en: Antonio is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and three loving children. Antonio is a responsible man; he wants to provide a good education to his children. He had some setbacks in life, but he didn't let this deter him. On the contrary, he was motivated to succeed, and he worked hard on his cocoa and plantain crops. He sells these crops in the city of San Francisco, where he has a diverse group of buyers who purchase from him because they trust the quality of his products. He has been growing for 20 years, and his biggest challenge is working during the rainy season because he cannot accomplish as much. In the future he hopes to save enough from his earnings to buy more land. This will be his twelfth loan with MFP; he knows he has to make his payments punctually, and he is prepared to do so. He is responsible and shows solidarity with the other members of his community bank. The loan will be used to maintain his crops by hiring workers to prune and clear weeds.

loans.use: hire workers who can prune and clear weeds and brush from his fields.

loans.name: Kantutas De Cañuma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE CAÑUMA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Remedios. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, cría de animales, venta de dulces en colegio, venta de tenis, empleada domestica, costura, cría de ganado, pensión venta de salchipapa.
 
La señora Remedios,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que participa gracias a la invitación de unas vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ganado que lo esta trabajando hace cinco meses. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de ganado vacuno, que comprara de la comunidad de Vilacota del municipio de Achocalla. Cuando este ganado ya pueda ser comercializado lo venderá en las ferias de Achocalla. También comenta que este negocio lo realiza con el apoya de su esposo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene diez hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las tasas de intereses bajas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kantutas de Canuma" will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Villa Exaltacion. It is made up of twelve members and it is managed by a board of directors, led by Mrs. Remedios. The businesses held by the members of the communal bank are various, and among them we have: vegetables sales, community store, raising livestock, sweets sales in a school, shoes sales, janitorial services, sewing services, raising cattle, prepared foods sales.

Mrs. Remedios indicates that is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer and she is a member following an invitation for a neighbor. She currently has a cattle sales business and she has had it for five months. 

The loan will be used to purchase a cow. She will purchase it in the community of Vilacota in the municipality of Achocalla. Once the cattle can be sold she will take them to the fairs at Achocalla. She comments that she has this business together with her husband. This type of business helps her generate an income to help her family as much as possible. She is married and she has ten children. 

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she enjoys the savings and the low interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a businessman who hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a Ugandan male aged 26 years who owns a boutique. He dreams of educating his children and setting up other income generating activities from which he can earn extra income. He acquired his initial capital from brewing alcohol. John wants a loan to purchase women and men's wear to sell in his boutique.

loans.use: To purchase women and men's wear for his boutique

loans.name: Duteraninkunga Rsz Group

texts.fr: Etienne est commerçant naquit au Rwanda, et il est membre du groupe solidaire DUTERANINKUNGA. Il est mariée, il a 33 ans, il a cinq enfants entre 8 ans et 16 ans tous vont à l’école, et il n’a aucune personne en charge, il a 4 ans des études secondaires. C'est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Claudine va utiliser son crédit pour acheter les habits des enfants qu'elle vende pour accroitre son business dans le marché locale. Il n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d'augmenter les heures de travail, de huit à dix heures. Sa vision, il voudrait acheter une moto qui va servir de déplacement pour atteindre son objectif ainsi que sa vision. Pour sa famille il va  payer le minerval pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Etienne is a small-scale merchant who was born in Rwanda and she is a member of the solidarity group DUTERANINKUNGA. He is married, 33 years old, and has five children between the ages of eight and 16. All go to school and he is not responsible for anyone else. He spent four years in secondary school. This is his first loan through ACB. He is going to use her loan to buy children's clothing to grow her business at the local market. 

There is no expectation that he might not reimburse her loan. His strategy for growing his business is to work every day selling clothing, and increase his working hours to work from 8am to 10pm. His dream is to buy a motorcycle to help her with his business. For his family, he plans to pay the semester fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and enlarge her little clothing business.

loans.name: Silis

texts.en:
Silis, 23, resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Silis and her husband are butchers, earning an income of $11 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

Silis is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more pigs to resell. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy pigs to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Suhayl

texts.ru: Сухайл проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат. Детей не имеет. У него среднее образование. Он более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом имеет продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для покупки масла, муки, арбузов, дыни, картофеля и семян. Сухайл хочет одновременно заняться растениеводством. Он намерен у себя дома выращивать овощи для продажи.
texts.en: Suhayl lives in the Yavan district.  He is 26 years old, married and has no children.  He has a secondary education.  He has been involved in retail sales for over six years and has a store near his house.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of butter, flour, watermelons, honeydew, potatoes and seeds.  Suhayl wants to also get involved in agriculture.  He plans to grow vegetables at home for subsequent sale.

loans.use: to purchase butter, flour, watermelons, honeydew, potatoes and seeds

loans.name: Merope

texts.en:
Merope is married and is 48 years old with four school-aged children. With her husband engaged in rice farming in the Philippines for almost 19 years now, they earn an average net profit of P25,000 per harvest. Her plan is to continue sending their children to school so they can finish their studies in college someday.

Merope is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for their rice production. She needs to strive harder to make her dreams come into reality. She believes that, "If there is patience, there is progress."

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for their rice production.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he sells vehicle spare parts.  He has been in the business for over eight years and has employed two people.  Previously, he was involved in a van transport business.  Through his hard work, he has grown his business.  He has also benefited from the financial training conducted by Faulu Kenya.

John hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts.

loans.use: buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Муминобод. Женат. Ему 41 год. У него двое детей. Его брат живет вместе с ними. Он занимается производством муки. Сам Чамшед занимается торговлей. Он на центральном рынке района занимается торговлей арбузов. Кроме того у него имеется пекарня, где пекут хлеб и булочки для продажи. Он берет кредит для покупки муки и сахара. Еще Чамшед занимается растениеводством. У него при доме имеется небольшой участок земли.
texts.en: Chamshed lives in the Muminobod district.  He is 41 years old, married and has two children.  His brother, who is involved in flour production, lives together with him.  Chamshed is involved in sales.  He sells watermelons at the district's central market.  Besides this business, he has a bakery, where he bakes bread and buns for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour and sugar.  Chamshed is also involved in horticulture and has a small plot of land by his house.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past four years, Jocelyn has been buying and selling salt in the Philippines. 

Jocelyn is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a sack of salt to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase salt to sell

loans.name: El Esfuerzo De Colón Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “El Esfuerzo de Colón” lo conforman 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, pero los principales son venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos por catalogo, venta de plásticos y venta de mercadería. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ciudad de Santiago. 
Olivia integrante del grupo del Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila y se encuentra sentada en el tercer puesto de derecha a izquierda, usa su cabello suelto, viste un sweater color negro.
Se dedica a vender ropa de temporada para mujeres, desde hace 4 años. Trabaja en horario flexible desde su casa, ya que su madre tiene un almacén y aprovecha esta instancia para ofrecer sus productos a los mismos clientes.
Su clientela es fija y vende puerta a puerta cuando ellas son conocidas. 
Su mercadería la compra en la comuna de Estación Central, en los locales donde los precios sean convenientes para invertir. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa, específicamente calcetines, sweater, poleras para mujeres.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda ofrecer y vender su mercadería. 
Olivia vive junto a su madre, su marido y sus dos hijos de 7 años y una pequeña de 9 meses de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son invertir en su negocio para generar mayores ganancias, de ésta manera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, además anhela comprar un auto para el traslado de su mercadería. En el ámbito familiar Olivia anhela costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos para que sean futuros profesionales. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, el crédito por su parte le permitirá invertir en su negocio.
Respecto a las reuniones impartidas con el Banco comunal, le ha permitido conocer a su grupo y de ésta manera sentirse con mayor comodidad. 
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile).
