Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
The communal bank “El Esfuerzo de Colón” has 17 members who have a variety of businesses.  The main ones are: the sale of clothing, cosmetics, plastic items and general merchandise.  They all live in the township of San Bernardino in the city of Santiago.

Olivia is a member of the communal bank who is found in the photo in the second row, seated in the third spot from the right or left; her hair is down and she is wearing a black sweater. She has had a business selling seasonal women's clothing for 4 years.  She works from her house on a flexible schedule.  Her mother has a store, and she takes advantage of this to offer her products to the same customers.  She has a regular customer base, and she sells door-to-door to the customers that she knows.

She purchases her merchandise in the township of  Estación Central, from the places that offer good prices for her investment.  With this loan, she will buy clothing, specifically: socks, sweaters and T-shirts for women.  Her goal is to have an established shop, where she could offer and sell her merchandise.

Olivia lives with her mother, her husband, and their two offspring: a child of 7 and a 9 month-old baby.  At the personal level, she dreams of investing in her business to generate greater earnings so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.  In addition, she wants to buy an automobile to transport her merchandise.  She also wants to pay for a college education for her children so that in the future they can become professionals.  Olivia is very content and grateful for the services provided by Fondo Esperanza.  She will invest her part of the loan in her business.  With respect to the meetings of her communal bank, they have allowed her to get to know her group and in this way feel more comfortable.  

San Bernardo is a city located 18 km. in a straight line south from the main square of Santiago (the capital of Chile).   It is known as the Capital of Folklore, because every year in January they hold the "International Festival of Folklore," an event in which the roots of the country come together and musical groups from all of South America participate.  The "Traditional Crafts Fair" takes place there as well,  where artisans from Chile and nearby countries participate.  Later in April they host the event "April 1,000 Cuecas," when the whole community dances the cueca dance (a traditional Chilean dance.)

loans.use: to buy clothing, specifically socks, sweaters and T-shirts for women

loans.name: Livia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Livia; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ternos, pantalones, blusas, la socia tiene una tienda de confecciones donde trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de confección de ternos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar telas, tijeras, hilos y agujas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Livia belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank located in Cusco district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.  

She is 52, married, and has three children.  Along with her daily activities, she has a business making suits, pants, and blouses. She has a sewing shop where she works from 7:00am to 9:00pm. Through this business, she is helping her children get ahead in life. 

She wants to expand and improve the suit-making business.  She is applying for the loan to buy fabric, scissors, thread, and needles.  Livia is happy to receive the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy fabric, scissors, thread and needles.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 29, is married and has three children between 9 and 2 years. He has been in farming for the last four years, producing and selling milk, vegetables and eggs to the local market. He gets additional income from his low-cost rental houses. His challenge is the high costs incurred in fighting animal diseases.

Stephen has made a third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 61,200 KES. He says the loan will help improve his farming income by enabling him to buy and insure a dairy cow at 31,200 KES and to buy more birds for his poultry business. 

He will use the income to ensure that his family enjoys better living standards. He plans to buy more dairy cows for his farm. He is also keen on timely repayment.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and purchase poultry.

loans.name: Bufunjo Farmers Group

texts.en:
Paul wants a loan to buy maize and groundnuts (peanuts) for resale. Aged 46, Paul hails from the Kyenjojo District in Uganda. He is the father of five children who he lives with, together with their mother, in a semi-permanent house. Having started in farming, he saved money to start his business which has grown over the past 5 years. His dream is to educate his children and would like to expand his business into new markets by hiring employees to help in his business. Price fluctuations and weather changes affect his business.
He is a member of the above mentioned group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy maize and groundnuts (peanuts) for resale

loans.name: Maria Noemy

texts.es:
María, es madre soltera de una niña de16 años, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y refrescos, ella inicio hace dos años, trabaja todos los días de siete de la mañana a seis de la tarde, aprendió por una amiga y hasta el momento han logrado mantener su hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de quesillo, aceite, condimento, bebidas, esta compra le ayudará para mejorar el negocio, también le ayudará para generar más ganancias.
Ella quiere mantener el negocio, hacerlo crecer y continuar surtiéndolo, también quiere que su familia cuente con mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
María is a single mother of a 16-year old girl. She makes her living selling pupusas (a traditional thick corn tortilla stuffed with fillings) and soft drinks. She started two years ago and works every day from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. She learned from a friend and, up until now, has been able to care for her household. 

Currently she is requesting a loan to purchase quesillo cheese, oil, condiments, and drinks. These purchases will help her improve her business and generate more income.

She wants to be able to maintain her business, make it grow and continue stocking it. She also wants her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quesillo cheese, oil, condiments, and drinks.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 20 years old and single. She sells spare parts for bicycles and has been doing so for one year. She would like a loan to buy more spare bicycle parts to sell. The extra profits will be used to renovate her family’s home.

loans.use: To buy more spare bicycle parts for resale.

loans.name: Mondoukpè Rachelle

texts.fr: Mondoukpè Rachelle est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Mondoukpè Rachelle est mariée à un fonctionnaire du nom de Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Mondoukpè Rachelle vend depuis quatre ans des articles de la plomberie (tuyaux, pointes, tôles et pots de colles). De façon secondaire, Mondoukpè Rachelle vend des charbons et de divers articles. Grâce aux revenus que lui génèrent ces activités, Mondoukpè Rachelle contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Mondoukpè Rachelle sollicite pour une quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois crédits reçus antérieurement par Mondoukpè Rachelle ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Mondoukpè Rachelle is 34 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to Joseph, a civil servant.  The couple has four dependent children; all are in school.  The children live together with their parents.  The couple takes care of the various household expenses together.  In order to provide for the family, Mondoukpè Rachelle has been selling plumbing materials (pipe, cutters, sheet metal, and pots of glue).  She also sells coal and various articles on the side.  Thanks to the revenue that this business generates, she pays her share of the household expenses.  To satisfy the demands of her growing clientele, Mondoukpè Rachelle is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.  The three loans that she previously received have been fully repaid.

loans.use: To buy plumbing materials (pipe, cutters, sheet metal, and pots of glue)

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende compra maquinas y utensilios par la soda que tiene ella actualmente.  Ella quiere seguir con el proyecto establecido y fortalecerlo aun mas para su mejor bienestar. Ella quiere darles a sus clientes una mejor atención y tener los alimentos para la venta a sus clientes aun mas rápido para su mejor estadía en el local. Ella quiere obtener de la soda el máximo de ganancias y aumentar la clientela para tener estable su economía. También quiere poder ayudarles a sus padres con las responsabilidades del hogar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Martha, 28, is single living with her parents and siblings at present.  She intends to use the loan to buy machines and utensils for her snack bar.  She wants to continue with this project and strengthen it still more for her better wellbeing.  She wants to give her customers better service and to have food available for sale to her customers more quickly so that their stay in the locale will be improved.  She wants to extract the maximum profits possible from her snack bar and increase her clientele to have a stable economy.  She also wants to be able to help her parents with household responsibilities.
This is her first Fudecosur loan.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur offered the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy utensils for her snack bar.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora Maria Julia tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Zope, ahi vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, Maria se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de abarroteria, refrescos, embutidos y otros productos, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion.
doña Maria es una mujer seria y muy reponsable con sus obligaciones, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia, desea comprar al  por mayor porque en esta epoca de navidad se vende bastante y quiere tener buenas utilidades.
Su sueño es que en este nuevo año Dios pueda bendecir a todas las familias del mundo.
texts.en: Mrs. María Julia is 46 years old and lives in the village of Zope.  She lives there with her three children and her husband.  Maria has worked for several years selling grocery items, soft drinks, sausages, and other products.  Her business is located in a room of her house.  Maria is a serious and very responsible woman with her obligations.  She will use the loan to purchase goods to stock her grocery store.  She hopes to buy in bulk because in this Christmas season she sells a lot and she wants to have good inventory.  Her dream is that this new year God will bless all the families of the world.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, bread, soft drinks, eggs, sausages, milk, cereal, oatmeal, toilet paper, candles, matches and churros.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 48 лет. Он женат. У них трое детей. Двое его сыновей работают в России. Сам  он занимается изготовлением окон и дверей. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 17 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения досок.
texts.en:
Sharif lives in the region Khuroson. He is 48 years old. He is married. They have three children. Two of his sons work in Russia. 

Sharif works with manufacturing windows and doors. He has been engaged in this activity for 17 years. He takes a loan to purchase planks.

loans.use: to purchase planks

loans.name: Abdukaum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм  клиент в организации с 2008 года, который каждый кредит использует на расширение бизнеса животноводства , на увеличение скота. Он с молодости занимался на рынке куплей и  продажей скота, поэтому хорошо разбирается в породистых коровах и баранах. У него сейчас две коровы и шесть баранов. На следующий кредит он планирует купить корову и несколько голов баранов. Его жена занимается домашними делами и продажей домашнего молока. Абдукаюм  кроме откорма работает в бригаде строителем, а из-за того что данная деятельность является сезонной , поэтому в зимний период он занимается  откормом и продажей скота.
texts.en: Abdukaum has been a borrower since 2008 and uses every loan to expand his animal husbandry business and increase his herd.  Since Abdukaum has been buying and selling livestock at a market from a young age, he has become an expert in pedigreed cows and sheep.  He currently owns two cows and six sheep.  With his loan, Abdukaum is planning to buy a cow and a few sheep.  His wife takes care of household chores and sells home-produced milk.  Beside his work in animal husbandry, Abdukaum also works as a builder in a construction team, but this activity is seasonal, so in the winter he is involved in the fattening and the sale of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a few sheep.

loans.name: Benkadi Yologosso 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi Yologosso 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Kouroubadougou, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  avec   SETOU DAOUDA , 1 ere debout de  la gauche vers la droite, sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte  acheter des intrants, semence, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour  pour l’exploitation de 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Benkadi Yologosso 2" are married women averaging 32 years of age and four children each all living in traditional families in Kouroubadougou, a village in San (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution. The past loans have indeed been paid back.

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with SETOU DAOUDA, the first one standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, and sundry equipment and to pay for plowing to make use of 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce will be sold in the village and at the San market to a customer base composed of men and women.

She plans on making an average profit of  160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and sundry supplies and equipment and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Ndiaw

texts.fr: Monsieur NDIAW est un tailleur de profession, il est marié et père de famille. Il habite à un village situé à 1km du Guichet. NDIAW a installé un atelier de couture depuis plus de 4ans.Il commence sa journée à 9h pour fermer la porte de son atelier à 19h. Il sollicite ce prêt d'un montant de 250.000F pour acheter une machine à coudre de marque CORNIERE. NDIAW gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais scolaires de ses enfants. A l'avenir Monsieur NDIAW voudrait ouvrir une mercerie afin d'augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille

loans.use: Acheter une machine à coudre de marque cornière pour satisfaire sa clientèle

loans.name: Matare Nuru Group

texts.en:
This group of three farmers is called Matare Nuru. It is a group of Nuru International farmers and is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Meremo, 33 years old, is married and has two children, and one of the children goes to school. She has been a member of this group since 2012. She is the one raising her hand in the picture. She is very excited about the 2014 long rains and she hopes to implement better farming methods to increase the farm yields. It is for this reason that Meremo is asking for a loan. She intends to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to be used in her one acre farm to grow maize, millet and sorghum. She is optimistic that she will obtain enough food from the yields and sell the surplus to invest in a shop business.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Mon Desir Group

texts.fr: MON DESIR est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Elisabeth (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans. Elisabeth a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Elisabeth est mariée à un certain Charles. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Elisabeth  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Elisabeth et son mari. Pour cette raison, Elisabeth vend des chaussures à son domicile depuis dix ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MON DESIR, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des chaussures.

loans.name: Omosumwen

texts.en: A mother of three (3) children, Mrs. Omosumwen O. is a trader. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in the business for five years. She is looking forward to getting this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will invest the loan in the maintenance and expansion of her salon.

loans.name: Eleacer

texts.es:
Eleacer is forty-two. She is married and has two children. Her husband works in the fields. She belongs to the group Limonar 6 along with Grafira Gordillo Vázquez. Both raise farm animals (pigs and chickens). They would use the loan to buy piglets and chicks, which they would raise and sell when grown for a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

ELEACER, tiene 42 años, casada, dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en el campo. Pertenece al grupo Limonar 6 junto con doña Grafira Gordillo Vázquez, ambas se dedican a la crianza de animales (puercos y pollos). Con el préstamo esperan comprar mas lechoncitos y pollitos para empezar desde pequeños su engorda y obtener mas ganancias ya que el costo de ellos es menor comparado con un animal ya grande.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 50 chairs, 10 tables, & a big cupboard

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina K. is married with grown children. She and her husband live in Dneprorudnyi, Ukraine, where Valentina sells office supplies in the local market. The demand for this type of product is high in Dneprorudnyi because there are many new schools and offices in the town.

Valentina has a good reputation as a responsible and serious entrepreneur. She has gained rich experience expanding her business. Today her net profit is about $600 a month, which is a good financial support for her family. Valentina is happy that the business risk she took five years ago has worked out for her. Moreover, she likes to earn money and contribute to the family budget along with her husband, who works as a miner. We believe her natural ability to deal with challenging situations and stay focused on the future will help her continue to succeed and expand her business even further.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda is a nurse by profession. She is 47 years old and has two children ages 17 and 11. She suffered considerably after her separation from her husband, and she now carries out the roles of father and mother simultaneously. In actuality, she has a new engagement with whom she shares all her ideas, and she feels very happy with his help, support and understanding. The most important thing to her is to see her children content and satisfied, which is why she excels in her professional job and in her business.

For a very long time now, she has been dedicating her time to the art of bijouterie, and to clothing and beauty product sales. In her ideal world she would open her own store where she could display these products. She is characterized as being a woman with many qualities, which help her develop very well in this field. However, to make this dream a reality, she requires capital in the form of a loan to invest in the purchase of her products and to improve some areas in her home where she will set up her business. With your uninterested support Florinda will progress and will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Florinda, enfermera de profesión, tiene 47 años con dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, sufrió bastante con la separación de su esposo; por lo que ahora desempeña la función de padre y madre a la vez. En la actualidad tiene un nuevo compromiso con quien comparte todas sus ideas y ella se siente muy feliz con su apoyo, comprensión y ayuda.Para ella lo más importante es ver a sus hijos contentos y satisfechos, es por eso que ella sobresale en su trabajo y en su negocio. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al arte de la bijoutería, venta de productos de belleza y a la venta de ropas, su mundo ideal es instalar su propia tienda con la exposición de estos productos. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer con muchas cualidades, las cuales le ayudan a desenvolverse muy bien en este campo, sin embargo para hacer realidad este anhelo necesariamente requiere de un capital de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de sus productos y sobre para mejorar los ambientes de su casa para implementar su negocio. Con tu apoyo desinteresado Florinda progresará y no te defraudará.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her bijouterie projects, and clothing and beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Mukhtaran's Group

texts.en:
My name is Mukhtaran B.. I was born in a small town, Shiekhpura, and then moved to another small town, Kot Radha Kishan after my marriage. I am a widow and a mother of six: five boys and one girl. All of my sons together operate a cardboard business except one who is a truck driver. My daughter is married. Now my sons feel a need to expand their business for which they request a loan.

My group members are: Irshad B., who needs a loan for their bricks trading; Saira B., who will use this loan for their cardboard business; Rani B., who requires a loan to rent land for growing crops; Mussarat B., who needs a loan to improve their wood business. I trust all these women and have known them for many years.

loans.use: Expand current business

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mrs. Sor I., 32, is the mother of four children and lives wI. her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works buying recyclable items from the people in her community and reselling them to her local recycling plant. She also works works growing rice on her piece of land. She can generally earn about $3/day in income. Meanwhile, her husband drives a horse-cart carrying salt to sell everywhere around his community and typically makes about $3 per day in revenue.

One of their children works as a carpenter making wooden doors, windows, chairs and various kinds of wooden furniture. The other children are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Sor I. has lately requested this loan to purchase more seeds to expand her little farm and purchase more wood to supply her son’s carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds to expand her farm and wood to supply her son’s carpentry business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H., 30 years old, lives with her husband and her four children in Hung Nguyen district, Nghe An province. Her life is very tough because all of her children are still small. If just depending on some perches of corn land, their family would not have enough to eat. She cannot work far from home either, because that means she would not have time to take care of her children. With this situation, Mrs. H. chose to stay home and breed animals. In order to buy piglets, Mrs. H. borrowed money from TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). Since she pays the weekly repayments, at the end of each loan term, the amount of loan unpaid is not too much. Thus, she can keep most of the money she got from selling the pigs. Her family income increases significantly with each loan. All of her children are able to go to school. She wants to borrow 525USD to buy piglets.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H., 30 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con tại Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. Cả 4 con đều còn nhỏ nên chị H. rất vất vả. Nếu chỉ trông vào vài sào ruộng thì không thể đủ ăn. Chị cũng không thể đi làm xa nhà vì như thế sẽ không có thời gian chăm sóc các con. Trước hoàn cảnh thực tế, chị H. chọn giải pháp ở nhà chăn nuôi. Để có tiền mua lợn, bò, chị đã tham gia Quỹ Tình thương và vay vốn. Số tiền vay được chia nhỏ trả theo tuần nên khi hết vòng vốn, số lãi thu được từ việc bán lợn hoàn toàn thuộc về chị. Kinh tế phát triển dần theo những vòng vốn vay, các con chị H. đều được ăn học đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 525USD về mua lợn giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio is 50 years old and his wife, Estela, is 48. They are the parents of four children, three boys and a girl, all of whom are students. Rogelio works selling typical handicrafts and his wife has been making quilts for more than 25 years.

Since he was very young, Rogelio has had a lot of success in sales that continues to this day. He also buys and sells cattle with the help of his parents who are in that business. Thanks to an entrepreneurial spirit, Rogelio and his wife have made progress and been able to support a family, build a home and have two vehicles – a motorcycle and pick-up truck – that are also used for work. Their home has many comforts which shows us that with hard work, it’s possible to get ahead while working independently.

The loan that Rogelio is requesting will be used to buy products to sell including towels, bed sheets and blankets and also to buy various colors of cotton thread that his wife can use to make her quilts.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Rogelio tiene 50 años de edad y su esposa la señora Estela 48, ellos son padres de cuatro hijos, tres varones y una mujer, todos estudiantes. Él se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos típicos, y su esposa a la fabricación de colchas de hilo hace ya más de veinticinco años.

Desde muy joven, se inicio en esta actividad con la cual continua con mucho éxito hasta la actualidad, además de ello también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado con la ayuda de sus padres que se dedican a los mismo. Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor, llegaron a progresar, pudiendo sostener una familia, construir una casa y contar con dos vehículos una moto y una camioneta que son también sus herramientas de trabajo. Su casa cuenta con buenas comodidades y nos demuestran que con una buena gestión se puede salir adelante en forma independiente.

El préstamo que solicita desea invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías varias para la venta como toallas, sabanas, frazadas además de comprar hilos de algodón de distintos colores para que su esposa pueda seguir elaborando sus cubrecamas.

loans.use: Purchase towels, bed sheets, blankets and various colors of cotton thread.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Judith S.. She is married and has 2 children, ages 4 months and 6. In 2005 Judith established her natural therapies and nutrition centre business. Judith has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA, and she now requires a new loan in order to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her natural therapies and nutrition centre business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia is a loving mother and grandmother with a mind for business, and she has been ever since she had her beloved children. She took on various businesses including sales through catalogues and she created beautiful pieces of art by hand. And most recently, with the support of her children, she has dedicated her time to remodel a small area of her home to create an internet cafe. These communication and information services are helping many people in the city, but the small space is not enough to meet the demands of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Leticia, es madre y abuela amorosa y emprendedora, desde que les concedió el don de vida a sus queridos hijos. Se dedicó a diferentes actividades, a la venta por campañas, realizaba hermosos trabajos manuales y finalmente con el apoyo de sus hijos decidió adecuar un pequeño espacio de su domicilio para abrir un locutorio y brindar servicios de internet, estos servicios de información y comunicación que brinda están ayudando a mucha gente en su ciudad, sin embargo esto no es suficiente para resolver la demanda y exigencia de sus clientes.

loans.use: To remodel her work space.

loans.name: Naran

texts.en:
Miss. Naran P., 40, is single and lives with her parents, brother, and sister. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her mother is a silk weaver and her sister is weaving at home as well. Her father does farming and assists with spinning thread and silk. Her brother is in local school.

Miss. Naran has been a silk weaver -- a skill she learned from her mother -- since 1984. The family sells their finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Naran is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk material to continue her family’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Sharifa's Jitahidi Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is 49 years old. She is a married woman with 5 children aged between 5 and 20. She became a charcoal and firewood seller in 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Sharifa now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwajuma, who has a spice selling business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to increase her stock.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon T. sells groceries. She sells a variety of products in her village; her husband, Mr. Hun Hoeurn, sells used clothes. She is married with seven children, three of whom are married and four of whom stay home, living in Chubtatrav Commune, Siem Reap Province. One of her children repairs radios and televisions in the local market; another owns a battery sales business.

To increase her family's income, she needs to expand her business through increasing grocery inventory. Hence, now she decided to request a loan to purchase more grocery inventory; she plans to use any leftover money to purchase a pump machine to use in her family's home.

loans.use: Purchasing more groceries

loans.name: Erminka

texts.en: Erminka P. ić is a mother of two children and lives in Lohinja near Gračanica. She has a husband who is constantly employed. However, Erminka is a modern young woman who doesn't want to just sit at home, and so she has a second hand shop. She is constantly busy finding and selling second hand clothes, and her business runs well. She would like to take out a loan to buy more clothes and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes for reselling

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani baji, the wife of S. A., lives inChichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for the last 20 years. She is the mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her son memorizes the Holy Book, Quran-e-Pak. Her daughter is in the 7th standard grade. 

Rani baji’s husband has been selling wheat for the past 10 years. Rani baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy wheat to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy leather for her shoe-making business. Rafea baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business. Asma baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Ameer baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.en:
E. Zulkhumor is 35 years old.  She is married with three children.  Zulkhumor is running a catering business where she provides meals of the national cuisine.  

She rents the catering room in a caravan, which is located in the central local market and allows Zulkhumor to have many clients, the majority of which are those making purchases in the market. Every day, she purchases the latest foodstuff and cooks delicious dishes.  

Zulkhumor’s children are already adults and in order to send them to the university, she has to earn more as her husband doesn’t earn much.  Now, she is asking for a loan 3900 Somoni ($1150 USD) with the term of 3 months in order to expand her business and earn enough to be able to send her children to the University next year. 

She will use the loan for buying kitchen inventory, tables and chairs.  She thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.  Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dreams come reality.

loans.use: Purchasing of kitchen inventory, tables and chairs

loans.name: Tesmarie

texts.en:
Tesmarie lives in the village of Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Jaymar who is 28 years old and working as an overseas contract worker.  She takes care of their two children: Jaymarie – 7 years old and in grade one; and Maryjay – 2 years old. 

She is engaged in the business of food vending and direct selling. Aside from selling foods, Tesmarie also sells clothes like shirts, skirts, pants, blankets, bed sheets, etc., to her fellow villagers. Sometimes, she also sells some of the products to her friends in the neighboring village.
 
Tesmarie is currently in need of additional working capital to support her business. The loan will be used to purchase additional stock such as short pants, polo shirts, etc. She also plans to buy her own motorcycle so that she can go to other villages to sell her merchandise in a more convenient and faster way.  She hopes that her business will prosper for the education of her children.

“I have a positive mindset that I can earn more income if I could add other varieties of clothes aside from what I have right now,” Tesmarie she said.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for sale and a motorcycle to be used for her business

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun K., 33, and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Chea, 36, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1995 and have two children: one son who attends school and one daughter who is a silk weaver. Besides her children, Mrs Savoeun K. also has one sister living with her.

Savoeun has been a silk weaver for eight years, a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a mason for about seven years. Savoeun is requesting her first loan of US$ 1100 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and to buy a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and buy a motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo O. is divorced and the father of one child. He is a 35-year-old businessman. He owns a boutique and sells men’s wear such as suits, shirts and trousers, shoes, belts, and caps. He has been in business for the past fifteen years.

O. says he purchases his stock from major wholesale outlets in Accra. He wants to inject more working capital into his business to enable him to purchase bulk quantities during his trips. With the loan, he believes he could have the resources to purchase good quality stock to satisfy his customers. He hopes that he can increase his profit margin substantially to enable him to support his family, especially the education of his child.

O. is in a group called Strong Trust Bank in his community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To procure men’s wear for re-sale

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander B. sells various home products at the central market in Melitopol city. He has been in business for 10 years. He enjoys selling small things that help make home chores easier. Alexander is a very happy and enthusiastic person. With his income, he helps his sisters and their parents whom he lives in one big house. He is not married.

Alexander would like to get a loan of 5,000 UAH to increase his inventories. He always tries to have a large assortment of small home products to offer something to each client that comes his way.

loans.use: To increase his inventories

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes D. dreams of a simple life that is fulfilled and satisfied. She is 43 years old, married and resides at Poblacion 2, Oroquieta City. She has three children. She wants to give all of her support to her children, who are presently studying. Her husband is a laborer. 

Because of her husband’s unstable income, she has found ways to sustain the needs of her family. She spends most of her time working, working and working. Fortunately, her eldest child works in a famous restaurant in the city and helps her with their daily expenses.  

At present, she is thinking of venturing into pig raising. In order to have working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in August 2008. Now, she is applying for PHP10,000(US$225) to buy piglets and feed. In the future, she will be fulfilled and contented if all her children will have successful careers and obtain a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Galulolo

texts.en: Galulolo I., 26, is married with two children.  She is just starting a shop.  She sells to the village people and general public, six days per week.  She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~120 USD).  SPBD loans are Galulolo’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  She will use her loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, salt, and other goods to replace all items inside her business.  She also hopes to improve her home.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for a shop

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié avec une femme qui est ménagère, il a 02 enfants et réside avec sa famille dans le quartier de Tokoin WUITI, il a appris la maçonnerie, mais le revenu de ce métier étant insuffisant pour couvrir les charges de sa famille alors il fabrique à base du ciment des briques, des claustras, des paves, des balustres pour vendre. il a reçu de ses clients 02 commandes, pour les satisfaire, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de ciment, convoyer 02 camions de graviers, 01 camion de sable et divers autres matières.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married to a woman who is a housewife. He has two children and reside with his family in the Tokoin WUITI district. He learned masonry, but the revenues from this trade are insufficient for covering family expenses. So he makes cement blocks, screen-walls, paving blocks, and balusters for sale. He has received two orders from customers. To satisfy them, he's requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy ten sacks of cement, two truck-loads of gravel, one truck-load of sand, and various other materials.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, gravel, sand

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La señora Mary Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos; Posee estudios superiores incompletos (educación).  Vive en la Av. De la Cultura pasaje Buena Vista.
Trabaja desde hace 1 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Con su primer préstamo de S/ 500.00 inició su negocio de preparación y elaboración de comidas al paso.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos soles podrá ampliar su negocio de venta de comidas al paso, comprará insumos para elaborar sandwich de pollo, de chorizo y otros; de esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos;  así mismo quiere terminar la construcción de su casa.
Le gustan mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, el compañerismo entre las socias y la puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is a member of the Las Fronterizas community bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 36, married, and has two children. She went to high school, but she did not finish. She lives on Av. De la Cultura, Pasaje Buena Vista. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. With her first loan for 500 PEN she started her business of making and selling takeout food. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will be able to expand her takeout food business. She will buy supplies for making chicken sandwiches, sausage sandwiches, and others. By doing this she will contribute to improving the quality of her children’s education. For herself, she would like to finish the construction of her house. She really likes the community bank’s meetings, the camaraderie between members, and the punctuality of their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, potatoes, eggs, vegetables, bread, noodles

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Mr. Chou H. is 60 years old and is married to Mrs. Mom Houn (pictured). They have one child. Chou H. generates his daily income by working as a furniture maker. He usually buys wood to make tables, chairs, and windows and sells them for a profit. On the other hand, he also has been hired by neighbors in order to build their house. As another income source, his wife works selling Khmer noodles in the village. Chou H. hopes to earn additional income by raising pigs because he has previous experience in this activity. Due to the lack of capital, he has decided to seek a loan from Kiva in order to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Progreso Y Conciliacion #1 Group

texts.en:
Andrea (pictured on the far left wearing blue) has five children and lives in a small town in Consuelo named “Barrio 15”. It can get quite confusing, really fast, when you travel within Consuelo. The dirt roads are very narrow and not named, but are just the perfect size for motoconchos (taxi motorcycles) to ride in. The motoconcho drivers have to make sure they accurately dodge the kids and animals playing outside. If you are lost, you can usually easily find your way by asking the friendly community members, everyone knows each other and can direct you without a problem. 

Andrea has requested a loan to purchase new women’s clothes, sheets, and comforters. She particularly states that she wants to buy women’s intimate apparel as she is currently running low. She has been doing this business for 12 years and is very experienced with it. This is her third consecutive loan with Esperanza but she says that she used to borrow from Esperanza eight years ago. Andre says that her life has changed dramatically after she became an Esperanza client. Now she has a lot of material goods that she never dreamed she could purchase. She proudly confesses, “life keeps on getting better”. Andrea hopes to always manage a successful business and aspires to see her children succeed in life. 

Support Andrea and her team of entrepreneurs achieve their goals. Thank you.

loans.use: Purchase of women's clothes, sheets, and comforters.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa L. is from Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54, married and has 4 adult children.  Rosa owns & operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling cosmetics in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Rosa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Rosa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma C. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is 38 years old. Wilma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business providing repair services to local community members. Wilma is just starting this business.

In 2002, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena D. is from Bacolod, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. She is married to Chris D. and blessed with four school-aged children.

Rowena operates a business buying and selling t-shirts, pants and other Ready To Wear items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately of 2,000 Philippine pesos a month. 

In March 2009, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC.

Rowena is requesting a new loan of 3,000.00 PHP, which will be used to purchase more items to sell. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Ready To Wear clothing business

loans.name: José Laureano

texts.es:
El señor José Laureano V. es propietario de una panadería el cual posee desde hace 30 largos años habiendo dedicado parte de su vida a esta actividad y habiendo adquirido mucha experiencia en el negocio.

Es importante destacar que el señor V. ha sobresalido en su negocio y sus clientes le visitan para comprarle el pan que el prepara tal como pan simple y pan dulce siendo vendido a diario en su establecimiento. Espera en que Ceprodel le brinde el crédito y así continuar elaborando el delicioso pan para su venta.
texts.en:
Mr. José Laureano V. is the owner of a bakery which he has had for 30 long years, having dedicated part of his life to this activity and having acquired significant experience in the business. It is important to note that Mr. V. has had great success in his business and his clients visit him to buy all the bread that he prepares, from plain bread to sweet bread, which he sells daily in his establishment. He hopes to receive the loan so that he can continue to create delicious bread to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Mujeres De Chilcato Tora (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres de Chilcato Tora se encuentra ubicado en la parroquia Tarquí a unos 30 minutos  a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, Tarquí se caracteriza por sus llanuras siendo el  sector  más productivo de leche y ganado vacuno, su clima es frió y la mayoría de su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, la mayor parte de la población joven han emigrado a diferentes partes del mundo para darles a sus familias estabilidad económica. Sus socias con el carisma que les caracteriza nos brindan sus historias.

La señora Delia Eudocia V. V. vive en la comunidad de Chilcato Tora en  la parroquia Tarquí, es socia del Banco Comunal del nombre de su comunidad, ella tiene 55 años de edad,  se encuentra casada, concibió siete  hijos de los cuales no recuerda las edades ya que todos son mayores de edad y casados,  sólo se acuerda de su última hija de 27 años que es  la única soltera, tres de sus hijos casados viven en su casa y le ayudan económicamente de vez en cuando porque  tienen sus propias responsabilidades en su hogar, su esposo es agricultor y con el trabajo en su juventud lograron construir su casa.

Delia se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene uso de razón, siembra coles, lechugas, nabos,  etc., cría gallinas y vende sus huevos, tiene dos terneritos los está criando para luego venderlos, también tiene una tienda pequeña pero aun le hace falta muchos víveres.

Dentro de su banco comunal  todas las socias  son muy buenas amigas a mas de ser de la misma comunidad se conocen desde hace varios años. Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideosm, etc.  para surtir su tienda.

Su sueño es ya no tener más deudas pues hasta la fecha está ayudando a su hijo que viajo al extranjero a pagar los gastos incurridos para su viaje.

La señora  María Tránsito P. C. es  otra socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres de Chilcato Tora, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre de su banco comunal en la parroquia Tarquí, tiene 65 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su amor  procreó cinco hijos, no recuerda las edades de sus hijos, solo de su último hijo que tiene 25 años es soltero y aún vive con ella, su esposo no trabaja porque le dio alergia al polvo de cemento impidiéndole realizar sus actividades laborales,  ella con su cónyuge lograron construir una casita pequeña de adobe, su situación económica es baja y toda la comunidad lo sabe, también le detectaron diabetes hace cinco años y ahora debe cuidarse mucho para no tener una recaída en su salud.

María se dedica a la cría de pollos hace poco tiempo, también tiene una vaca su leche vende a los carros lecheros del sector pero le pagan muy barato, nos manifiesta que es su primer crédito en la fundación y todas sus amigas le apoyaron para que ingrese y trate de salir adelante con los beneficios que otorga la Fundación a sus socias, con el préstamo que ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en su criadero comprando mas pollos, alimento y vitaminas para su crecimiento de esta manera incrementar su negocio y  tener un ingreso seguro para solventar sus gastos de medicinas y del hogar.

Su sueño es ver que todos sus hijos se superen personal y económicamente.

La señora Teresa Elvira  C. C. vive en la comunidad de Chilcato Tora, en la parroquia Tarquí, es socia del Banco Comunal del mismo nombre de su comunidad, tiene 47 años de edad, casada y concibió seis hijos de:24, 22, 20, 14, 11, 9 años de edad, su primera hija estudia corte y confección en una academia a distancia, la segunda hija ya es casada y vive independiente, su hijo de 20 años trabaja en la construcción pero todo el dinero es solo para sus gastos, mientras que sus tres últimos hijos aún son estudiantes de escuela y colegio. Su esposo migró al exterior para darles un futuro mejor y gracias a ello han logrado construir su casa propia.

Teresa se dedica a la agricultura y es más para el consumo de su hogar, también a la crianza de animales, vacas lecheras, chanchos, pollos, etc, que los vende en la comunidad, 

Este es su primer crédito en la fundación y su expectativa es mejorar su situación económica y la de su familia, con el préstamo que  la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a invertir en la compra de más animales como: pollos y chanchos, comida  y vitaminas para su crianza.

Su meta es llegar a tener un gran criadero y  ser una gran comerciante de animales.
texts.en:
The Chilcato Tora Communal Bank is located in the Tarquí parish 30 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca. Tarquí is characterized by its plains, and it is the sector that produces the most milk and dairy livestock. Its climate is cold. Most of the people work in agriculture and livestock. A large part of the population of youths has immigrated to different parts of the world to give their families economic stability. The members, with their characteristic charisma, tell us their stories. Delia Eudocial V. V. lives in the Chilcato Tora community in the Tarquí parish. She is a member of the communal bank with the same name as her community. She is 55, married, and has seven children. She does not remember their ages because they are all adults and married. She only remembers that her last daughter is 27, and she is the only one that is single. Three of her married children live in her house and help economically once in a while. They have their own responsibilities in the home. Her husband is a farmer, and through his work in his youth they were able to build a house. Delia has been a farmer ever since she was young. She plants cabbage, lettuce, and turnips, etc. She raises hens and sells their eggs. She has two calves, and she is raising them to later sell. She also has a small store, but she is lacking a lot of supplies. Within the communal bank the members are very good friends. They are from the same community, and they have known each other for several years. This is her first loan with the foundation. She will buy products like rice, sugar, oil, and noodles, etc. to better stock her store. Her dream is to have no more debts. She is now helping her son who traveled abroad to pay the expenses he incurred on his trip. María Tránsito P. C. is another member of the Mujeres de Chilcato Tora Communal Bank. She lives in the community that has the same name as her bank in the Tarquí parish. She is 65, married, and has five children. She does not remember the ages of her children. She only remembers the age of her last child who is 25, single, and still lives with her. Her husband does not work because he became allergic to the cement dust. This stopped him from doing his work. She and her husband built a small adobe house. Their economic situation is down, and all of the community knows it. Also, she was diagnosed with diabetes five years ago. Now she has to take very good care of herself to not have a relapse in her health. María has been raising chickens for a short time. She also has a cow, and she sells her milk to the milk carts in the area. But, they pay very little. This is her first loan with the foundation. All of her friends supported her joining, and she tries to get ahead with the benefits the foundation offers their members. With this loan from ESPOIR she will buy more chickens, food, and vitamins for their growth. This way she will expand her business and have a secure income to pay the medication and household expenses. Her dream is to see all of her children succeed personally and economically. Teresa Elvira C. C. lives in the Chilcato Tora community in the Tarquí parish. She is a member of the communal bank with the same name as her community. She is 47, married, and has six children; ages 24, 22, 20, 14, 11, and 9. Her first daughter is studying dressmaking at an open academy. Her second daughter is married and lives independently. Her 20 year old son works in construction, but all of the money is only for his expenses. Her last three children are still in school. Her husband migrated to the exterior to give them a better future. Thanks to that, they have been able to build their own house. Terese is a farmer; most of her crops are for household consumption. She also raises animals like dairy cows, pigs, and chickens, etc. She sells them in the community. This is her first loan with the foundation. She hopes to improve her economic situation and that of her family. With the loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy more animals like chickens and pigs, food, and vitamins to take care of them. Her goal is to have a large farm and to be a great animal merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic products like rice, sugar, oil, seeds for planting, animals like chickens, pigs, food, and vitamins for their care

loans.name: Trần Thị's Group

texts.en:
Huệ Trần Thị (10114070013) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà Nội. Huệ is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cổ Dương 2 (1).

Huệ is married and has two adult children. She works in a family business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2003, Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,148,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Huệ is now requesting a new loan of 3,706,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 9th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Lê Thị Lý (10114070014) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

2. Ngô Thị N. (10114070015) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

3. Dương Thị H. (10114070012) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 4,142,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.


About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*****************************************************
Huệ Trần Thị (10114070013) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà Nội. Huệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cổ Dương 2 (1).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch rau quả để bán. Huệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2003, Huệ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Huệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6,148,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua hạt giống bổ sung, cây giống & cây con để trồng. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,706,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 9th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Lê Thị Lý (10114070014) là 43 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Ngô Thị N. (10114070015) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

3. Dương Thị H. (10114070012) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,142,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Domitila

texts.en:
Domitila N. is 36 years old and is married without children. She lives with her parents in Burera district, in the Northern Province of Rwanda where she recently opened a foodstuffs shop.

Domitila has an experience of three years in this career of selling potatoes. Her small shop is open every day from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. .

Domitila is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase more potatoes that will help her to serve more customers. Through this service, she hopes to earn more profit than previously.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old and she has been engaged in a hog raising business for almost ten years. Her net income, when she sells one hog is PHP 2,500. She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, that she will use to purchase hog feeds.
Thelma is married to Jaime P., who works as a farmer. They are blessed with four children, three boys and one girl. Two of her children are already married and the other two are still single. Their house is  downstream, near an irrigation canal. Thelma hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan. She hopes to have a fruitful income to be able to pay for the medication of her daughter who is mentally ill.

loans.use: Additional investment in her livestock business

loans.name: Mandah

texts.en:
G. Mandakh is 53 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Khovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His oldest daughter currently operates a shoe-making business, his two youngest daughters are secondary school students, and his only son is two years old.

Mandakh operates a second-hand clothes business in his town. He purchases used clothing from Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's largest city and capital, and transports it back to his province to sell. Mandakh started his business in 2004 and has built a stable operation over the years. He is a very open-minded and hardworking person and has used his business to provide a good life for his family.

Mandakh hopes to continue his success and plans to expand his business in the near future. He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase second-hand clothes for his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is married with 4 children. She is 43 years old. She sells sarongs and laces of various attractive colors to make a living. She also has another stall where she sells groceries. This is the high season for business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She uses her experience in the business to attract more customers to her stall. She loves this business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase sarongs or laces. She needs a loan of 180,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea E. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is the mother of four children: one is a construction worker while the others are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Hor Hing, helps her with the farm. They live in Chambak Tuem village in Takeo province. 
Mrs. Sophea E. faces an obstacle with her plantation because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer or gasoline to pump water to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy these materials. She wants to use the rest of her loan to buy pesticides to kill the insects. 
Her husband is present on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticides

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou T. est une femme de 64 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de banc Villageois depuis 4 ans et demi. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine. son objectif est de participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aïssatou T. is a 64-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for 3½ years. She fattens cows and sheep. Her goal is to help with the various family responsibilities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business fattening cattle

loans.name: Wilbert Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Wilbert M. se ha dedicado a trabajar en un centro de labores donde se esfuerza para obtener los ingresos que le permitan el mantenimiento de su casa de habitación que está compuesta por su cónyuge y su hijo.
El señor Wilbert, como todo padre responsable, está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda ya que al haber estado en condiciones malas, el señor Wilbert la ha venido mejorando poco a poco. El crédito lo utilizará en la compra de zinc,  clavos, perlines, entre otros y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de vida de su familia que tanto depende de él.
texts.en:
Wilbert M. works at a worksite in the Chinandega department. He puts forth the effort in order to get the income that allows him to support his household, which is comprised of his life partner and their son. Wilbert, like all responsible fathers, is asking for a loan to buy construction materials for his house because it is in bad condition. Wilbert has been improving it little by little. He will use the loan to buy zinc, nails, beams, and other things. This way he will improve the living conditions for his family that depends on him so much.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Prak S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She sells desserts at her home, earning approximately an income $2 per day.  She has been in business since 2009. 

Prak is able to cover her family expenses, especially the children’s education costs.  Her husband is a civil servant, earning an income of $2 per day.  Prak wants a loan of $500 to expand her business and to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner. (Prak is pictured with her husband)

loans.use: Buy a motorbike and cows.

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khun T. is the group leader of five people in Thnuoh village in Takeo province. The members will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Khun T. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Seng Suor, is a construction worker.

Although they try to work hard they still earn less income than needed to support the family and they cannot provide better conditions for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Khun T. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for the family.

Mrs. Khun T. is the mother of four children, one of whom is a garment worker while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To add to her saving to build a new house for the family

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mr. Soun M., 58 (is in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Vanda Vuth, 51, have been married since 1979. They have six children; four sons and two daughters. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, two work in the garment factory and another one assists his father in the business. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Soun has been growing mushrooms since 2006 and his wife is a cleaner. He is requesting his first loan of $300 to use for growing mushrooms.

loans.use: To use for growing mushrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell on a larger scale

loans.name: Guillermo José

texts.es:
El Señor Guillermo G. R., labora para el centro de insumos para la salud, el tiene a su cargo tres  hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar,  es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante 18 meses, en ese lapso ha invertido  dos créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio de piso de la vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor Guillermo G. R., labora para el centro de insumos para la salud, el tiene a su cargo tres hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante 18 meses, en ese lapso ha invertido dos créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio de piso de la vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de Vivienda y Ampliación.

loans.name: Gloria Emelina

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Emelina S. A. tiene 49 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Cabaña de la ciudad de Choluteca, Gloria se dedica al servicio de venta de comida y bebida, hace pollos fritos y los vende con tortillas o pan blanco.
este tipo de comida es muy bien vendida ya que muchas personas consumen pollo casi todos los dias por ser un alimento nutritivo y de menor costo que la carne de res.
tiene muchos clientes y esto es por el sabor que Gloria les da a sus pollos fritos, tiene un toque secreto para condimentar los pollos.
las ventas son buenas en el almuerzo y la cena.
muchas personas prefieren comprar el pollo frito entero y llevarlo a sus casas para comerlo con sus familias.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas pollos, aceite, refrescos y otros materiales para hacer su comida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria Emilina is 49 years old and lives in the Cabaña barrio of the city of Choluteca. Gloria sells meals and drinks, and makes fried chicken and sells it with tortillas or white bread. This type of food sells very well since many people eat chicken almost every day, because it is a nutritious food and cheaper than beef. Gloria has many customers and this is due to the flavor that she gives to fried chicken. She has a secret recipe for seasoning her chicken. Sales are best at lunch and supper. Many people prefer to buy a whole fried chicken and take it home to eat with their families. The loan will be used to buy more chickens, cooking oil, soft drinks and other materials to make her meals

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CHICKENS, COOKING OIL, CONDIMENTS, TORTILLAS, BREAD, AND SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora L. is from the village of Brgy.San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 53 years old. Adora is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Adora owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Adora has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Luís Marcelo

texts.es:
Luís Marcelo A. R. tiene 25 años de edad y vive en unión libre, en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene una hija de 1 año: Dóminique Nicole.

Luís es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.
