Luís se dedica a la agricultura, en la siembra de maíz, y también trabaja como empleado publico. Realiza las compras en San Pablo y las ventas a los comerciantes en el terreno. 

Luís solicita el préstamo para la implementación y el mejoramiento de un centro de computadores y cabinas telefónicas. Dice que el crédito le ayudaría mucho para realizar la compra de mercadería para el local de computadoras y cabinas. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y adquirir más computadores.

Los desafíos que el enfrenta es la competencia con los demás locales comerciales. 

Su hobby es practicar deportes como indoor fútbol y voleibol.
texts.en:
Luis Marcelo A. R. is 25 years old and lives in a common-law-marriage in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. He has a 1 year old daughter: Dóminique Nicole. Luís is a member of the rural Santiagopamba window, located in San Pablo, a half hour from the town of San Miguel. The people in this window work in agriculture, as it is a source of income for their families. Luís works in agriculture, in planting corn and also works as a public employee. He makes purchases in San Pablo and makes sales to traders in the field. Luís is seeking a loan for the implementation and improvement of a center for computers and telephones. He says that the loan would help him greatly to purchase goods for local computers and cubicles. His goal is to grow the business and acquire more computers. The challenge he faces is competition with other commercial locations. His hobby is playing sports such as indoor soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the implementation and improvement of a center for computers and telephone cubicles

loans.name: Cry For Help Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Cry for Help” group. They are small scale businesswomen in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 2,200,000 leones. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. 

The leader of this group is Isatu K.. Isatu was born in Yoni, a village in Northern Sierra Leone. She is 45 years old, married to a businessman and they have four children. Isatu sells household utensils like dishes, pots, stoves, rubber bowls, etc. She has been in this business for eight years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will be able to buy her goods wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy household utensils like dishes, pots, stoves, rubber bowls, etc.

loans.name: Melsie

texts.en:
Melsie G. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old. Melsie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Melsie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling used-clothing or ukay-ukay in the local community. Melsie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Melsie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk S. is a widow with three sons and three daughters: three are married and live in separate homes, two work in Phnom Penh City and one attends school.

Mrs. Thouk S. has asked for a Kiva loan once before to purchase weaving materials (cotton thread) for her weaving business. She is applying for her second loan of $400 to make repairs to her house. It is it difficult for the family to live in it since it is old and broken in some parts.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a toilet and sink to install new facilites in her little salon, thus giving better attention to her customers.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, D. 41 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía D. su esposo Rubén D. 48 años y D. sus 3 hijos que son mayores D. edad. Cuando su hija mayor decidió instalar en su casa el servicio D. alquiler D. cabinas para ofrecer el servicio D. Internet, ella vio  la oportunidad D. empezar a ofrecer golosinas y gaseosas en ese negocio, para así generarse ingresos extras. Tiempo después comenta que le esta yendo muy bien, además se turna en el horario D. atención con su hija, luego  se reparten las ganancias regulares que se obtienen del negocio. Además le gusta mucho este trabajo  porque es tranquilo y lo realiza  en la comodidad D. su hogar. Como si fuera poco, también se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo D. una reconocida marca mundial, pero solo les venD. a sus amigas y conocidas. Además tiene muchos planes por concretar para el futuro, es por esta razón que tiene pensado instalar una pequeña tienda, junto al negocio D. su hija. Es el sétimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luz tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. gaseosas y golosinas para implementar mejor el negocio que tiene en las cabinas D. Internet D. su hija, D. esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz, 41, lives in her own house with her husband Rubén, 48, and their three adult children. When her older daughter decided to set up rental booths in her house to offer Internet service, Luz saw the opportunity to begin offering snacks and soft drinks at that business to generate some extra income. Some time later she says that it is going very well for her. She also alternates shifts with her daughter, and they diviD. the regular earnings that they obtain from the business. She also likes this work very much because it is peaceful, and she carries it out in the comfort of her home. As if that were not enough, she sells beauty products by catalog from a globally recognized brand, but she only sells them to her friends and neighbors. She also has many plans to settle for the future. For this reason she is thinking of installing a small shop next to her daughter's business. This is her seventh loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments punctually. She is also very grateful to all the people who maD. possible the loan that allows her to continue working in search of progress. Luz plans to invest the requested loan to buy more soft drinks and snacks to better stock the business that she has at her daughter's Internet booths. In this way she hopes to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and snacks to stock her business

loans.name: Meach

texts.en: Meach P. is 54 years old and lives with three children in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a widow and has a business weaving mats to sell at the local market. She has been operating this business since 2000 and is able to make about $1 US of profit a day. She is also supported by her children who are workers. This family spends $40 on food, $20 on transportation, and $10 on other expense. Meach P. is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase cows to plow farmland. (Meach P. is pictured with her son from home.)

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow farmland.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana F. is from the village of Dalumpinas, Sapang Dalaga. She is 43 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Susana raises hogs. Susana has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Susana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susana is requesting her first loan of 3,500 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for hog raising. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo Y. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 55 years old, married and has 5 adult children. Ricardo owns & operates a business venture, catching and selling ocean caught fish like milkfish, sardines, mackerel and tuna. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ricardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en: Twenty-five people make up this village loan group. Mrs. Khen L. is a 48-year-old married woman and the group's president, having been selected by its members. They live in Tuol Sophi village in Kandal province. L. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. She also works as a farm laborer. Her husband, Mr. Lors Heng, 44, works as a motorbike taxi driver. They are able to earn a small income but in order to increase it and improve the family's living conditions, they want to start a business breeding fish. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy the baby fish and nets for fish raising. The couple has two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy baby fish and nets for fish raising.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda Nidar F. is a married woman who lives in Purok Croton's A, Brgy Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Antonio F., who is 39 years old, works as selling fish to earn his living. They have 2 children who are 10 and 12 years old.

Rosalinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase a fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements. Rosalinda Nidar F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase motorized boat.

loans.name: The Shameem Muhamad Nasir Group

texts.en:
Shameem lives in Multan, the fourth largest city in Pakistan and a city that is famous for its shrines and sweetmeat. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in an area named Chowk shaheedan. Shameem came to this area after her marriage with M. N. 12 years ago. 

Shameem’s husband operates a spare parts business and sells parts for different vehicles. His shop is located in the market and he earns a regular monthly income. Shameem supports her family by doing embroidery. She is very good at this art and, since her work is of such good quality, she receives regular orders. She is also a housewife and has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Two of her children are enrolled in school to get an education, while the third one is free and doesn’t do anything. 

Shameen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. She is a new Asasah client and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her. With the loan, her husband will buy custom spare parts to meet customer demand and increase his sales. He has been doing this business for many years and has a good customer base. Customers approach him because he is a good dealer who sells genuine parts for very reasonable prices.

loans.use: to buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.en:
Jose is forty-three years old.  He lives in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.  Many families have small fruit plantations or raise animals.  Jose owns his home.  He lives with his young wife and their one-year-old daughter.

In the mornings Jose works as a farm hand on local plots of land of larger land owners.  He earns about $7 daily in this activity.  In addition, Jose maintains corrals near his home in which he and his wife raise sheep, hogs and fowl.  They raise the animals until they reach the appropriate size and weight to be sold in local markets or to neighbors.

Jose plans to use the loan to make improvements to his corrals and purchase additional feed for his animals.  He hopes these investments will improve the general health of his herd and increase the production of his farm.  He dreams of increasing his family’s income so that he can provide for the education of his child and better his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To make improvements to his corrals and purchase additional feed for his animals.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda L. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: tobacco sales, pig fattening and coffee sales. She lives in Brgy. 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her three businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Merlinda is now borrowing PHP 30,000 in order to fund the operations of her tobacco business. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlinda hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operations of her tobacco business

loans.name: Odixa Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

La señora Odixa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos a podido ir creciendo en su negocio y por ende mejorando su calidad de vida. Tiene  39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos, uno  de 20 y una niña de 10 años que estudian en Universidad y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la cría de pollos.

Ella junto a su esposos se dedican a la cría de pollos, nos cuenta que venden hasta 200 pollos por mes, los mismos que los tienen por dos meses para luego faenarlos y llevarlos a entregar a las tiendas de la localidad y de Portoviejo, trabajan todos los días en la alimentación y cuidados para tener una buena producción ya que dice que estos animalitos requieren de muchos cuidados porque si no podrían tener muchas pérdidas ya que estos son muy delicados, pero nos cuenta que gracias a Dios nunca han tenido muchas pérdidas.
p>
Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para tener una buena producción. Sus sueños son tener un carro para transportar sus productos y las compras que realizan todos los meses.
texts.en:
In the parish on Portoviejo street, the members of the Crucita Communal Bank meet. The area is known for its beautiful beaches that surround this lovely place and are frequented by local and foreign tourists who know the locale as Crucita la Bella.

Odixa is the founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to grow her business and improve her quality of life. She is 39 years old. She is married, and from this marriage she has two children: a son who is 20 and a daughter who is 10 years old. They are studying at the university and at school. Her husband raises chickens.

She and her husband raise chickens. She tells us that they sell up to 200 chickens a month. They have these chickens for two months so they can later slaughter them and take them to the local markets and the Portoviejo market. They work every day feeding and taking care of the chickens so they can have good production. She says that these little animals need a lot of care because if they are not cared for there can be many losses because the chickens are delicate. But she tells us that thanks to God, they have never lost many.

This loan is for buying chickens, feed, and medicines so they can have good production. Her dream is to have a car to transport her products and the purchases that they have every month.

loans.use: Buy chickens, feed, and medicines

loans.name: Renzo Edemir

texts.es:
Renzo, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su familia, su esposa y una hija de un año de edad, solo él trabaja para cubrir los gastos del hogar, su edad es de 22 años, Renzo comenzó solo como observador del comercio de cerdos, negocio que le gusto ya que tiene al frente de su vivienda el tiangue donde se comercializa animales (ganado, cerdos), debido a la necesidad de obtener un negocio comenzó comprando cerdos para comercializarlos, también aprendió albañilería que al igual se dedica por tiempos a este trabajo.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para mejorar el piso de su casa,  los materiales a usar serán arena, cemento y ladrillo, con este préstamo espera adquirir todo lo antes mencionado para realizar el trabajo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ya que estarán en un hogar con mejores condiciones y mejor vistosidad.
Para él su mayor deseo es trabajar con mucho entusiasmo logrando vivir con su familia de una forma ordenada y digna, sin pasar dificultades grandes.
texts.en:
Renzo lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel. He lives with his family, his wife and a one-year old daughter. He works exclusively to provide for the household expenses. He is 22 years old. Renzo started out raising pigs and the he liked the work especially because the place were they sell the livestock (cattle and pigs) is right in front of his house. He saw the need to start a business so he bought pigs to resell them. He also learned construction work and he takes on this work at the same time as the other business. 

He requests a loan to purchase construction materials to improve the flooring of his house. The materials he will use include sand, cement, and bricks. This loan will let him acquire the indicated materials for the project and to improve the quality of life for his family. They will be able to live in a house that is in better conditions and more pleasing to the eye. 

His greatest goal is to keep working with enthusiasm in order to keep life with his family orderly and dignified, without having major problems.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married lady, with three children between 4 and 16 years.  She runs Joe's Babycare Centre.  Besides this, she makes and sells detergents for extra income.  She was previously selling clothes for a living.  Her business is eight years old and she has employed three people.  She has witnessed a lot of growth in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She has requested for 50, 000 Kes to pay school fees to her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora vive por la Zona de Viloma Grande, a 25 Km de la ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona de Sipe Sipe, ella se dedica a la produccion de leche cruda y a la agricultura, cultivando de cebolla, zanahoria y maiz. Tiene 3 hijos pequeños. de 12, 7 y 5 años, que asisten a la escuela, en la misma zona. Su concubino la abandono hace tres años. Ahora  viven solos en su casa y Dora siempre a buscado la forma de sustentar su hogar; ahora trabaja dentro del proyeto que trabaja con el embolsado de plantas, han creado un nuevo proyecto que les ayudara, este proyecto consiste en la cria y engorde de conejos, este proyecto les construira la granja y los afiliados deberan comprar los conejos, para esta inversion es por la que se apersono la Sra Dora porque ella conoce de este negocio y sabe que le rendira muy buenos resultados.

Con esta actividad mas la sra. Dora podra generar mas ingresos para su familia, esta señora es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora con el tiempo lograra todos sus sueños, que sus hijo terminen el colegio y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Dora lives in the Viloma Grande zone, which is 25 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba in the Sipe Sipe municipality.  She devotes herself to producing raw milk and to farming.  She grows onions, carrots, and corn.  She has three young children, ages 12, 7, and 5.  They go to school in the zone where they live.  Her common-law husband left her three years ago.

Now they live alone in her house.  Dora has always looked for the way to support her household.  She now works on a project that works with packaging plants.  They have created a new project, which will help them.  This project consists of raising and fattening rabbits.  This project will build the farm, and the affiliates need to buy the rabbits.

This investment is why Dora came to us.  She knows about this business, and she knows that it will give her very good results.  With this additional business activity Dora will be able to generate more income for her family.  She is a very enterprising and hard-working woman.  In time she will achieve all of her dreams, which are that her children finish school and become successful people.

loans.use: Capital to invest in a rabbit farm

loans.name: River Breezes Group

texts.es:
el grupo Brisas del Rio esta ubicado en el Barrio Arenas de la ciudad de Choluteca, lo integran tres mujeres, todas se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y son muy buenas amigas, trabajan duro para salir adelante con sus familias.
A continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

doña Maria A. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. elabora sus tortillas en su casa de habitacion.
Maria es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando, junto con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para producir sus ricas tortillas.  sus tiempos libres lo dedica a visitar iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la produccion de las tortillas. 

doña Felix M. es una mujer trabajadora y que se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas desde hace 7 años.
Felix es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales los tiene en la escuela de su comunidad, ademas cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja de albanil.
sus tiempos libres lo dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.

doña Emerita M. se dedica a la venta de baleadas en diferentes barrios de la ciudad de Choluteca, Emerita es madre de 2 hijos, los cuales estan pequeños de edad. 
Emerita cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja en una empresa de seguridad. 
sus hijos los tiene en el kinder.
en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las baleadas.

Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y con muchos deseos de salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group named Brisas del Rio, meaning River Breezes, is located in the community of Arenas in the city of Choluteca. It is made up of three women who have known each other for a long time and they are very good friends. They work hard to provide for their families. 

In following paragraphs are the details of the different businesses they have: 

Mrs. Maria A. is an enterprising woman who sells tortillas. She has 6 years in the business. She makes her tortillas at home. Maria is the mother of 4 children, all of whom she has kept in school. Together with her husband she works hard to provide for her children. She starts every day at 5 in the morning to make delicious tortillas. In her spare time she visits her church. 

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients to make tortillas.

Mrs. Felix M. is a hardworking woman who has been making and selling tortillas for the past 7 years. 

Felix is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are in the community school.  She has her husband’s support and he works as a construction worker.

In her spare time she raises poultry and pigs.

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients to make tortillas.

Mrs. Emerita M. has been selling baleadas (traditional Honduran food) in various communities of the city of Choluteca. Emerita is the mother of 2 young children. 

Emerita has her husband's support and he works in a security company.  Her children are in kindergarten. In her spare time she visits her church. 

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients to make baleadas. 

They are defiant women who are eager to get ahead and to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth M. is from the village of Yumbing, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Ruth is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals like afritada, caldereta, bulalo and humba to customers in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ruth joined Kiva's partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ruth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients like meat, vegetables and spices. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Ruth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients like meat, vegetables and spices for her restaurant

loans.name: Roly Edson

texts.es: Roly tiene 23  años es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con una moto taxi que da en alquiler a su hermano, el vehiculo lo adquirió con ahorros producto de su trabajo como obrero de construcción civil , esta actividad la sigue desempeñando en la actualidad , lo que le pagan por el alquiler de su moto taxi es de s/ 25.00 soles diario y lo que gana como obrero es s/300 soles semanal su meta en el futuro es terminar de construir la casa de su padres para tener una mayor comodidad, aun no la pueden terminar por que requiere un capital mayor el cual aun no lo tiene; el dinero será invertido en darle mantenimiento a su moto taxi cambio de aceite pintado entre otros , roly esta muy agradecido por la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Roly, 23, lives in his parents’ house.  He has a mototaxi that he leases to his brother.  He acquired the vehicle with savings from his job as a laborer in civil construction, a job he still has. 

He is paid a 25 sol daily rental fee for his mototaxi and he earns 300 soles per week as a construction worker.  His goal for the future is to finish building his parents’ house in order to have more comfort.  They haven’t been able to finish it yet because he needs a larger amount of capital that he doesn’t yet have.

The money will be used for mototaxi maintenance: to change the oil and paint it, among other things.

Roly is very grateful for the trust being placed in him.

loans.use: to change the oil and paint his motoraxi.

loans.name: Bendiara Group

texts.fr:
Mme Amsétou est la responsable du groupe BENDIARA. Elle est mariée, mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. Tous les 04 enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 07 personnes à sa charge.

Amsétou vend du savon, comme activités connexes des cartes de recharge et un secrétariat public. Elle mène cette activité depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du  secteur 08 en ville. Ses clients sont les voisins et les passagers.

Mme veut s’acheter 04 cartons de savon et des fournitures de bureau pour sa secrétariat.

Elle veut utiliser ses économies pour pouvoir fabriquer elle-même son savon. Elle a pour ambition de créer sa propre entreprise de savon, surtout fabriquer les savons antiseptiques et d’employer des gens pour l’aider. Mme veut payer  la scolarité de ses enfants et subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amsétou is in charge of the BENDIARA group. She is married with four children. The eldest is 23 and the youngest 14. All four children go to school. She is supporting seven people. 

Mrs. Amsétou sells soap and also rechargeable phone cards and office supplies. She has been in this business for 12 years. She buys her inventory in the marketplace in Sector 8 of the town. Her customers are neighbors and passers-by. 

Amsétou wants to buy four cartons of soap and office supplies for resale. 

She wants to use her savings to manufacture her own soap. Her ambition is to create her own soap factory, in particular to make antiseptic soap and hire some people to help her. She wants to pay her children's school fees and be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy four cartons of soap and some office supplies for resale.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson P. is from the village of Sto. Niño. He is 42 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Nelson owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Nelson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Katiba

texts.en:
Katiba is a married woman with four children. Three of her children attend school and one graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a café business, cooking chapatti (flat bread, beans and rice). Katiba also makes natural fruit juice for sale, which contributes to her other source of income. Her potential customers are local villagers and students attending a nearby school. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, the number of customers attending her business is low.  She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 100 Kilograms of rice, sugar and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 Kilograms of rice, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Maria Exaltaciona

texts.es:
María,  tiene 21  años de edad, es una mujer casada y tiene 2  hijos que dependen de ella y su esposo. Esta familia vive  en una comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo ubicada a 15 minutos del distrito de Mórrope – Lambayeque.

María tiene gran experiencia en la actividad que realiza. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos), contando con clientela establecida que son los pobladores de su comunidad y alrededores. María cuenta con corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio donde puede realizar con comodidad esta actividad.

María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles  para comprar pavos y alimento balanceado para estos. Esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y por ende sus ganancias.  María y su esposo tienen muchos deseos de superación y es por ello que este crédito le sería de gran utilidad.

María es una clienta antigua de nuestra institución y goza de un buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
María is 21 years old, is married, and has 2 children who depend on her and her husband. This family lives in a developing rural community located 15 minutes from the district of Mórrope, Lambayeque. 

María has a lot of experience in raising and selling turkeys. She has an established clientele among the people in her community. María has pens located behind her house, where she can pursue this activity comfortably. 

María requests a loan for 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy turkeys and animal feed. This will permit her to increase her production and her earnings. María and her husband have a desire to improve their lives and this loan will be very useful.

María is and old client of the institution, and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy turkeys and animal feed

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason. She is married with seven children. 

Marilou works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.
 
Marilou has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Baptiste

texts.en:
Baptiste is 27 years old and is married with two children who are between 3 and 5 years old. He sells local drinks. Baptiste has one year of experience.

Baptiste has requested his first loan from Kiva partner via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more sorghum to make a local drink. With these profits, Baptiste will reinvest in his business and pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum to make local drinks.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor lives and works in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is married and the father of two children. Bakhtiyor sells jewelry, souvenirs and hair clips at the market of “Korvon” in Dushanbe city. He tries to keep his family in a good living condition. That’s why he would like to get a loan of $3000 USD for purchasing jewelry, souvenirs and hair clips in order to expand his business and make a good profit to meet his family's needs.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy jewelry and souvenirs

loans.name: Howaida

texts.en: Howaida is 26 years old. She is a mother of two children. Her husband is a driver. Howaida and her husband opened a small store to sell different types of items such as home products, tools, and even food products. The business has been running successfully for two years. Now Howaida want to develop the store by reorganizing it and adding more food items to their store.

loans.use: To reorganize her store and add more food items

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past three years, Mwende has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing another bigger business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, Mwende wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Bernabas

texts.en:
Bernabas is a 38-year-old man who is married to Frederika. In their marriage, they have 2 lovely sons: Aryanto, 7, is in 1st grade at elementary school and Melani is 5 years old. 

Bernabas is a fishmonger. He sells tuna and sardines. Bernabas has been involved in this business for almost 13 years. He is a hard worker; he usually works from 6am to 3 pm.  

Sometimes Bernabas faces difficulties in buying fish from the fisherman, particularly in the windy season, but he always does his job with pleasure.
Bernabas plans to add more fish to his range such as yellow mottle fish (“belang kuning fish”) but he needs more capital to do so. He is requesting a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM to buy more fish. He is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business.

loans.use: To add more fish to his stock, such as yellow mottle fish

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is 25 years old and lives in Dumanhog, Siquijor. He is single with one child. 
Everyday Levi sells fresh fish at the market. He has been doing this type of work for one year. He has requested a loan of 7000 to purchase fish to sell at the market.
He has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for two months. In the future, Levi hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela integrante del Banco comunal “Fondo Amigo” perteneciente a la localidad de Villa Alemana.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 15 años, tiene un negocio de abarrotes, verduras y librería, éste se encuentra ubicado al lado de su casa.
Comenta que desde sus inicios le ha ido muy bien con el negocio, puesto que ha generado buenas ganancias que le han permitido remodelar la infraestructura de su vivienda y su almacén.
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras, supermercados mayoristas, en la feria y a los mismos proveedores quienes llegan a su domicilio.
Con el crédito comprará una máquina fotocopiadora para su librería.
Sus metas son abastecer su negocio de mercadería, ampliar su infraestructura y comprar computadores para formar un ciber pequeño, pero que sea un espacio útil para los estudiantes del sector. 
Carmela vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 15, 12 y 4 años de edad, quienes estudian, todos van al colegio.
Sus sueños en el ámbito personal y familiar son comprarse un auto para trasladar su mercadería. 
Ella está muy agradecida del apoyo y confianza depositado en ella, por parte de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido una gran ayuda para su vida y negocio. Ella asiste a las reuniones grupales del banco comunal, las cuales son muy gratas ya que comparte y disfruta con los demás socios. Comenta que es un grupo muy comprometido. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones, ha podido integrar estos aprendizajes de ventas a su propio negocio, ya que registra sus gastos e ingresos.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Carmela is a member of the Communal Bank “Fondo Amigo” which is located in the town of Villa Alemana. She has been in the retail trade for 15 years. Carmela manages a grocery store, a vegetable stand, and a bookstore which are all located next to her house. She says that since starting her business, she has done very well. Her business has enabled her to generate a good income that has helped her to remodel the infrastructure of her home and her store. The merchandise she sells is purchased from distributors, wholesale supermarkets, and at the fair. Those same distributors visit her at her home.

This loan will be used to buy a photocopying machine for her bookstore. Her goals are to restock her business with merchandise, expand the infrastructure, and buy computers so that she can start a small cybercafé in order to provide a useful space for the local students.

Carmela lives with her husband and three children (ages 15, 12, and 4) who are all studying and enrolled in school. Her personal ambitions and dreams for her family include buying a car so that she can transport her merchandise. She is very grateful for the support and trust that have been demonstrated to her by Fondo Esperanza, which has been a great help in both her life and in her business. Carmela attends the group meetings of her Communal Bank, where she freely shares with and enjoys the company of the other members. She says that they are a very committed group. With respect to the training, Carmela says that she has been able to integrate what she learned from her sales classes into her own business, such as how to track her income and expenses.

Viña del Mar is both a city and a township located on the central coast of Chile. It is known as “Ciudad Jardín” (Garden City) because of the gardens and patios found in some of the older homes in the city. Viña del Mar is also considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopying machine for her bookstore.

loans.name: Jenerose

texts.en:
Jenerose is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. She is a new member of HSPFI and in the future hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married and has eight children. Jocelyn is 47 years old and lives in Tangub City.

Jocelyn sells banana fruit to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to  purchase fertilizers for her banana fruit plantation.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her banana fruit plantation.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, a 56-year-old enterprising businessman, is married to Jane, who is a basket weaver. They are blessed with four children aged 28, 24, 20 and 16 years respectively. Supporting his family with a monthly income of KES 40,000, Moses has been a sisal farmer for the past 31 years while also running a butchery as his secondary business.

Having repaid his previous loan, Moses is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD to buy bulls and goats for slaughtering. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses he will educate his children, and he also hopes to buy a piece of land for farming.

loans.use: to buy bulls and goats for slaughtering.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: La socia Maruja sigue administrando su fotocopiadora, aqui realizan trabajos como tipeos, fotocopias, escaneos, grabados a DVD, CDs, impresiones entre los trabajos frecuentes que piden los clientes, la socia desea implematar su fotocopiadora  para recibir a mas clientela a futuro cercano, en esta ocasion la socia desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra D. papel A-4, tintas para las impresiones y D. este modo seguir creciendo con el negocio.
texts.en: Member Maruja continues working with her photocopier.  She does jobs such as typing, copies, scans, recordings on DVDs. CDS, printing, among all the types of work her customers request.  She wishes to set up another photocopier to attract more customers in the near future.  This time the member requests a loan to buy A-4 paper, printer's ink, and in this way, keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy A-4 paper, and printer's ink so that her business can keep growing.

loans.name: Sabina Thairora

texts.en: Sabina, 42 years old, is married and has five children ranging from fifteen to twenty-nine years. She describes herself as ambitious. Sabina runs a grocery store. She has been in this business for five years and faces a challenge of transportation when buying the goods. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to add stock to the grocery store. Sabina wants in the future to expand the business by increasing her turnover.

loans.use: To add stock to the grocery store.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua  is a "kenkey" (fermented maize dough) seller at Besease near Elmina.  Efua has been in this business for six years now.  Her husband is a sprayer and they have three children.  She assists her husband in caring for their children. Efua will use her loan to purchase bulk maize for the preparation of the "kenkey".  With the new profit she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk maize for the preparation of "kenkey".

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Jenalyn is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy tools & pay for gasoline for daily usage.
Jenalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jenalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline for daily usage

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung (in the photo with her loom) is a weaver, while her husband, Sophorn is a construction worker. Kung is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business. 

In addition, the couple also grows rice. They live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have been married since 1985 and have seven children - three sons and four daughters.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb is a 34-year-old man from Kakamega County, situated in Western Kenya. He is married to Caroline and they have three children aged between 7 and 16 years old.

Caleb has operated a welding business in Kakamega for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 9,550. He is taking out his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy metal and other materials for his workshop.

Caleb plans to reinvest any profits he will make back into his business. His dream is to start taking large scale tenders from schools and colleges for items such as desks and chairs.

loans.use: To buy metal for his welding business.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Profile story 

Habiba works for SOSAI Renewable Energies, a Barefoot Power distributor in Nigeria. 

This is her story: 

SOSAI Renewable Energies Company is a registered company in Nigeria working as a social enterprise targeting the people at the bottom of the pyramid. We work to offer reliable, efficient, and affordable technologies to households to improve their livelihoods. 

Work in this sector began at SOSAI in 2010. The organisation had existed as a fully commercial company before this, but now we operate as a social enterprise. 

SOSAI was set up by Habiba, who is a founder, and who had worked for Developmental Association for Renewable Energies (DARE), where she had got the opportunity to carry out exhibitions and workshops for people in rural areas and urban slums highlighting the benefits of renewable energies. Because DARE is an NGO sales were limited by DARE, so Habiba decided to branch out to revive SOSAI. With benefitting people at the forefront, running this organisation as a social enterprise was paramount. 

The idea behind the project of creating micro-enterprise by providing solar lighting is to empower small entrepreneurs who can penetrate more communities by giving them the opportunity to buy products and pay for them in installments, with an agreed upon plan and model. This will develop micro-enterprise, especially for women, while ensuring that a large number of people get all-important lighting into their homes, at the same time empowering more by giving them a means of livelihood. With the high number of households not connected to the grid--despite its rich energy resources--Nigeria is a fertile ground to grow this business as in the past 10 years (in spite of the government's promises) the power sector has only worsened with more power cuts and fewer people being connected to the grid. 

According to the WHO 1.6 million deaths occur yearly from indoor air pollution; this project will in the long run reduce green-house gas emissions while improving maternal health and ensuring basic education as longer study hours will be ensured. 

Benefits accruable to using Solar Home Systems as provided by Barefoot Power are immense, but the most important reason for SOSAI undertaking this comes from a personal experience Habiba has had with kerosene lamps while assisting her mother who owned a "Bukka," a term used to describe a small eatery, where they worked till late at night using kerosene lamps. Her mother currently has an eye problem because of the exposure to indoor air pollution and Habiba herself wears glasses. What better drive to promote a cleaner source of lighting than personal experience? 

The business model will be fully developed to include training for the business owners and training of technical staff that will ensure the warranty Barefoot Power prides itself in. 

This loan will enable SOSAI to better promote this sales model and move deeper into the rural areas especially to give us the strength to be able to fall back and take on the steam at anytime.

loans.use: To sell solar lighting to people who doesn't have electricity

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien would like to take a further loan to buy more computers and game cards for his shop. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more computers and games for his business.

loans.name: Aida Rita

texts.es: Aida es una señora responsable y cuidadosa, es soltera con 2 hijos pequeños a quienes cuida y apoya  como toda madre que adora a su familia, esta señora trabaja como conserje en un organismo de desarrollo social en la zona donde vive, del cual tiene 11 años de laborar, actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para reparar el techo de su cuarto ya ue se encuentra en mal estado y lo utlizaria en la compra de 2 laminas de zinc, alfajillas de madera, tapa goteras y pago de mano de obra. lo que le vendra a mejorar sus condiciones de vida de eela y de sus hijos.
texts.en: Aida is a responsible and careful woman. She is single and has two young children, whom she takes care of and supports, as any woman who loves her family does. She has worked as a caretaker for the past 10 years in social development agency where she lives. She is requesting her first loan to buy a bed, which will allow her family to be more comfortable.

loans.use: Cambio de techo del cuarto de su vivienda, el cual compra de dos laminas de zinc ,  alfajillas de madera, tapas goteras y pago de mano de obra

loans.name: Zebojon

texts.ru: Эта женщина Зебожон. Она начинающая бизнес леди. Ей 43 года. Зебожон из города Канибадам. Она готовиться к новому бизнесу. Зебожон отремонтировала свой магазин, и планирует перевезти больше товаров на продажу. Она хочет заниматься торговлей деятельности. Зебожону нужно деньги для приобретения продукт питания и скорее начать бизнес. По причине, что его муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Она живет вместе с двумя дочерями. Зебожон не стало ждать отправки деньги мужа, и старается зарабатывать самостоятельно, чтобы помочь мужу обеспечить семью. Ей нужно поддержка с Вашей стороны. Из-за нехватки денег Зебожон просит кредит.

loans.use: Для перевоза продукт питания и для новой деятельности.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her dairy farming business by purchasing two dairy cows.

loans.name: Dokuyo

texts.en: Madame Dokuyo is mainly into the preparation and sale of palm oil in her community. She has no money to buy the palm fruits to prepare the oil, even though she has a lot of customers who would like to buy oil from her. She is seeking a Kiva loan of $900.00 to enable her to buy more palm fruits for preparation.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells fried chicken and snacks. She started her busines with the help of her son, who is in the US and who sent her US$ 500 as initial investment.

In the beginning, she only sold breakfast and lunch. Now she also offers snacks and grilled chicken. Maria would also like to start selling all kinds of grilled meats.

She will use the loan to invest in the renovation of her restaurant, to buy kitchen utensils and a new oven. She trusts that these new products will allow her business to grow and that it will allow her continue to invest in her merchandise.

Maria is separated and has two children. She is convinced that her business will grow and will allow her to save for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria se dedica a la venta de pollos broastizados y meriendas. Empezó su negocio con el apoyo de su hijo que esta en los Estados Unidos quien le envió $500 dólares para que emprendiera el negocio.

Al principio solo vendia almuerzos y desayunos. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos juntos con meriendas y pollos a la braza. Maria aspira vender parrilladas y todo en carnes asadas.

Ella usara el prestamo para invertir en la adecuación del local, utensilios de cocina y un nuevo horno. Ella tiene fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecera y le permitira seguir invirtiendo en mercaderia.

Maria esta separada y tiene dos hijos. Esta convencida que su negocio crecerá y le permitirá ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To renovate her restaurant, to buy utensils and an oven

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen M. S., 29,  has now completed three credit cycles with Friendship Bridge. With the first credit, she bought a single piglet, and now she has four that are getting close to being ready for market. They each take 5-8 months to raise to maturity, although some grow faster than others. She buys waste tortillas to feed them. A single piglet costs about US$20 when young and will fetch between $65 and $80 when mature. Carmen hopes to buy at least one more piglet with this coming credit, and to continue feeding the others until they're ready for market. Carmen did not have any schooling, and never learned to read or write. But she's making sure that her three children will be able to go to school. The oldest, age 7, is already ahead of her because he's learning to read in the first grade. And she's very proud of him.

loans.use: Purchase and feed additional pigs

loans.name: Hermelinda Luz

texts.es:
The school cafeteria has become an important source of income for Hermelinda’s family. She has three children, and it is because of this business, which they occasionally help her with, that they are able to study. Hermelinda’s friendly manner has maD. the cafeteria into a place that is very popular with the school children.

Due to the requests she receives day after day from her regular customers, she wants to increase her stock of products and also expand the space she occupies. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan of S/. 600.00, which she is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. She hopes you will be able to help her, so that she can begin her project as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

L. cafetería escolar se ha convertido en una importante fuente D. ingreso para L. familia D. Hermelinda, elL. tiene tres hijos y gracias a esta actividad, que desempeñá en algunas ocasiones su compañía, ellos pueden estudiar con satisfacción.L. cordialidad que posee L. ha convertido en una D. los lugares más concurridos por los niños.Y a raíz D. las exigencias que le dan día a día sus asiduos clientes es que desea ampliar su stock D. productos y también el espacio que ocupa. Por ello solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles con el compromiso D. retornarlos en un lapso D. 6 meses. Por esta razón recurre a cada uno D. ustedes con L. esperanza D. poder recibir su ayuda; para emprender D. manera inmediata su proyecto

loans.use: To increase her stock and expand her space in the school cafeteria where she prepares and sells food

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som M., aged 32, sells vegetables to earn $2 per day. Her husband works for a private company as a driver, earning $4 per day. They have two children, one who is a student and one who is unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to purchase a rice grinding mill to grind other farmers' rice for a fee. She plans to use the increased income to reinvest in her business, reinforce her house and support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a rice grind mill to start a milling business.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
The Azucenas CommUnity (CommUnity is a term used by Friendship Bridge to refer to the Communal Banks) is composed of a group of women who surprise the inspectors with their organization and punctuality. Members of Azucenas always arrive to repayment and disbursement meetings on time, then proceed to sit down orderly and wait for the credit agent to assign their turn to speak, when everyting is in place. This organization is also evident in the financial aspect. These women have been working, collaborating and sharing for approximately seven years. The recipe for this Community to stay together for so long lays in the combination of different ingredients these women have combined, such as promptness of repayment, honesty, solidarity and trust.

Almost all the members of this CommUnity have been and are weavers. From a young age, they learned the backstrap loom weaving technique, producing naturally colored fabrics. They have learned to color threads using natural dyes, which they get from the mountains. They use the trunk of the banana tree to fix colors and the trunk of avocado, leaves from different bushes, medicinal plants and food ingredients to obtain the dyes. They learned these techniques, which have been passed on for generations in San Juan la Laguna, from their mothers and grandmothers.

They will invest the credit in buying thread wholesale, in order to decrease production costs. One of the women is a painter and she’ll use the loan to buy oil paint. María C. Gonzales mentioned that her son is sick and she’ll have to make a great effort and invest half of the loan in her business and use the other half to buy medicines for her son.

Members of Azucena have several dreams. Marilú Jacinta C. pointed out that she wants to send her son, recently graduated from high-school, to college. For that she needs her business to keep prospering as it has been recently. Concepción M. wants another loan because she would like her business to consolidate to the point where she’s able to buy a small lot of land for her son.

These women constitute an example for all the indigenous women in the region. Many years ago, they decided to become financially independent and support their respective husbands with extra money to cover household expenses.

Thanks to their effort they are reaching their goals, sending their children to school and providing them with a permanent roof and sufficient food, in order for them to advance. The Azucenas are a typical example of Guatemalan indigenous women, who set the well-being of their families above their own. Nonetheless, if their businesses grow and prosper in the way they have projected, that situation doesn’t have to continue, and all will be able to enjoy a good life. Help them!

One of the women was not able to be in the picture, due to health issues.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La ComUnidad Azucenas (ComUnidad es un término que utiliza Friendship Bridge para llamar a los Bancos comunales) está conformado por un grupo de señoras que sorprenden a los veedores por su organización y puntualidad. Las Azucenas siempre llegan a las reuniones de repago y desembolso a la hora exacta, luego prosiguen a sentarse en orden y esperan a que la agente de crédito les de la palabra inicial una vez que todo está en orden. Esta organización también se ve en el aspecto financiero. Estas señoras han venido trabajando, colaborando y compartiendo juntas desde hace aproximadamente 7 años. La receta para que esta ComUnidad haya permanecido junta por tanto tiempo es que esta señoras han combinado distintos ingredientes como: la puntualidad del repago, la honestidad, la solidaridad y la confianza.

Casi todas de las integrantes de esta ComUnidad han sido y son tejedoras. Desde pequeñas ellas aprendieron a tejer con la técnica de telar de cintura, telas teñidas con tintes naturales. Además, ellas aprendieron a teñir los hilos con tintes naturales. Estos tintes naturales las señoras los traen de las montañas. Ellas utilizan el tronco del banano como fijador de colores, el tronco del aguacate, hojas de arbustos, plantas medicinales e ingredientes de comida para sacar los tintes. Las técnicas que ellas utilizan las aprendieron de sus madres y abuelas. Son tradiciones que han sido aprendidas por generaciones en San Juan la Laguna.

Estas señoras van a invertir su crédito en comprar hilo al por mayor para reducir sus costos de producción. Una de las señoras es pintora. Ella va a utilizar el préstamo para comprar pintura óleo. María C. Gonzales comentó que su hijo estaba enfermo. Ella va a hacer malabares para invertir la mitad de su crédito en su negocio y la otra mitad en comprar medicinas para su hijo.

Las integrantes de las Azucenas tienen varios sueños. Marilú Jacinta C. comentó que ella quiere mandar a su hijo recién graduado del colegio a la universidad. Lo único que necesita es que su negocio siga prosperando de la misma manera como ha venido sucediendo. Concepción M. quiere otro préstamo porque quiere que su negocio se consolide al punto donde ella pueda ganar lo suficiente para poder comprar un terrenito para su hijo.

Estas señoras son un ejemplo para todas las mujeres indígenas de la región. Muchos años atrás ellas decidieron independizarse económicamente y apoyar a sus respectivos maridos con dinero extra para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

Gracias a su esfuerzo ellas están cumpliendo sus objetivos, mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y proveerles un techo permanente y suficiente comida para que puedan salir adelante. Las Azucenas son un típico ejemplo de la mujer indígena Guatemalteca, ellas ponen el bienestar de su familia por encima del de ellas. Sin embargo, si sus negocio crecen y prosperan de la manera como ellas han proyectado, esa situación no va a tener que suceder, ya que todos van a poder disfrutar de una buena vida. Ayúdenlas a salir adelante!

Una de las señoras no pudo estar presente en la fotografía por razones de salud.

loans.use: Purchase of thread for the production of huipiles (Mayan women blouses).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing goods and resources

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian T. owns a road-side hairdressing salon in Cape Coast, where she has worked for 6 years. She is a single, 25-year-old woman who works very hard and is seeking $525 to buy hairdressing products to meet the demands of her loyal client base. In addition, she hopes that the additional capital will allow her to expand her client base by offering new products to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing products to meet the demands of her loyal client base and to attract new customers.

loans.name: Kimombasa South F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Madina N.. She is currently in the business of selling cattle and is requesting a loan to expand business. Madina is 30 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging from age 2 to 13 and her children go to school. Each week, Madina makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children. Madina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Madina is joined in her small group by Joeria Namukobe, Zulaika N., Hadija M., and Hamida N.. Joeria Namukobe has a business in cattle trading and wants to diversify to selling goats. Zulaika N. is currently operating a business selling cattle and wants a loan to boost business. Hadija M. operates a business in cattle sales and wants to increase her inventory. Hamida N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase more furniture.

loans.use: To add more working capital to cattle trading business

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem C., 32, makes about $5 per day growing edible aquatic plants and selling fish.  She lives with her husband, Suy Bros, and her two children at Stung Chrov Village, Kandal Province. Mr. Bros has been a motorbike taxi driver since 2005 and earns about $5 per day. In order to expand her business, Mrs. C. now seeks a $600 loan to buy a fishing boat and net. With this loan, Mrs. C. will grow edible aquatic plants easier and fish in the Stung Chrov Lake, Kandal Province. It will also help her sustain her family’s living expenses.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat and net

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en:
Theresah is thirty eight years old and she has two children. She has a beauty salon and also prepares and sells batik, tye & dye materials. She wants to use her loan to buy more calico material to prepare more batik, and to buy hair creams and other supplies for her beauty salon.

Theresah is a member of the group called “Nyame wo Tom” (meaning "God has power"). Members of the group agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Theresah’s photo was taken during the group’s meeting.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for batik, and dye and hair products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Mrs. Gladys L. C., her husband (Rogelio Conde) and her three children live in her parent's house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz, Bolivia. Gladys works as a maid in a private residence, and her husband works in a mine located in the Paceño district.

Gladys’s parents gave the married couple a portion of their property in order to build a home. Gladys and her husband have already constructed two rooms with previous loans. Gladys is asking for a new loan in order to build an additional room made of brick. This is the sixth time that Gladys has requested a loan, and she has received high ratings in socio-economic analyses.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gladys L. C., su esposo (Rogelio Conde) y sus tres hijos viven en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz. Gladys es empleada domestica en un domicilio particular y su esposo trabaja en una mina que se encuentra en departamento paceño. Los padres de Gladys otorgaron al matrimonio parte de la propiedad para que construyeran su vivienda, misma que cuenta con dos habitaciones construidas con anteriores créditos. Con el préstamo actual, Gladys planea construir una habitación nueva de ladrillo. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo, la clienta califica favorablemente en el análisis socioeconómico realizado.

loans.use: To build a new room in the family home

loans.name: Gabil

texts.en: Gabil has been in this business for 11 years. He is 48 years old, married, has 2 children, and has settled in Gala settlement. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Lachin region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Now he is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to buy home appliances to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for re-sale

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna Fay is 44 years old, married, has 7 children and takes care of 3 other people. She has been a member of the Lélo village bank in Thiès for the past 8 years. She wants to buy chicks, food and medication for her poultry breeding business as well as suppliers for her restaurant. Maimouna would like to grow her businesses in order to improve the living conditions of her children. She is requesting a loan which will be refunded in six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Maimouna F., 44 ans, mariée, 07 enfants et 3 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Lélo à Thiès depuis 8 ans. Elle veut acheter des poussins, des aliments et des médicaments pour son activité d’élevage et des provisions pour son restaurant. Maimouna souhaite renforcer ses activités pour améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Running a restaurant and breeding poultry

loans.name: Riaz M.zafar Group

texts.en:
Riaz baji is the wife of M. Z. and lives in a city named Pakpattan. Pakpattan is famous for its historical and holy places. She has one daughter who is 1 year old. Her husband has a spare parts shop. He sells specifically motorbike spare parts. Riaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy motorbike spare parts to re-sell.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Ashra baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Sarwar baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy fertilizer to re-sell. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en:
N. Sabohat is a very hardworking woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married with 3 children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity has created in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their population and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding.

She makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she’s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her three children, who also help out in caring for the animals during their free time. She wants to improve her stable stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she’s requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 12 months to buy small cattle and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle and fodder

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Кодиров Умарали житель Варзобского района. Работает на СТО . Занимается ремонтом автомашин. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Один является кормильцем семьи. Решил получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить автозапчасти. Это поможет ему продавать запчасти прямо у себя в мастерской. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Umarali K. lives in the Varzob district. He works at an auto service station repairing automobiles. Married with six children, Umarali is the sole provider for his family. He decided to obtain a loan in order to purchase auto parts. This would enable him to sell the auto parts right at his repair shop. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is married and has one child. She runs a small business selling clothing at the central market. She started this business about a year ago and it is financially profitable. Her working capital is 30,000 UAH and her monthly income is 2,900 UAH. Anna decided to get involved in this particular business because she saw a good opportunity. Inexpensive clothing is always in demand. The seasons change and people buy new clothing constantly.

Being a hardworking and entrepreneurial person, Anna can continue to make her business a success. Anna would like to request a loan of 3,000 UAH to purchase more goods for the upcoming busy winter season. More goods would bring her more profit and enable her take better care of her family. Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Fariba

texts.en:
