Fariba lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She helps support her family. Her husband works part-time as a security guard and she works in tailoring. She has good experience with lots customers and she always tries to work hard in her business. She loves to see her business succeed. She was very weak in her business and day by day, she works hard to have a good business and after the loan she will do it.

When she found AFSG in Kabul she applied for an individual loan of 30,000 Afghans to buy machines and complete her tailoring stock to continue her business to help her family and her husband and make a better future for all members of their family.

She is happy. She wants to say, "I never saw such a great program here in Afghanistan and I am sure that every woman and man who use this loan will have a good future and make a better income for their families, thanks to Kiva and AFSG, with this successful program of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and complete her tailoring stock

loans.name: Thanh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Thành, năm nay 44 tuổi ở Quảng Xương Thanh Hoá. Gia đình chị có 3 con và còn đang đi học. Năm 2004 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và  vay vốn để mở cửa hàng tạp hoá  Hiện tại công việc kinh doanh cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra chồng và con trai chị còn có thêm công việc buôn bán chim cảnh với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng nên kinh tế gia đình chị Thành đang ngày càng ổn định hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị muốn  vay 9.000.000 để mua bia và một số mặt hàng khác để bán hàng trong dịp tết nguyên đán
texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh Thi H., 44 years old, lives in the town of Quang Xuong, Thanh Hoa. Her family includes 3 children who are going to school. In 2004, she joined the Fund and borrowed money to open a general store. Currently the business is bringing her an income of 2,000,000 VND/month. Her husband and son also has a business selling ornamental birds with an income of 3,000,000 VND/month so the family's finances are improving and becoming more stable day by day. In this round of funding, she would like to borrow 9,000,000 VND to buy beer and a number of other goods to sell during the lunar New Year's holidays.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer and other goods to sell

loans.name: Lavina

texts.en:
Lavina J. is currently in the business of selling dresses and bed sheets at the market. Lavina is 35 years old and widowed. She has one child, who goes to school. She is requesting a loan to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business selling dresses and bed sheets.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es: La solicitante es la Sra Mirta agüero la misma es casada tiene 3 hijos todos trabajan y ayuda a la unidad familiar. La misma es microempresaria se dedica al servicio de Bar hospedaje denominado San Luis en la Ciudad De Yatytay km 16 cuenta con 20 años antigüedad en rubro. Esta solicitando de nuestra asistencia destino de la operación compra de mercaderias, harina aceite carne , y articulos de limpieza la de 3MM a 12 meses.
texts.en:
The applicant is Mrs. Mirta Agüero who is married and has 3 children, all of whom work and help the family unit. She is a micro-entrepreneur who works in service at the Bar-Lodge called San Luis in the city of Yatytay kilometer 16 and has 20 years in this area. She is asking for our support for the purchase of merchandise, flour, oil, meat and cleaning products with 3 million Guarani over 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise, beer, flour, meat etc.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang P. usually buys fish in bulk from suppliers and fisherman and then sells them retail them in the local market. She is 39 years old and is a villager living in rural area of Kompong Tom province. She is married and has two children who are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Ban, age 45, is a local building foreman. 

Neang P. is requesting a loan of $600 to increase her current capital. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her current capital

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha A. K. is 44 years old and lives in Tulkrem City in Palestine.To help her family economically, she decided to open her own sewing workshop in order to support her four children of whom all are in school,  given that her husband’s income does not cover their living expenses. She wants a loan of US$ 1200 to buy sewing machines, accessories and fabrics. Aisha would like to thank you in advance for your support!

loans.use: Purchase sewing machines and accessories

loans.name: James

texts.en: Since 1979 James Dohkoe has worked as a shoemaker and knife sharpener at Shama Junction.  James gathers old machetes, recycles the metal and creates new knives out of the old products.  He is married with eight dependents and received an education through Junior High School. His wife works as a farmer.  James is responsible for paying water and light bills and also for providing housekeeping money for his family.  His loan will be used to trade in old machetes, which he will recycle into new knives, and also tires, which he will make into shoes.  He hopes to use the new profits from his business to help complete a home for his children.

loans.use: To trade in old machetes, recycle them into new knives, and also tires, which he will make into shoes.

loans.name: Ameyo's Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VOVOLE est composé de 5 femmes. Elles sont spécialisées dans la production de l’huile de palme à base des noix de palme. Avec ce crédit le groupement souhaite s’approvisionner en noix de palme et aussi acheter des matériels nécessaires pour la production de l’huile rouge. Elles ont fois a leur association et espèrent que cette chance changera beaucoup de chose dans leur vie
texts.en:
The group VOVOLE is made up of 5 women. They are specialized in producing palm oil from palm nuts. With this loan, the group wants to buy palm nuts and also to buy other necessary materials for producing "red oil" (palm oil). They have faith in their association and hope that this opportunity will change a lot of things in their lives.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing palm nuts for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru: Самадова Зебо, молодая женщина 25 лет ,имеет одного ребёнка.Зебо вместе со свекровью занимается шитьём и продажей халатов и платьев. Она закончила курсы шитья женской одежды и приступила к самостоятельной деятельности. У неё много клиентов в районе Мастчох, которые покупают у неё её платья и халаты.Зебо хочет в кредит купить вышивальную машинку и выбивать на национальных платьях вышивки. Сейчас у нас очень модно носить платья с вышивками. На снимке Зебо в день подачи заявки на кредит.
texts.en:
Zebo S. is a young, 25 year old woman with one child. She and her mother-in-law have a business sewing and selling robes and dresses. She began independent work after completing courses on sewing women's clothing. She has many customers in the Mastchoh district for her robes and dresses. Zebo would like to use a loan to buy an embroidery machine for embroidering traditional dresses. It's popular right now to have dresses with embroidery. In the photograph Zebo is pictured the day she applied for the loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing and sale of dresses and robes

loans.name: Progreso Y Conciliacion #2` Group

texts.en:
Maria is married and has five children. She lives in a small town in Consuelo, Barrio 15. Consuelo has many green fields, sugar plantations, narrow dirt roads, and tin houses that are constructed one next to another. Maria has lived there her whole life and operates a small women’s clothing shop from her home.

Maria has been in business for about eight years, selling clothes, intimate apparel, and custom jewelry. With this loan she will particularly buy women’s panties, bras, socks, bracelets, rings, earrings, and other accessories. She is also looking into buying a glass stand where she can display and protect her accessories.

This is Maria’s third loan with Esperanza. She states that business is not always good, it has its ups and downs, like everything else. She hopes that one day her business will reach a healthy size. 

Please help Maria become a successful businesswoman in her community. Thank you.

loans.use: To purchase women's intimate clothing and accesories

loans.name: Renne Atieno

texts.en:
Renne Atieno Y. is 26, married and the mother of three children. Renee runs a pharmacy shop which she took over from her husband after he got employed. The business is situated in Miwani Juakali, which is in the outskirts of Kisumu City, Western Kenya. Most of her clients come from Juakali center and Miwani Sugar factory and its environs.

Renne got introduced to KADET by a neighbor who was already a member. She joined and took her first loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings. She plans to diversify her business with this loan. She therefore intends to expand her other business of selling window curtains. Her future hope is to expand her businesses and become a wholesaler.


About KADET
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To diversify her current  business by combining it with another one selling window curtains.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
62-year-old Corazon A. is a rice grower in their village. Although she is too old to farm, she is still strong enough to manage a business. She has five children. She and her husband, Asher A., work very hard to support their needs and their grandchildren.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and chemicals. The loan will truly help them achieve maximum harvest on their farm.

Now she is happy joining the CEVI credit program. She noticed that CEVI is not just providing loans to their clients but education as well to help their small business grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Aldo Jose

texts.es: El señor Aldo O., habitante de Villa del Carmen, su acompañante trabajadora de una empresa privada, tiene un hijo de siete años de edad, es un hombre luchador, buscando lo mejor para su familia, buen padre e hijo. Dentro de sus planes realizarle mejoras a su vivienda y ofrecerle diferentes opciones a su hijo. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen como guardia de seguridad, desde hace seis meses anteriormente trabajaba en la Zona Franca, se ha encontrado dificultades para la construcción de su casa y gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, hierro, azulejo y otros materiales de construcción, siendo la iniciación de su proyecto.
texts.en:
Aldo O. lives in the Villa del Carman. His significant other works for a private business. He has a seven year old son. Aldo is a fighter who looks for the best for his family. He is a good father to his son. His plans are to make improvements to his house and to give his son different options. He has worked as a security guard in the Villa del Carmen region for six months. He previously worked in the Zona Franca. He has run into problems building his house. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, he will buy construction materials like cement, iron, tile, and other materials as this is the beginning of the project.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima M. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a business selling charcoal, green vegetables, and fruit to customers in Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases goods for her business directly from wholesale sellers and then sells to her customers at retail. Green vegetables and fruit are purchased from the city market at Buguruni and Kariakoo. She meets her family's daily needs with the income from her business. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 TZS to buy more goods in order to meet customers' demand.

loans.use: To buy more goods to meet customers' demand

loans.name: Ndoumé Kara

texts.fr: Ndoumbé Kara D. est une femme de 54 ans, elle es mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOBOR KAGNAROU depuis 6 ans et y a bénéficié de 12 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Avec son crédit elle veut faire la promotion de son commerce de produits halieutiques; huitres, crevettes etc. Elle appuie son époux par rapport à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ndoumbe Kara D. is a 54 year-old woman, she is married, and she is mother of 5 children who are still in her care. She has been a member of the Community Bank "Tobor Kagnarou" (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 6 years and she has received 12 past loans, all of which she has repaid successfully. With her loan she wants to expand her seafood business, selling: oysters, shrimp etc. She helps her husband to provide for the needs of the family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her small business

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
En el mercado central de Chinandega, con mucho entusiasmo y esfuerzo la señora Carla P. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de ropa, fajas y carteras en su establecimiento en una zona muy visitada por clientes en el mercado.

Con urgencia ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de la ropa, de las fajas y los bolsos para continuar ofreciéndolos en su localidad y así mejorar las condiciones de su actividad para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
In the central market of Chinandega, Sra. Carla P. attends to her business with great enthusiasm and effort. She sells clothing, belts, and wallets from her establishment. The area where the market is located is frequented by many customers.

Carla is in urgent need of a loan so that she can buy clothing, belts, and purses so that she continue offering products to her customers and improve her business. This will help her maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & accessories

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 34 years old, is married to Loise Mwikali, and is the father of two children: Emmanuel, 10 years old, and Jason, 3 years old. William comes from a humble background where his parents couldn't pay for his education, but his future dream is that his children are able to get a good education. William was introduced to KADET through an existing KADET client. He is applying for his second loan. He wants to purchase spare parts for his business (e.g. a compressor, accessories) so as to increase his number of clients. William is intending to extend his workshop and get more working space for his business with the extra profits. His hopes and dreams are to get a bigger workshop and to employ three more staff. He is outgoing, a people person, patient with people and very hardworking. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his electronics repair shop

loans.name: Ireda Agali 3 Atimango Lucy Group

texts.en:
A. Lucy is representing her group. She is a businesswoman, thirty-eight years old, and married with five children, all schooling. More so, she is taking care of two dependents.

Lucy deals in produce and charcoal. She takes produce such as beans, cabbages, rice, maize, etc., to Abim district, Karamoja, and purchases charcoal from deep villages in Abim to market in Lira district. She has stayed in this business for over six years.

Because of the war impact in Abim district, there is no food and that is why Lucy targeted supplying or marketing her produce in Abim.

Lucy is requesting the loan to purchase more stock so that she can add capital into her business. She is a very hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to give her children a bright future: that is, by educating them.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her business

loans.name: Ren

texts.en: Mrs. Ren K. is a resident of Krang Roung village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She is a widow with three children; one is a beautician, and the others are attending the local school. Her first child’s business is facing a small problem because her child does not have enough money to buy beauty supplies, so Mrs. Ren K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy the supplies on her child’s behalf.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her child's business

loans.name: Mon

texts.en: Mrs. Mon L. is a good homemaker who cares for the children and does housework. Mon L. currently depends on the income from her husband’s work. He provides a well-digging service. His skill is digging wells by hand, and he has been working at it for years. He earns $7 a day to buy food for his family. Mon L.’s husband has been very busy at his business due to there being many clients who need him to dig their well, but he is still lacking materials to perform his service. Therefore, Mon L. requested a loan to purchase more digging materials. Note: Mon L.’s husband is pictured above.

loans.use: To purchase more digging materials

loans.name: Kholniso

texts.en:
K. Kholniso is a 31-year-old man who is married with two children. Thanks to his father (pictured), who is a farmer, Kholniso has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the sheep in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The sheep are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day, Kholniso gets up early in the morning in order to feed the animals. All day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the sheep. Kholniso says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with proper education. Now, Kholniso would like to expand his business and purchase more sheep. For this purpose, he has applied for $900 USD and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of sheep to expand the business.

loans.name: Hishigtogtoh

texts.en: Hishigtogtoh is a single mother who lives with her five children in Khovd province, Mongolia. Her children all help with the family business in their spare time. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian tent called a "ger". She currently operates a metal product making business as well as a broom making business in her town. She produce a variety of traditional Mongolian household goods. Her products are very popular among her many customers because of their good quality and unique style. Hishigtogtoh started her business in 1994 and has built a successful operation over the years. Her earnings have enabled her to hire two more assistants who were unemployed and helped them improve their lives. Hishigtogtoh is focused on the future and has many new ideas for her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says, "All I want is to save enough money for my children's education." She is requesting a 900,000 tugrug loan to purchase metals and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase metals and materials for her business

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Pat R., 23, is married and lives with her one-year-old child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. R. is employed at a local garment factory in the city, earning an income of US$2 per day. She has been with this business since 2005. Her husband is a driver who transports dirt for landfill for people in different provinces, earning US$4 per day. (R.'s husband is pictured in the photo.)

R. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to get rid of necessary daily expenses. Therefore, R. is requesting a loan of US$800 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es una madre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y dos de  sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo y comida en un puesto ubicado en los exteriores del mercado central del distrito de Cayaltí. Ella nos comenta que ya tiene más de 15 años en el negocio y que empezó vendiendo carne de pollo y frutas. Tuvo que dejar de vender frutas debido a la amplia oferta de la zona y entonces se decidió por vender comida.

Su rutina laboral empieza desde las siete de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde. Los platos que más ofrece son caldos de gallina y ceviche. Agustina desea ampliar su negocio de venta de carne de pollo pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es adquirir una mototaxi para seguir ayudando a la economía del hogar y a la educación de sus hijas que ya están estudiando en un instituto de la zona. Ella es una mujer alegre, laboriosa y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Agustina is a 55-year-old mother who lives with her husband and two of their four children in the Cayaltí district, an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. She sells chicken meat and prepared foods from a stall located on the outer edge of the Cayaltí central market. She tells us that she has had this business for more than 15 years, and that she began by selling chicken meat and fruit. She had to stop selling fruit due to the large supply in the area, and she decided then to sell prepared foods. Her work day lasts from seven in the morning until one in the afternoon. The dishes she sells most are chicken soups and ceviche. Agustina wants to expand her chicken meat business, but she does not have enough capital to carry out this plan, which is why she is for the first time asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 soles. Her greatest desire is to acquire a moto-taxi (a motorcycle with added passenger seating) so she can continue helping with the household finances and the education of her daughters, who are studying at an area school. She is a happy, hardworking and enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken meat to expand business

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: C. Jeannette est née en 1959 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a environs 9 ans que Jeannette s’est installée à Kadjacomé, dans la commune de Sémé-Podji.  Jeannette est mariée à C. Antoine, un pêcheur.  Le couple a trois enfants, qui vivent ensemble avec eux à Kadjacomé.  Certains des enfants sont scolarisés.  Jeannette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Jeannette vend des plastiques au bord du lac de Agbalilamè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji.  Il y a 10 ans que Jeannette exerce cette activité.  Jeannette s’approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo (capitale administrative du Bénin) et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Jeannette sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer son activité et mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Jeannette C. was born in 1959 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. About nine years ago she setteld in Kadjacomé, in the community of Sémé-Podji, a district of Cotonou. Jeannette is married to Antoine C., a fisherman. The couple has three children, and the whole family lives together in Kadjacomé. Some of the children go to school. Jeannette never attended school. In order to provide for her and her children's needs, Jeannette sells household plastic goods by the lake of Agabaliamè in Sémé-Podji. Jeannette has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She purchases her stock at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo (the administrative capital of Benin); in the past she had obtained two loans from ALIDé, which she duly reimbursed. Jeannette is seeking a third loan in order to strengthen her business and better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing plastic goods

loans.name: Rann

texts.en:
Mrs. Rann S. is 39 years old and a villager from Daom village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Phart Chhoun, is a battery charger who earns a small income to support his family. The couple has four children – one is an electrician, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other two attend a public school.
Although they work hard in their different businesses, they still do not earn sufficient income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Rann S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding.

loans.use: To buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy H. is 51 years old and lives in Kampong Pou village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Choeun Sem, are farmers who own a one hectare field where they grow crops to earn a living for their family. They do not have enough money to support their farming activities. Thus, Mrs. Chanthy H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to pay a laborer to plow.

This couple has seven children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and two others are farmers who support their parents' farming while the other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to pay a laborer to plow

loans.name: Onyame Nnye Mmfosuo Group

texts.en:
Hanna is forty-four years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children who are between the ages of two and fifteen years. Hanna lives with her children and husband, a trader, in a rented apartment in their community. She is a hard-working and a trustworthy woman. 

Hanna trades in socks. She has been trading for seventeen years and has acquired rich experience in business. Hanna buys the goods from nearby towns. Hanna aspires to give all her children a very good education. She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Onyame Nnye Mmfosuo’, which literally means 'God makes no mistakes'. The group is made up of six members and the majority are traders while a few are in the service industry. They are mostly requesting the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: to buy socks in bulk for resale

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Q. V. José Luis, vive en el caserio el siete, perteneciente al distrito de Pachacutec. Tiene a su cargo a su esposa Y 1 hijo. Su esposa trabaja de manera eventual en fundos agricolas. El Sr. Q.  trabaja como obrero de campo para el Sr. Nieto Rebatta Cesar Martin en el distrito de Pachacutec. Tiene casa propia. Solicita el financiamiento para el tarrajeo de su vivienda a fin de cumplir su sueño de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El Sr. Q. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Q. V. José Luis lives in the seventh village of the Pachacutec district. He is responsible for his wife and one son. His wife works on a casual basis in agricultural farms. Mr. Q. works as a field worker for Mr. Nieto Rebatta Cesar Martin in the district of Pachacutec. He has is own home. He requests funding for plaster to repair his home to fulfill his dream of providing a better quality of life for his family. Mr. Q. is grateful for the support to be provided with this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 18 años a su cargo, pues ella siempre busca la forma de sacar adelante a su hijo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y leña, pues de esta manera ha logrado proporcionar el pan de cada día y sufragar los gastos en su familia. Pues las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante ya que solamente así puede obtener una gran variedad de clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para la inversión de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes y vestidos. Siempre sueña con tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is a single mother with an 18-year-old son, and she is always looking for ways to support him. She works selling clothing and firewood, and has been able to provide their daily bread and pay for familial expenses. In order to get a wide variety of clients she sells her products in the street. This loan will be invested to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and dresses for sale. She hopes in the future to have a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna D. is from the village of Inawa-an, Batangan, Valencia City. She is 49 years old. Erna is married and has 1 school-aged child . To make a living, Erna owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Erna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Erna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service, such as tires, tire interiors, and tools. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation services

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Diamantes, es casada tiene 38 años y 2 hijos que estudian, Sonia hace manualidades a crochet, como costureros, adornos de cocina, de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes. Además vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, productos que le envía su hermana. También Sonia vende ollas renaware por catálogos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de polos. Sonia estudio cosmetología y sueña con implementar un salón de belleza en donde también venda sus productos.
texts.en:
Sonia, 38, is married and has two children who are students; she’s a member of the Diamantes (Diamonds) communal bank. Sonia makes crochet crafts such as sewing baskets and kitchen decorations on order. She also sells clothing on order to friends and relatives; her sister sends her the merchandise. In addition, Sonia sells Rena Ware brand pots by catalogue. She will use the funds to buy polo-type shirts. Sonia studied cosmetology and her dream is to set up a beauty salon where she can also sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts.

loans.name: Mallana Group

texts.en:
Anthony F., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Mallana. He is 32 years old, married and has two children who are 2 and 5 years old. He was only able to attend school through 4th grade due to lack of support. For 3 years, he has been selling light bulbs in West Point, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He describes himself as very reliable.

Anthony plans to use his 18,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 90,000 LRD group loan to buy more light bulbs. His dream is to expand his business, build a house and continue to educate his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more light bulbs

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem S., 43, is married with five children living at home in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 each day, while her husband is a recycler. Her husband, Houth Vuth, typically makes about $4 each day. Chhem S. would like a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to attach to a trailer.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon N. is a young woman who is pictured here with her husband (on the right of the photo). This couple has spent their life cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents. The couple married several years ago and they now have two school-aged children.

Each year, the family plants and cultivates new crops, which has brought them great success. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year, following both the rainy and dry seasons.

While the coming rainfall is good for growing, Pon N. does not have capital yet to use on her farm. Therefore, Pon N. is looking for a loan to use toward purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.es:
Maria es madre de familia de tres hijos,  pues siempre ah ayudado a su familia con los gastos, ya que su esposo no ajusta con su salario es bajo ya que se desempeña como conductor.
Primeramente solo vendía tortillas, luego comienza hacer fritanga por las tardes logrando así ganar más. Nace la iniciativa de aumentar las ventas pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente lo que recurre al
Financiamiento logrando Así las mejoras en su pequeño negocio.
Ahora ha logrado poner una pequeña pulpería aunque con poco pero su objetivo es poder comprar productos y lograr hacerla crecer. Con este préstamo comprara: diez cajillas de huevos, dos cajas de sopas maggi, cloro, cuatro quintales de carbón, cinco quintales de maíz, queso entre otros para lograr llenar su venta.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of three children. She has always helped her family with the expenses since her husband does not earn enough money at his job as a driver.

At first Maria only sold tortillas, but she later began selling fried foods in the afternoons so that she could earn more. With her natural born initiative, she was able to increase her sales. However, she was left with insufficient capital, which is why she is resorting to financing in order to make improvements to her small business.

Maria now has a small grocery store. Her goal is to make it grow by acquiring more products a little bit at a time. This loan will be used to buy ten crates of eggs, two boxes of Maggi soup mix, bleach, four quintales (1 quintal = 46kg) of charcoal, five quintales of corn, cheese, and other products she needs to fill her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs, soup mix, bleach, charcoal, corn, cheese, and other products

loans.name: Maristania Solanda

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela Comercio de la Ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen cada 15 días las socias del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias Exitosas.

La señora Maristania es casada, fruto de esta relación tiene tres lindos niños que son su alegría de vivir y tiene un hogar muy bonito. Además de su familia también viven con ellos su hermano y su sobrino.

Su casa queda ubicada cerca de una cancha es así como hace 8 meses surgió la idea de poner un negocio de bebidas, en el cual vende desde gaseosas hasta bebidas alcohólicas, según nos cuenta lo que mas se vende es la cerveza y la pony malta(bebida energisante) y que desde que inicio le ha ido muy bien.

Atiende su negocio desde las cuatro pm. hasta las ocho pm. Hay semanas que trabaja todos los días pero que en otras desde el jueves hasta el domingo, esta muy a gusto porque gana su dinero, trabaja en su casa, y le queda tiempo para dedicarles a su familia.

Va a utilizar el nuevo crédito para comprar mesas y sillas  para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

Lleva ya tres ciclos en el Banco  Comunal y sus sueños son seguir aquí y tener un gran bar.
texts.en:
The Successful Mutually Supportive Women Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo’s Ciudadela Comercio neighborhood. Maristania is married and she has three lovely children who are her life’s joy; she has a very pretty home. Besides her family her brother and nephew also live with them. Her house is very near a sports field so about 8 months ago she got the idea to open a beverage business where she can sell everything from soft drinks to alcoholic beverages. According to her, what sells best is beer and Pony Malta (a non-alcoholic energy drink) and she has done well since she opened. She is open for business from 4pm until 8pm. There are weeks when she works every day and others when she only opens Thursdays through Sundays. She is very satisfied because she earns income, works from home and has time to spend with her family. She will use the new loan to buy tables and chairs to provide better customer service. She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and her dream is to continue her and have a great bar.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria E. is a 66-year-old farmer. She is married and has five children. Her affectionate husband, Jasasyn, has been a tower of strength to her for almost 40 years. Cattle breeding is the only source of subsistence for this couple. They began this business in 1995, starting with the purchase of one milk cow. Today they have a small farm with milk cows and earn about 3,500 soms (KGS) monthly by selling milk.

Maria and her husband concentrate all their efforts on supporting and expanding their household. For this very reason, Maria wants to take a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy bull calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenue from this investment, she plans to develop her farm by means of livestock breeding. In the future, Maria dreams that her grandson will keep on with the farm and become an efficient farmer.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Lê Đắc's Group

texts.en:
Lê Đắc C.  (20209010014) is a 39-year-old man living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  C. is the group leader for a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đông nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


C. is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, C. works in a manufacturing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling products to local businesses and community members.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3.100.000 VND a month for his work. 


In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  He is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to further renovate the business.  This will be his 3rd loan borrowed from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà C. (0) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


2.  Lê Thị Mỹ Lệ (0) is a 23 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Lê Đắc  (20209010014) là 39 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở tH.nh phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các tH.nh viên.  Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đông nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 3.100.000 VND.  Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà C. (0) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  Lê Thị Mỹ Lệ (0) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận H.nh công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Chelistie

texts.en:
Chelistie E. is a single woman who lives in Sitio San Juan, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and E-load retailer businesses. 

Chelistie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Chelistie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her businesses so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her businesses. 

Chelistie E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Tutafika Group

texts.en:
Charles P. is in his mid-forties and is married, with three children. Charles owns a small tailoring business from which he tailors men's clothes, as well as selling women's and children's clothing. Charles has been running this business since the year 2000. The tailor shop is open between 2 a.m. and 2:30 p.m., and earns Charles a good monthly profit.

This till be Charles second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Charles used his previous loan to buy a new sewing machine, a loan which he has successfully repaid. Charles aims to use his second loan to increase his stock of textiles, as he hopes to offer a greater variety to his customers.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group Tutafika, which is made up of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Charles can be seen in the middle of the front row, wearing white.

loans.use: To increase their stock of textiles.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the village of Segatic daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a transportation service. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This loan will be Jocelyn's seventh loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmer, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Belizario

texts.es:
Belizario tiene 20 años de edad y convive junto con su novia. Ambos residen el una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Reque, un distrito bastante comercial situado a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un grupo de animales menores los cuales cría en algunos corrales ubicados cerca a la vivienda donde actualmente reside. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre suelen visitar la localidad en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como chofer de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la cual brinda servicio de transporte en su localidad.

Belizario ha estado ahorrando dinero para poder adquirir una mototaxi nueva, ya que la que actualmente maneja no es suya, el desea completar la suma que necesita para lograr su objetivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Belizario is 20 years old and lives together with his girlfriend.  They both live in a marginal urban area of Reque district, a commercial district located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Belizario has a group of young animals which he raises in some pens near his house.  When they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the traders who are always visiting the town in which he lives.

Belizario also works as the driver of a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorbike with a carriage behind it which is used to transport cargo and passengers)..  He uses his vehicle to offer transport services in his town.

Belizario has been saving money to buy a new mototaxi' since the one he is currently using doesn't belong to him.  He would like to complete the sum of money that he needs to achieve his goal.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy a new 'mototaxi'

loans.name: María Martina

texts.es:
María Martina es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmoa, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con establecimiento en su domicilio en donde suele ofrecer prendas de vestir para todo público. Usualmente ofrece su mercadería al crédito y al contado. El negocio ya tiene una antigüedad de cuatro años y durante este tiempo se ha vuelto bastante conocida, actualmente cuenta con una clientela fiel. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

María desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que suele incrementarse durante la temporada navideña. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Martina, 37, is a mother living with her family in Olmoa district, a farming zone with fairly active commercial movement, located in Lambayeque province over an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has an establishment at home where she sells clothes to the public.  She usually sells both for cash and on credit.  The store has been in operation for four years and has become quite well known during this time; she can currently count on her regular customers.  She uses income from sales to help her family get ahead.

María would like to expand the business acquiring more merchandise to meet customer demand that tends to increase during the Christmas season.  She has, therefore, asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 59-year-old married man living with his wife and one child. He has made his life as a professional builder. He has been involved in this type of business for the past 25 years. He represents the only financial support to his family. He works closely with some construction entrepreneurs. 

Due to his long experience and good business reputation, his business level has developed. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his construction tools and replace the long-used ones.

loans.use: to renew his construction tools

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P., is from the barangay of Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old, married and has seven children. To make a living, Lilia sells dried fish in the local community. She has been in business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In January 2010, Lilia joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Lilia is now requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell. This will be 3rd loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Bacilio

texts.es: Bacilio tiene 52 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. El es arquitecto y desde hace 20 años que se dedica en la elaboración de planos arquitectónicos, esta profesión es uno de sus grandes pasiones. Desde realiza esto planos para construcciones  aprobadas por el municipio de su localidad. Es un profesional muy reconocido de su zona, ya  que conocen la calidad y vocación de su trabajo, Paralelo a ello, se dedica a vender cervezas, de la misma manera dedica su tiempo en la agricultura. Su principal apoyo son sus hijos que le ayudan en el transporte y cuida de cada detalle en el comercio que realiza. Los servicios como arquitecto son rentables por lo que ha decidió implementar y mejorar sus herramientas. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una impresora para su taller de planos arquitectónicos y también invertirá una parte en la agricultura, para ello comprará abono.
texts.en:
Bacilio is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his own home.  He is an architect and has been making blueprints, one of his great passions, for 20 years.  The drawings he makes are for buildings appoved by the local authorities.  He is a very well-known professional in his area where people are familiar with the quality and skill that go into his work.  He also sells beer and does some farming.

He is mainly supported by his children who help him with the logistics and details of his business.  The architectural services provide a good income so he decided to acquire better tools.  This is his fifth loan through MPF.  He is grateful for the financial support and has always paid back the loans on time.  He enjoys being part of the communal bank because of the committed, supportive members.   He thanks all the lenders who are helping him expand his business.

He plans to use the loan to buy a printer for his blueprint workshop and also to buy sacks of fertilizer for his farming activity.

loans.use: To buy a printer and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn, wood, and bags

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
El señor Roger Antonio B. es trabajador, esforzado, emprendedor y con grandes metas en primero es tener su casa y un carro. Él tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace 5 años la cual inicio vendiendo chiverías meneíto, platanito, fresquito, boli, tortillitas, palitos…etc. 
B. junto con su esposa trabajan arduamente en su negocio e invertirá el crédito en productos en especial granos básicos y maíz para la tortillería que tiene.
texts.en: Roger Antonio B. is a hard worker, dedicated, and enterprising, with big dreams, the first being to have his own home and a car. He has had a small local store for five years. He started by selling sweets, ice cream, bananas, fresquito (a gelatin-based dessert), boli (frozen fruit dessert, similar to a popsicle), lollipops and tortillas. Nowadays, B. and his wife both work very hard in their business and will invest the loan in products such as staple grains and corn for the tortillas they make.

loans.use: Staple grains and corn

loans.name: Letty Alexnadra

texts.es:
Letty de 28 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Vende arroz, azúcar, enlatados, aceites etc. Su esposo le ayuda ha venido ayudando económicamente. Mientras que ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que quiere darle una buena vida a sus hijos de 6, 5 y 2 años de edad. Quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceites para su pequeña tienda. En el futuro quiere hacer su casa de cemento ya que ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
28 year-old Letty is a hard-working woman who owns a small store which is located in the front of her home.  She sells rice, sugar, canned goods, oils, etc.  Her husband helps her financially.  Letty works from 8.00am to 8.00pm.

Letty has many aspirations for her business as she would like to provide her children, aged 6, 5 and 2, with a good life.  She would like to use her loan to buy rice, sugar and oils for her small store.  In the future, she would like to construct her house from cement as it is currently built from cane.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn S. is a widow with three sons and three daughters (in the photo Horn is on the right, and her daughter is on the left). One is married, one is a construction worker, two are garment factory workers and two are employed full-time. The family lives along National Road Number One about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Horn stays at home. Her main source of income is from her children’s salaries. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair her kitchen and fill up the land around her house.

loans.use: To repair her kitchen and fill up the land around her house

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
Yenny, D. 41 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Ricardo D. 46 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. El restaurante D. Yenny esta ubicado en una D. las calles principales del distrito D. Carabayllo, el cual es muy concurrido por las personas, debido a lo sabroso D. L. comida y a L. variedad D. platos que ofrece al publico, lo cual a hecho que su restaurante sea uno D. los más conocidos.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y le gusta hacerlo bien, puesto que sabe que una buena atención hará que vuelvan pronto, lleva 10 año cocinando para sus clientes y lo más difícil para elL. es atender al mismo tiempo a todas las personas que asisten a su restaurante, espera poder mejorar L. infraestructura D. su negocio en el futuro y así poder brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta segura D. poder hacerlo, al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, en su banco comunal siente que esta realizando una buena labor y que le tienen mucho respeto por L. puntualidad que demuestra. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, renovará sus utensilios D. cocina y arreglará mejor el ambiente D. su restaurante.
texts.en:
Yenny is 41 years old. She is a kind and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Ricardo, who is 46 years old, and their 3 beloved children, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Yenny's restaurant is located on one of the main streets in the district of Carabayllo. It is well known to people due to the deliciousness of its food and the variety of dishes it offers the public. This has maD. it into one of the best known restaurants. 

What she like the most about her work is serving customers and she likes to do it well since she knows that good service will make them come back soon. She has been cooking for her customers for 10 years and the hardest thing for her is serving all the people in her restaurant at the same time. She hopes to improve the business' infrastructure in the future and thus offer her cusomers better service. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time and she is sure that she will be able to do it, the same as with her first loan. In her community banks she feels that she is doing a good job and she has a lot of respect for the punctuality she has demonstrated. With the three thousand nuevos soles she has acted for, she will renew the kitchen utensils and fix up the ambience of the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and restore her food stand

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela A. L.  y su familia son grandes emprendedores, que a partir de sus trabajos independientes en negocios,  han logrado sacar adelante su hogar del cual tienen dos hijos en las edades de 20 y 23 años,  a quienes sueñan verlos muy exitosos y cada día progresando. Mientras el esposo de Ángela tiene una tienda desde hace 20 años, ella hace dos, creó nuevas oportunidades de generar ingresos para su familia, pues emprendió el negocio de vender   prendas de plata, mediante el sistema de crédito a clientes muy bien seleccionados y  muchos de ellos en la actualidad le han solicitado joyas de oro, pero Angela es una mujer pensante y por ahora está construyendo el capital para poder invertir en este nuevo producto que  requiere más dinero.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará pulseras, cadenas, aretes, tobilleras anillos y dijes de plata, que tiene encargado a propósito del día de las madres, pues muchos clientes quieren agasajar a todas las mujeres de sus familias mediante un regalo que comprarán a Ángela. Su sueño y gran desafío es la apertura de un local dedicado a la venta de joyas, donde la exhibición de sus prendas, despierten la atención, el interés y la acción de compra, por parte de muchas personas que muy seguramente se convertirán en clientes de Ángela. Mientras esto ocurre ella continuará esmerándose por aumentar su capital de trabajo y manejando un margen de utilidad no menor de un 29%.
texts.en:
Ángela A. L. and her family are great entrepreneurs.  Through their work in their own businesses, Ángela and her husband have managed to get the members of their household ahead in life.  They have two children, aged 20 and 23, and they dream of seeing them become very successful and making progress each day.

Ángela's husband has owned a store for 20 years.  Two years ago, Ángela created new opportunities for making income for her family.  She started a business selling silver jewelry.  She started selling on credit to very carefully selected customers, many of whom are currently requesting gold jewelry from her as well.  However, Ángela is a thinking woman and right now she is gathering together the capital she needs to invest in this new product which requires more money.

Ángela is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy silver bracelets, chains, earrings, anklets, rings and charms which she has orders for, for Mother's Day.  Many customers would like to celebrate all the women in their family with a gift that they will buy from Ángela.

Ángela's dream is also her big challenge.  She would like to open a sales location where she can sell her jewelry and display her products.  This will awaken people's attention and interest and lead them to buy from her.  Very probably, many people will become Ángela's customers.  While she works towards this, she will continue putting a lot of effort into increasing her working capital and maintaining a profit margin of no less than 29%.

loans.use: to buy silver bracelets, chains, earrings, anklets, rings and charms

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is 56 years old and is married with 2 children.

She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like cooking oil and spices.

Nila has previously borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari(variety) store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Nila aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her general store

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maruja; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende fideos, arroz, azúcar, harinas, aceite y golosinas, la socia trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Maruja is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she sells noodles, rice, sugar, flour, oil and candies.  She works from 5.00am to 10.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Maruja would like to expand and improve her grocery store.  She is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale.

Maruja is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a widow born in 1972.  She was married to Mr. Ndifon Augustin and is blessed with five children, two of them are under fifteen years old. They live in a three room apartment in Tumuku quarter in the Belo subdivision. Evelyn received her first loan of 50,000 FCFA from GHAPE in 2009. She embarked on a retail store business in her area.

Evelyn is applying for her second loan to increase stock in her store. This loan will be used to buy 20 liters of honey for 30,000 FCFA, 100kg of rice for 30,000 FCFA, a cartoon of soap for 15,000 FCFA, and 125kg of groundnut for 35,000 FCFA. She knows that her trade will be a success because her store is the only one in the quarter and she always meets the demands of the people. Her trade actually helps the community since the demands of the people are satisfied. 

Evelyn had problems in life when the husband died and she was unable to pay her children's school fees. She will use the gain from her loan to buy a plot of land for her children and educate them. She preferred a loan from GHAPE because repayment is in small installments and it offers some training on how loans are to be used.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy rice, honey, groundnut and soap for resale

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is a 51-year-old married woman living in Pinopoc, Alcala, Cagayan. Leonarda has three children. Leonarda's spouse works as a carpenter in their place of residence.

She has been in the business of hog raising for over a year. She plans to use this loan to purchase feed for sustainability and buy vitamins and medicines to ensure good nutrition.

In the future, Leonarda would like to enhance her hog-selling business in order to generate more income and provide a successful living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for sustainability and buy vitamins and medicines to ensure good nutrition.

loans.name: Sainte Cathérine Plus Group

texts.en:
Mamu is the chairwoman of a community bank named “Sainte Cathérine Plus” composed of 15 small business owners. Bank members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Mamu is 57 years old and married. She is the mother of nine children, ranging in age between 17 and 27. Three of her children attend school. Mamu’s main activity is selling smoked fish from her business located west of the city of Kinshasa. Besides that, she also sells beverages. Currently, her business brings in 30 USD weekly. Mamu has been a micro-entrepreneur since 2007 and is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC. She has received and repaid four previous loans. 

Mamu is requesting a loan to increase her stock of goods by buying packages of smoked fish to meet the high demand of the customers in her community and to make more profits. Her ambition is to become the best smoked fish provider in her area.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Nukramo

texts.en:
Nukramo is an honest and hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver in a local city. Nukramo sells woman’s fabrics at the market of “Korvon” in Dushanbe city. She has been selling fabrics for 13 years and she has broad experience in this business. Nukramo wishes to improve her living conditions and expand her business. She would like to get a loan of $1,900 for purchasing more women’s fabrics to sell.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy women’s fabrics.

loans.name: Milo

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Milo is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy feed and vaccines for his hog-raising business. He hopes that in the future, his business will grow to fully support the studies of his children to become professionals someday. 

He is 49 years old, married and has three school-age children. He has been a farmer for almost 20 years, earning a net profit of PHP 36,000 for the sold fattened pigs. Milo is doing his best to keep his business growing.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijas y de 1 hijo y reside en el Barrio La Ceiba, en el Municipio de La Union. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y en algunas ocasiones tambien vende cosmeticos y golosinas. Su mayor dificultad es su edad, ya que muy seguido le dan achaques, pero gracias a Dios tiene a su hija menor que depende de ella y ésta le ayuda a trabajar. Por las tardes van de casa en casa a vender la ropa y los cosmeticos, y por la tarde noche en frente de su casa colocan una mesita y empiezan a vender golosinas como pastelitos, yuca con chicharon, tajaditas de platano verde, entre otras. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar fardos de ropa usada para la temporada de lluvia, cosmeticos para que sus vecinas perfeccion su belleza e insumos para la preparacion de las golosinas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo Doña Santos podra seguir manteniendo sus negocios activos y esto le permitira seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para sostenerse ella y su hija, y tambien podra tratarse medicamente. Su compañera de Grupo Ganiria Araceli se dedica a la venta de ropa. Doña Santos ha tenido varios prestamos en FAMA y ha pagado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is 55 years old and a single mother with three daughters and a son. They reside in the neighborhood of La Ceiba in the town of La Union. She has been selling secondhand clothes for five years and on occasion she will also sell cosmetics and sweets. Her greatest difficulty is her age because she suffers from various ailments, but she thanks God that she has a young daughter who is able to help her with her work. In the afternoons, she goes from house-to-house to sell clothing and cosmetics. At night, she sets up a small table in front of her house and begins selling sweets such as miniature pastries, cassava and pork, green plantain chips, and other items.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bundles of used clothing for the rainy season, cosmetics that will help her neighbors achieve perfect beauty, and supplies for preparing sweets. With the help of this loan, Doña Santos can keep her businesses active. This will allow her to continue having a source of income to sustain herself and her daughter. She will also be able receive medical treatment.

Her fellow group member is Ganiria Araceli, who also sells clothing. Doña Santos has received several loans from FAMA and has completed her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 38 years old. She is divorced from her husband who is working with an NGO. She has four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a hotel service business (restaurant) in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan for three years.

Lina requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to be able to purchase the requirements listed above so that she can operate her hotel and build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more water, chairs and tables

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
