Patrick is a 29-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to own a fully-fledged video hall (small cinema showing videos or television broadcasts) in the next three years. 

For five years he has been into videography and photography and the business is still booming. His major challenge has been unsettled debts and limited space in his business premises. Patrick needs the loan to complete building his video hall.

loans.use: to complete building his video hall

loans.name: Carlos Orlig

texts.es:
Carlos Orlig tiene 42 años de edad tiene tres hijos es soltero, vive con los hijos de dos, dieciocho y catorce años de edad en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Unión y progreso la Colombia baja esta conformada por 15 socios y esta ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa Se dedican a las Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, soya, plátano, naranja etc.

Las compras de los productos los realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.Solicita el crédito para sembrar cacao, arroz, maíz y  comprar abonos , fertilizantes, insumos, líquidos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El crédito le ayudara para poder obtener productos de calidad para porder venderlo a un mejor precio y mejorar el ingreso económico.

El sueño de Carlos es poder comprar una casa para que pueda vivir con la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho caminar y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Carlos is 42 years old, single, and has three children two of which live with him. They are 18 and 14 years old. They live in the Chillanes Province of Bolívar. 

The "VRC Unión y Progreso la Columbia", was formed by 15 members and is located 90 minutes from the cooperative. They work in the agricultural activities of planting cocoa, rice, corn, soy, bananas, oranges, among others.

Each weekend they buy supplies in San José del Tambo. He is asking for a loan for the planting of cocoa, rice, and corn including manure, fertilizer, supplies and pest control to maintain the crops in good condition. The loan will help him produce a quality crop in order to sell at a good price, which will provide a better income. 

Carlos's dream is to buy a house where he can live with his family. In his free time he likes to walk and listen to music.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant cocoa, rice, and corn including manure, fertilizers, supplies, and pest control

loans.name: Braulita

texts.en: Braulita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Braulita has operated a tailoring shop for 10 years, making and repairing dresses and uniforms. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials for tailoring, such as cloth and scissors. Braulita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Braulita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for tailoring

loans.name: Alonane

texts.en: Alonane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rope-making business in the Philippines. Alonane requested a 12,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy materials for her rope-making business. Alonane has been in this business for five years. In the future, Alonane would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda and her husband own and manage a rice farming business to generate income. They have been farming for more than 20 years and usually earn a profit of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest season. They use their income for their daily consumption and for allowance for their child. They aim to become financially stable to continue sending their child to school and to give him a bright future. 

Despite financial difficulties, they aim to expand their rice plantation to increase their yields. She is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides for their rice farming business. She believes that her loan will help her to improve their rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for a rice farming business

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: La socia continua administrando su negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, ella compra ormigon, cemento, arena al por mayor y desea implementar su negocio y tambien comprar cemento, ladrilos, arena en esta ocasion la socia desea invertir en la compra de estos materiales.
texts.en: The member continues managing her building materials and supplies business.  She buys concrete, cement and sand at wholesale and she wants to equip her business and also to buy cement, bricks and sand.  On this occasion she wants to invest in the purchase of these materials.

loans.use: to equip her business and also to buy cement, bricks and sand.

loans.name: Gricelda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Gricelda tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañada con cuatro hijos.
Ella aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde hace 20 años de edad. Fue su madre quien le enseño. Griselda además  elabora y vende  pupusas y bebidas desde hace 10 años junto con su esposo. Se levantan a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar a la cosecha,  ellos caminan unos 3 kilómetros. Griselda trabaja 6 horas, luego se regresa a la casa a preparar las cosas para elaborar las pupusas y las vende enfrente del cementerio de la ciudad,  mientras su esposo se queda trabajando en la cosecha. 
Griselda camina a pie durante dos horas aproximadamente dos kilómetros, por quebradas y veredas, para abordar el autobús que la conduce a la ciudad donde compra los insumos agrícolas y la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las pupusas.  
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar abono y quesillo, chicharrón, entre otros insumos para elaborar las pupusas y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. De esta manera ella no presentara problemas con su cosecha ni con su negocio de venta de pupusas y bebidas, por que dispondrá de materia prima para elaborarlas, lo cual le ayudara para llevar el sustento a su familia. 
Gricelda ahorrara de sus ingresos para comprar vacas lecheras. Para incrementar sus ingresos y brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Gricelda is 33 years old and has four children. Her mother taught her how to farm 20 years ago. Gricelda also makes and sells pupusas and drinks. She has been doing this for 10 years together with her husband. The couple get up at 4.00am to go and work on their crops. They walk 3 kilometers to do this. Gricelda works for 6 hours then returns home to prepare what she needs to make her pupusas. She sells her pupusas opposite the town cemetery while her husband continues working on their crops. Gricelda walks for two hours, approximately two kilometers, alongside streams and along sidewalks, to catch the bus that will drive her into the city where she buys her agricultural supplies and the raw materials she needs to make her pupusas. Gricelda is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy manure and also quesillo (soft cheese) and chicharrón (cooked pork meat) and other supplies for making pupusas and products to offer her customers. This will mean that she will not experience problems with her crops or her pupusa and drinks business as she will have the raw materials that she needs available. This will help her to provide for her family. Gricelda will save her income so that she can buy dairy cows in order to increase her income and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure, and also quesillo, chicharrón and other supplies for making pupusas and  products to offer her customers

loans.name: Maria Isabelina

texts.es: La señora María Isabelina a sus 44 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos, se dedica desde su finca a trabajar la cría y levante de ganado lechero, además tiene gallinas ponedoras;la leche de las vacas la vende al carro recolector que pasa por su finca ubicada en una vereda del municipio del carmen de viboral ubicado al oriente de Antioquia y los huevos de las gallinas a sus vecinos. La señora María Isabelina cuenta con amplia experiencia ya que toda la vida ha vivido en el campo y su familia se ha dedicado a la ganadería y la agricultura. La señora María Isabelina desea comprar una ternera con la cual pueda continuar creciendo con su actividad y mejorar sus ingresos. Con lo anterior podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sus condiciones económicas. El sueño de la señora María Isabelina es sacar adelante a su familia y tener muchos más animales.
texts.en: María Isabelina, who is 44 years old, is the mother of three children.  She works on her farm, growing and raising dairy cows.  She also has laying hens.  She sells the milk from the cows to the collection car which passes by her farm.  The farm is located on a path from the Carmen de Viboral municipality located to the east of Antioquia.  She sells the chickens' eggs to her neighbors.  María Isabelina has plenty of experience since she has lived her whole life on the farm, and her family is dedicated to ranching and agriculture.  María Isabelina wants to buy a calf with which she can continue to grow in her business and improve her income.  With the loan, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life and their economic conditions.  María Isabelina's dream is to help her family get ahead and to have many more animals.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Kosal is 30 years old, while her husband, Oun, is 48 years old. They live in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two young children, one son and one daughter. 

Kosal and her husband are rice farmers. Additionally, Kosal’s husband also sells cows. He buys cows from the nearby districts and resells them to a middleman who comes to buy them at his home.  

Kosal is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to help raise capital for her husband to buy additional cows for resale.

Note: In the photo, Kosal is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to help raise capital for her husband to buy additional cows for resale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 50 years old, married and has three children. He is a farmer who does livestock farming. He has employed one person in his business. He also grows potatoes to earn additional income. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Julius has been trained on business management skills and he has learned how to manage his business. Julius hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

Julius needs a loan of 10,900 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp. He will use the lamp to light his house because he lives in a rural area where there is no electricity.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is a married woman living in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family. She has had a sari-sari store business for 9 years. Esmaelita sells items like canned goods, eggs, shampoo and soap. Esmaelita works hard to improve her business and continue supporting her family.

Esmaelita has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as noodles, eggs and canned goods. Esmaelita plans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Jayette

texts.en:
Jayette is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jayette is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Jayette has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jayette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

loans.name: Bint Ndawa

texts.en:
Bint Ndawa is a married woman with nine children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a mat-weaving business, selling from door-to-door to town dwellers and neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bamboo slivers as materials for weaving mats. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo slivers as materials for weaving mats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows and start a dairy farming business.

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en: Meleseke is a married mother of two who lives in the village of Vailele. She is the only pork cake maker of the center. She joined the program just last year, but now she has already paid off her third loan of $1250.00. Her record of paying the loans tells you how good and honest she is.

loans.use: To purchase an oven.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy containers of paint

loans.name: Maria Celestina

texts.es:
My business is a small ‘apulperia’ (Grocery store) where I sell various delicacies like Churros, candies, cookies, bottled drinks, bread, beans etc. My business has helped me to support my family and provide my children with a good education. I have run this business in my house for three years, so that I do not have to rent a space. Now I need to buy more products to give my customers, neighbors from my village, better service.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo este pequeño negocio que es un apulperia (Grocery store) donde vendo varias golosinas como; Churros, confites, galletas, refrescos de botella, pan jabon, frijoles etec. El cual, me ayudado mucho a mantener ami familia y mis hijos para poderles dar una buena educacion mandandols al colegio. Este negocio lo tengo hace 3 años en mi casa. ya que no tengo para pagar un local. Ahora nesecito comprar mas productopara pder dar un mejor servicio a mis clientes los cuales son mis vesinos de mi colonia.

loans.use: To purchase bread, churros, cookies, candy, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Margot Rosalía

texts.es:
Margot lives with her husband and three children in Juliaca, a beautiful city in which they chose to settle for the sake of her husband's work. The need to provide for her childen and especially their education prompted Margot to open a wine shop. At first she sold within her circle of acquaintances but she soon found other customers and now supplies various local restaurants in addition to members of the community. Faced with growing demand Margot finds herself in need of more capital to increase her stock and expand her product line. She is asking for $650 and promises to repay the loan within 8 months. She is counting on your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Margot, actualmente radica en Juliaca junto a su esposo y tres hijos, por motivos laborales del jefe de familia decidieron establecerse en esta bella ciudad y emprender sus proyectos juntos. Debido a las exigencias que genera la educación y manutención de sus tres pequeños hijos decide iniciar el negocio de la venta de vinos.Esta actividad en un principio la realizaba dentro de su entorno amical únicamente pero conforme iban comprando esta bebida iba incrementando también su demanda y recomendación.Ahora los ofrece a los restaurantes y demás pobladores de su comunidad. A raíz de este acontecimiento es que Margot se ve en la necesidad de incrementar su capital; para invertirlo en la compra de más variedad y cantidad de vinos a fin de copar la demanda de sus clientes satisfactoriamente. Su solicitud es por un monto de 650 dólares con un compromiso de pago por un período de 8 meses y para iniciar su proyecto desea contar con tu ayuda.

loans.use: To expand the product line of her wine shop.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: I am a widow and the mother of four children. I sell rugs and carpets door to door, whereas my son operates a ready made garments business. He had to quit his studies after his father’s death to support the family and help his younger brother and sisters continue with their studies. We need a loan of US$350 to expand the ready made garments business. My son will buy garments in bulk and will save on the cost per item.

loans.use: Buy ready made garments in bulk

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen A. is married with a 5 month old baby.  His wife is a seamstress who supports the family in her small way. He is a well known electrician/trader at Moree, where he lives. He also receives orders from electrical contractors for electrical supplies. There has been a tremendous increase in demand for electrical parts from his customers.  He is asking for $1,200 to increase his working capital to buy more electrical parts to meet the increasing demand of his customers.

loans.use: To increase his working capital to buy more electrical parts to meet the increasing demand of his customers.

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en:
A 35 year-old woman, Mrs. Ifeoma E. is married with four children. She lives in Benin City where she sells cooked food to the people in her community.

She is requesting the loan of $875 to buy more foodstuffs for cooking. She has been in this business since 1992 and has had three years of training in this business. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy additional food Items for cooking and selling

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti N., 29, and her husband have one child. She sells clothes on credit door-to-door around the villages and earns $25 a week. Her husband, Tulus, works at a construction site and earns $30 a month. She is a member of MBK and would like a loan of $100 to expand her business. She has agreed to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Heam

texts.en: Mrs. Heam Y., 35, is a mother of two children and works as a construction laborer in Phnom Penh city, making on average of $4 a day of profit. Her husband also works at the construction site earning about $3.50 a day. Because of big concerns with their low daily income, this couple has decided to open another business with a  loan from Kiva to be used to purchase a plot of land for farming. They strongly believe that growing rice will increase their revenue and lead to increasing the standard of living for their family. They thank for your help.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and one of her children. Two other children are grown up and have their own jobs. The family's main business is farming, raising ducks and fish, as well as growing bananas and mangos. The family sells fish twice a year, which is their main source of income.

This year Mrs. Nguyen Thi N. wants to borrow $575 to raise some pigs as another source of income.

loans.use: Invest in raising pigs

loans.name: Comité 29 De Setiembre Group

texts.en:
The Committee of Entrepreneuring Women is a program carried out by Fundación Paraguaya which targets groups of enterprising women who create a village bank through which they receive assistance in terms of loans. The main goal is to give them the opportunity to carry out economic activities which enable them to live in dignity and contribute to a better quality of life in their homes. Lending to poor women creates a cascading effect that brings social and economic benefits to a whole family, and thus to the entire community. What is more, the sense of belonging to a group gives these poor women, as members of a Committee, the energy and motivation to reach success.

The Committee “29 de setiembre” (September 29th) is formed of a group of 20 women who live in Limpio. A woman who wanted to become member of another Committee in Villa Elisa city could not make it because she was not living in the same town. As a result she contacted 19 other women living in the same town (Limpio) and convinced them to form another group. That is how “29 de septiembre” (September 29th) was born. Today the Commitee is on its 8th loan cycle and they can request loans ranging from 100.000 to 1.600.000 guaranies (US$ 25 to 400) per member.

Among the businesses these women run are: despensas (grocery stores), sewing shops, sales of cheese, food, drinks, jewelry, cloth, fruits, vegetables, lingerie, and sheets. The money provided by the loan will be used for the purchase of lingerie, meat, vegetables, fruits, jewelry, candies, fabrics, thread, cloth and others.

loans.use: Purchase of lingerie, meat, vegetables, fruits, jewelry, candies, fabrics, thread, cloth and others

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun C., 73, and her husband, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married since she was 16 years old and have six children, three sons and three daughters. All of them are married and live outside the family home with the exception of their youngest daughter, who has full time employment in Phnom Penh, while Mrs. Yun’s son in-law sells mobile phones and motorcycle at his shop, also in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yun, formerly a silk weaver, has been selling silk products for many years. She buys the products from her village for resale in nearby provinces, and she also spins silk at home. Although of advanced years, she is still strong enough to work. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 for her son-in-law to expand his business of selling cell phones and motorcycles.

loans.use: For her son-in-law to expand his business of selling cell phones and motorcycles.

loans.name: Nga Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nga Thi N. (SEDA ID 020059) is 33 year old. She borrows 2,714,000 Vietnamese Dong for her plan of raising small farming animals and making tofu. Her 2 sons are still at school age. She has borrowed the loan once and repaid on time. At the moment, the family frequent incomes are at level of 100,000 Vietnamese Dong, approximately $6.93, per day.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nga (MS: 020059), năm nay 33 tuổi. Chị vay 2.714.000 VND để chăn nuôi, làm đậu phụ. Gia đình có thu nhập thường xuyên. Chị đã vay vốn một lần và hoàn trả rất tốt. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Mức thu nhập bình quân 110.000 VND/ngày.

loans.use: Raise small farming animals and make tofu

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es:
Mariette has a pension (small restaurant) where she sells food (lunch at midday and at night grilled meat and silpancho, a Bolivian dish with meat, rice and potatoes). Her husband is a driver and they have two school-aged children.

This credit will be used to buy tables and chairs for the implementation of the business, as the business has the space to attend to customers, but does not have furniture. The loan will be a great help and will increase her income and improve her quality of life. Her home is located in the Villa San Antonio Bajo neighborhood in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time that she has requested a loan and the second time that she has needed Kiva’s help. Her history qualifies her for the loan, as she has paid back what she has borrowed in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Mariette tiene una pensión (pequeño restaurant) donde vende comida ( almuerzo a medio día y por las noches silpancho y asado) y su esposo es chofer, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.

El crédito será destinado para la compra de mesas y sillas para la implementación en el negocio ya que cuenta con espacio para la atención de comida pero no cuenta con muebles, por lo cual será de gran ayuda este crédito ya que aumentara su nivel de ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa san Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requiere la ayuda de Kiva su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Zikriddin

texts.en:
Zikriddin N. is 43 years old. He is married with three children. Zikriddin raises and sells cattle. He purchases the young cattle in the central market, feeds them and then re-sells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 3 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals and how to breed them and look after them.

Thus, he gets up every morning at five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his large family.

Zikriddin has already been provided with a loan by IMON and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower with a positive credit history. Today, knowing that the prices for animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Zikriddin is planning to enlarge his herd and purchase cows and calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 1000 US Dollars for a term of 12 months. You could become an important part in Zikriddin's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: Purchasing cows and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Shomolu

texts.en:
Shomolu K. is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Issashi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells weavons, hair extensions, and hair cream. She is also a hair stylist, which she learned how to do over three years. She opened her own salon in 1990. She makes lovely hairstyles for her customers.

Shomolu is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan for $1200 to buy more weavons and hair extensions to sell. She said that with the help of the Kiva loan, she would be able to increase her business and make more profit. She thanks all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and hair extension to sell.

loans.name: Maali

texts.en: Maali M. is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three children. All her children are currently in school.  Maali is a food vendor and she prepares waakye (cooked brown rice with beans, eaten with vegetable sauce or shito) which most people eat in the morning, evening, and sometimes in the afternoon. Schoolchildren and workers in her neighborhood also enjoy it because of its affordability. She has been selling waakye and stew for ten years.  Now she wants to buy more rice, vegetables, and vegetable oil to avoid price hikes in the commodities. She hopes to increase her savings towards her children’s future with this loan. She is a member of the group called “Saamu” which means "receiving." Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during one of their group meetings.

loans.use: To buy rice, vegetables, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Cecilia Z. D. tiene 41 años de edad, sus estado civil es casada, Doña Martha tiene 2 hijos su hija mayor tiene 19 años de edad y cursa reciente mente el 2 año de administración y su hijo menor 16 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañero de vida labora como obrero en una constructora, sus propósitos son de establecer su propio negocio en un lugar donde represente las condiciones adecuadas, en sus deseos esta el ayudar a sus hijos a seguir adelante para que puedan defenderse en un futuro y prepáralos para el mañana.


La actividad económica a la que ella se dedica es la venta de productos médicos, el tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 10 años, en sus inicios empieza vendiendo productos médicos en el campus de la universidad de León a los estudiantes que llevan la carrera de odontología y mas tarde decide realizar la distribución de sus productos en las diferentes farmacias en león por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que consiste en la compra: alcohol, acetona, moldes para la dentadura ya que las compras las realiza en Managua por lo que tiene que buscar el lugar donde a ella le ofrezcan el producto mas accesible.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha Cecilia Z. D. is a married 41-year-old mother with 2 children. Her eldest child, age 19, is currently in her second year of Business Administration, while her youngest child, age 16, is currently in his fourth year of high school. Her husband works in construction. Her goal is to establish her own business in an optimal location. She also wishes to help her children get ahead and prepare them for tomorrow so that they can get by in the future.

She has been selling medical products for a living for 10 years. Initially, she would sell medical products to the dentistry students on campus at the University of León. Later, she decided to distribute her products to the different pharmacies in León. She is requesting this loan to use as work capital to buy: alcohol, acetone, molds for making dental impressions, etc. She purchases these products in Managua, where she has to search for the place that sells them to her at an affordable price.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Nakabugo A-Rashida Nakitende Group

texts.en:
Rashida N. (far right) is a hardworking business lady of 24. She is married to a city taxi driver and is the mother of two children, ages 2 and 5. The couple is also looking after three orphaned children of her husband’s late brother.  Rashida wants a happy, healthy, educated, and supported family.  

She rears poultry broilers at home, from which she earns some income to sustain her family. To prevent the loss of her poultry to diseases, she ensures good hygiene, healthy feeds and regular vaccination. She will use the loan to purchase maize brand feeds for the poultry. Rashida hopes that when her business generates more profits, she will be able to buy layers so that she can supply eggs to the retailers in her locality.

loans.use: Purchase maize brand feeds for the poultry.

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Min S., 38, pictured here with her husband, is married and lives with her husband in the Batheay district, Kampong Cham province. She is a local doctor and sells medicine from her home to earn a living and is able to make $5 a day, while her husband is a rice farmer and typically makes $4 a day to help support the family.  This couple together have two school-aged children. Mrs. Min S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilisers for her husband's farm and the rest of the money will be used for additional medicines.

loans.use: To purchase fertilisers.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Q. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Matilda Huchani y sus tres hijas.
El señor Roberto es oficial de bajo rango en la policía nacional y su esposa es empleada en un restaurante, como ayudante de cocina.
El crédito es para la instalación de alcantarillado de su vivienda con servidumbre al vecino ( esto es comun en la ciudad de La Paz, se usa una parte del alcantarillado del vecino cuando la casa está localizada en una parte que está muy lejos de la calle principal donde corre el alcantarillado maestro de la zona).
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Roberto Q. lives with his wife Matilda Huchani and their three daughters in a house he owns in Pasankeri to the west of the city of La Paz. Roberto is a low-ranking official in the National Police and his wife is employed in a restaurant as a cook's helper. The loan will be used to install a sewer connection from the main city sewer line to his home with an offshoot to his neighbour's (this is common in the city of La Paz: one part of a neighbour's drainage is used when the house is too far from the main road where the main sewer line for the area is located). This is his fourth loan and our socio-economic analysis has determined that he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the installation of a sewer connection to his home.

loans.name: Betania 1B Group

texts.en:
Betania 1b is a group of 10 farmers in Nekmese Naet Village – Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province in Indonesia. This group is led by Ande K., a 29-year-old man. He is married and has 1 daughter, aged 1. His wife usually helps him on the farm. The soil in Nekmese Naet Village where Ande lives is fertile, and it has potential to growth coconut and banana. Most of the community in this village relies on the agricultural sector to earn money. The weather and climate in this area is good as the season changes every 6 months. 

Ande is interested in the cattle fattening program because he wants to improve his living standard as a farmer, and the availability of cattle food that he has encourages him to join the cattle fattening program. Ande is requesting loan from TLM amounting to Rp 3,300,000 to buy young cattle to be fattened in 12 months. The other borrowers of Betania 1b group are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened. After the cattle have been fattened for 12 months, they will be sold and the initial cost of the cattle will be repaid to the lender and the group members will get the profit from the sale.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 24 year old man who lives with his wife in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Ibrahim has owned a butcher shop since 2007. He requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase lamb for his shop. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him purchase merchandise for his shop and improve his financial situation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ibrahim chose his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase lamb for his butcher shop

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 49 años de edad  ella vive en una ciudad de comayaguela que se llama Peña vieja, es una zona que esta bien poblada de pavimento las casas esta en forma continua cuentan con todos los servicios publicos. Doña Santos ha tenido su pequeño negocio por 30 años, ella compra el maiz la leña, maseca en pulperias, y las vende en su casa, asi mismo entrega doscientos lempiras diarios en una Casa de Beneficiencia Aldeas S.O.S. le pagan mensual seis mil lempiras por una ganancia mensual de $ 300,00 ya que es una buena opcion ya ella puede ver su ganacia mensual, ella se ha dedicado toda su vida a la venta de tortillas, ella tomo un bus para irlas a entregar es muy querida por la gente, a ella le ayuda sus hijas por las mañanas ya que por las tardes va a la universidad, invirtio el prestamo anterior en comprar maiz, leña al por mayor asi puede bajar los gastos ya que puede ir a comprar a un mercado local y gastar menos, ella necesita nuestro apoyo para comprar maiz,leña maseca de nuevo ya que quiere invertir mas, ella vive con su suegra  que es una sra.muy agradable de 80 años con su esposo y sus dos hijas ya que el sueño de la cliente es ver a sus hijas graduadas,me agrado pasar una momento agradable con doña Santos
texts.en:
Doña Santos is 49 years old. She lives in a town of Comayaguela called Peña Vieja which is a densely populated area, paved, the houses are built closely and have all public services. Doña Santos has had her small business for 30 years, she buys corn, firewood, and corn flour at local stores and sells from her house. She also delivers merchandise for two hundred "lempiras" (local currency) daily to a "Casa de Beneficiencia Aldeas S.O.S." She is paid six thousand "lempiras" monthly allowing earnings of $300.00. This is a good option as she can see her monthly earnings. She has been selling tortillas all her life, she takes a bus to make the deliveries. She is very beloved by the people. Her daughters help her in the mornings as they attend university in the afternoons. A previous loan was invested in buying corn and firewood in bulk to lower costs as she can buy at a local market and spend less. She needs our support to buy corn, firewood and corn flour as the wants to invest more. She lives with her mother-in-law, who is a very nice 80-year-old lady, her husband and her two daughters. It is her dream to see her daughters graduate. I spent a pleasant moment with doña Santos.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, corn, and corn flour.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Empecemos.
Eulalia es viuda, tiene 75 años y 4 hijos, Eulalia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende coca, verduras, ropa de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes, actividad que realiza una vez por semana.
Eulalia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas, verduras.
Los sueños de Eulalia son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Empecemos ("Let's get started") Village Bank. Eulalia is 75 years old, widowed, and has four children. Eulalia travels once a week to different regional markets to sell coca leaves, vegetables, and clothing, depending on what her customers order. Eulalia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy fruits and vegetables. Eulalia dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: For the last two years, Mwanaidi has made a living selling fish in the Kola neighborhood of Morogoro. She is a member of the Railway Corter loan group, and currently earns about $175 a month by working eight hours a day. Mwanaidi is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fish to sell and expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her income will increase. Mwanaidi is 24  years old and married.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell and to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosa Beatriz

texts.en:
Rosa Beatriz is from Urcos, a small community that is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas, 50 minutes away from the city of Cusco. She is 37 years old and has two children. During the week she sells lunches in the market. A typical pork dish with a soft drink costs 10 soles.

To supplement her income Rosa Beatriz also works on the weekends. On Sundays she sells chickens on the main square in Urcos. It costs her 1,500 soles to buy the chickens in bulk and she can sell around 20 on an average Sunday. She wants to increase sales by purchasing more chickens in bulk with her loan.

Rosa Beatriz is a member of a 44-person lending group with Arariwa that receives financial training from a loan officer. She also participates in the group savings account. In the future she would like to have her own chicken store.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Rosa Beatriz from  Peru

loans.use: To buy more chickens in bulk to sell on the weekends

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en: Nabi A. is 47 years old and married, and has four children. Nabi sells confections and other food in the market. He has been in this business for ten years. His business generates the main income for Nabi’s family. Nabi is very popular in the market because he sell fresh and tasty pastry and he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Nabi is requesting a loan of $2000 USD loan to purchase more food products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Dodoma Roa Dc borrower group in Kihesa, Iringa. She is a 27-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are aged 9 and 5. She also cares for 1 other dependent.

Lucy started her own shop selling rice, cooking oil, wheat, etc. 9 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 180,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Lucy’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities: rice,wheat, and sugar. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lucy hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children -- two sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Abuakwa in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Augustina is a beautician. She is a hair dresser by profession. She buys her logistics such as cream, lotion, shampoo and artificial hair from Kumasi. She also deals in textiles and jewels. She says she has trained a number of apprentices who have graduated and have established their own salon shops. Augustina has been in business for more than 15 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy hair dressing materials

loans.name: Yustina

texts.en:
Yustina is a member of the Dodoma borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 12,10,4 years.

Yustina started her own clothing business selling kanga,vitenge(fabric) 5 years ago,she works 4 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Yustina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Yustina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
Las socias del grupo “Reynas” están representadas por la señora Maria Ana Jesús y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades como costurera D. prendas D. vestir, servicio D. peluquería, abarrotes en tienda D. barrio, transporte público D. pasajeros y a la venta D. productos como verduras, carne, detergentes, chicharrón D. pollo, pacumutus, maní y diferentes hiervas medicinales. La competencia dentro D. sus rubros es alta, pese a eso saben sacar adelante la actividad económica a la que se dedican. El crédito esta destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios con la compra D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para mejorar más sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro D. la institución pero están contentos D. que se les brinD. un apoyo económico que ayudada a generar mejores ingresos y a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia
.
texts.en:
Maria Ana Jesús represents the Reynas Group, which is comprised of 12 members. The members work at different activities like making clothes, hairdressing, having a neighborhood grocery store, and public passenger transportation. Some members sell things like vegetables, meat, detergents “chicharrón D. pollo” (fried chicken rinds), “pacamutus” (large kebobs), peanuts, and different herbal medicines. The competition in their fields is high. In spite of this, they know how to get ahead in their businesses. The loan is to grow their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and tools to improve their incomes and allow them to give their families a better quality of life. As far as their loan experience goes, the members are in their first loan cycle with the Institution. They are happy to be offered an economic support that helps generate greater income and improves their their families quality of life. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar G. L. tiene 37 años, es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ellos estudian y ayudan a Don Oscar. La actividad económica de Oscar es  la venta y elaboración quesillos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Inicio este negocio por su familia, ya que fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron este negocio a Oscar le gusto mucho ya que siempre estaba interactuando con sus clientes. Oscar es un hombre trabajador y le gusta enseñarles a sus hijos como se gana el dinero humildemente fue con el tiempo decide hacerse cargo de manera independiente de este negocio ahora es la fuente principal de sus ingresos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra materia prima para su negocio. el sueño de Oscar es seguir adelante a pesar de todas las dificultades.
texts.en:
Oscar G. L. is a married 37-year old man. He has 2 children in his care; they are in school and also help him with his business. Oscar is engaged in the business of producing and selling quesillos (a snack made with tortilla, cheese, and other ingredients). He has been selling quesillos for more than 15 years. The business was started by his family; they taught him the business. Oscar enjoys the work very much, since he is always interacting with his customers. Oscar is a hardworking man and enjoys teaching his sons how to earn money humbly. Over time he decided to take charge of this business and now it is the principal source of his income. The loan that he is requesting is for working capital to buy raw materials for his business. Oscar dreams of continuing to move ahead in spite of all of the difficulties.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Osas

texts.en:
Osas is 37 years old and married with a child. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the past five years.

Osas is requesting the loan of N30,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing has a grocery stall where she sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She hopes to own a supermarket and a boutique in the future. She is 36 years old and married with seven children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda B. is 46 years old and resides in Barangay Marobbob Amulung, Cagayan. She has three children: Jovelyn, a sixteen year old senior high school student; Jayson, a 12 year old sixth grade student; and Jocelyn, a six year old first grade student. 

Luzviminda has raised pigs behind her house for more than ten years. To meet her family's needs, moreover, she also helps her husband with farming. In order to improve her pig raising business, she decided to ask for a PHP 3,000 loan from the Kiva lenders. She will use the money to purchase more piglets.

loans.use: purchasing more piglets

loans.name: Nkodo 2 Mugagasana Joyce Group

texts.en: Joyce M. is a group representative, of forty years of age, carrying out livestock activity. She has been doing this business activity for over ten years. Because her animals could die due to the drought season, she is now using the loan to purchase more animals, feed, drugs, and so forth for livestock. She is a hard-working woman whose hopes are to raise her standards of living, educate her children and obtain other businesses for more income generation.

loans.use: To purchase animals and supplies for livestock.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy sells used clothes, jewelry and sarongs to make a living and sells daily from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. There are people in her community that cannot afford new clothes. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

Joy is 40 years old and married with five children. She is a smart and friendly woman. She needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more used clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

Joy is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesús

texts.es: Guillermo de Jesús S. B. de 44 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, departamento de San Salvador. Su familia esta conformada por su esposa la cual se dedica al trabajo del hogar y sus tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Guillermo posee una venta de tortas mejicanas y hamburguesas, las cuales las comercializa en uno de los lugares que más se vende este producto, ya que esta frente a una universidad, en la cual hay varios puestos de estos debido a la gran demanda por parte de los estudiantes que transitan por el lugar. Cada día Guillermo se dispone a preparar las tortas en su cocina móvil, con la esperanza de obtener muy buenas ganancias, lo cual beneficie a la economía familiar, esto debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen.Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de su producto, así mismo comprar más tambos de gas propano. Guillermo se destaca por se alguien muy amable y trabajador el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo de Jesús S. B., 44 years old, lives in Tonacatepeque, departament of San Salvador. His family is composed of his wife, who does the housework, and their three children, who are studying. Guillermo owns a stall in which he sells sandwiches and hamburgers. He sells them in one of the places where these products sell best, in front of the university, where there are many of these stalls due to the great demand from the students that walk past. Every day Guillermo readies himself to prepare the sandwiches in his portable kitchen, in the hopes of obtaining a very good profit which will benefit the family economy, since this is the only source of income they have.

He asks for a loan with which he can purchase the raw material he needs for his products, as well as more propane gas canisters. Guillermo's outstanding qualities are being kind and hard working and looking after the well being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for sanwhich and propane gas canisters

loans.name: Men

texts.en:
Men K. is in the business of producing handmade brooms to sell in her village. She is 48 years old, married and lives with her three children in Takeo province, Cambodia. K. earns US $2 per day. She has been in her business since 2000. Her husband is a skillful carpenter earning US $3 per day. 

K. and her family members work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to cover necessary daily expenses. Therefore, K. is requesting a loan of US $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Dimas Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Dimas G. A. es profesor de primaria de una escuelita, el dinero los solicita para compra de un terrero para hacer su casa ya que vive en terrero de sus suegro y quiere independizarse, estado civil acompañado es padre un bebe de 5años ya ha tenido 11 créditos con nosotros y si le han ayudado de mucho en su vida familiar a podido hacerse de todas sus electrodomésticos de su casa y ahora quiere compra este terrero y después hacer otro crédito para empezar a construir.
texts.en:
Dimas G. A. is a teacher in a small primary school. The money he is requesting is to buy a piece of land for a house. He lives on his in-laws' land, and he wants to become independent. He has a life partner and a five year old baby. He has had 11 loans with us, and they have helped his family life a lot. He has been able to get all the domestic appliances for his house. He now wants to buy this land and later get another loan to start building.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Obidon

texts.fr: B. Obidon est née le 10 décembre 1978.  Il y a neuf ans que Obidon vit à PK10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, au Bénin.  Mariée à TOVIHOME Jacob, un plombier, Obidon est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Obidon vit ensemble aven son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Obidon n’a fait que l’école primaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Obidon vend des produits divers (savon, lait, bombons, cubes, enveloppes, etc) à son domicile.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Obidon s’approvisionne.  Obidon exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé.  Obidon sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Obidon B. was born on 10th December 1978. For the past nine years she has been living in PK10 in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. Married to Jacob TOVIHOME, a plumber, Obidon has three children, all of whom are at school and in her care. Obidon lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Obidon has been to primary school only. In order to cover her needs, she sells a variety of products (soap, milk, sweets, stock cubes, envelopes etc.) from home. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Obidon has been carrying out this activity for five years and has already had one loan from ALIDé. She is applying for a second loan in order to strengthen her business and increase her profit.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is 38 years old and a mother of four children, all of whom are students in the local school. She is a villager from Roluos village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Moeun Kean (pictured left), are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. In addition to farming, Mr. Moeun Kean is a duck seller who earns a small income to support his family. Since Mr. Moeun Kean's business is going so well, Mrs. Srey C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more ducks to support her husband's business activities.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to support her husband's business

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn C. is 53 years old and is a villager who lives in Thom IDL village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Phan Phai, are farmers who own a one hectare field for cultivating rice. They do not have enough money to support their crop farming. Thus, Mrs. Yorn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support their farming.

This couple has six children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory and another is a laborer while two others are farmers who support their parents' farming and the other two are students at the local school. Mrs. Yorn C.'s husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Myriam Esnith

texts.es: Myriam Esnith R. V. tiene 43 años,  vive en Bosa-Brasil, un barrio de la capital de Colombia justamente al sur de la misma. Myriam expresa que su comunidad es unida, colaboradora y con gran sentido de pertenencia, y que es allí donde ella ha logrado generar ingresos dedicándose a trabajar en su propio negocio: “la fabricación  de rodillos de diferentes tamaños en felpa y espuma”. Su familia la conforman  sus 3 hijos en edades de 24, 12 y 6 años y su cónyuge, quien también trabaja en esta actividad, y es que el emprender este negocio, se lo debe Myriam a la experiencia que adquirió su esposo cuando se retiró de una empresa, donde aprendió a elaborar los rodillos que hoy venden; fue así como ellos decidieron vivir rodeados de cabos,  tapas, tornillos  felpas y espuma. Con su primer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo obtuvo mayores oportunidades para trabajar, ya que fue capaz de agregar más productos o elementos a su negocio; ahora con sus segundo crédito, por valor de $1.000.000, realizará arreglos de una máquina inyectora de plástico que se les dañó, y en consecuencia su producción se ha visto afectada; con este dinero también comprará materiales, como  cabos,  tapas, tornillos  felpas y espuma, así continuará  trabajando en su propia casa junto con su esposo. Su máximo desafío es convertirse en una empresa consolidada a nivel comercial y laboral en el mercado y agregar otras maquinarias modernas que mejoren su desempeño  productivo.
texts.en:
Myriam Esnith R. V., age 43, lives in Bosa-Brasil. This neighborhood is just to the south of the capital of Colombia. Myriam says that her community is united, and the people work together. There is a great sense of belonging in her community. That is where she has been able to generate income by working in her own business of making different sizes of felt and foam rollers. Her family consists of her three children; ages 24, 12, and 6; and her life partner. He also works in this activity; he started the business. Myriam owes it to the experience her husband got when he retired from a company where he learned to make the rollers they now sell. That is how they decided to live surrounded by handles, covers, screws, felt, and foam. With her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo she got greater work opportunities. She was able to add more products or elements to her business. Now, with this second loan for 1,000,000 COP, she will make repairs to a damaged machine that injects plastic. Because the machine is damaged their production has been affected. With this money she will also buy materials like handles, covers, screws, felt, and foam. That way she will continue working in her own house with her husband. Her biggest challenge is to become a consolidated business at a commercial and labor level in the market. Part of this challenge is to add other modern machines to improve her work effort.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like handles, covers, screws, felt, and foam, and fix the machine that injects plastic

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
Buena O. is from the village of Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 52 years old. Buena is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Buena owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Buena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Buena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Buena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Buena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey R. (pictured above) and her husband Mr. Meun Mak live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three children, one son and two daughters. All of them are in school. 

Srey has been a silk weaver for 30 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who in turn sells in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a construction worker for two years. She is asking for her first loan in the amount of $400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Gosi Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 39 years old. Erlinda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Norma Guadalupe

texts.es: Norma Guadalupe C. D. J. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por  sus cuatro  hijos todos menores D. 13 años D. edad,  los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa. En dicho negocia ella comercializa leche, pan, golosinas y otros productos más. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio, sobre todo con productos los cuales son muy básicos en el hogar. Ana desea mucho poder mejorar las ventas, ya que es ella quien se encarga D. solventar todos los gastos del hogar y D. sus cuatro hijos, esto debido a que Norma es madre soltera y es quien vela por todas las necesidad existentes en la casa, sobre todo desea poder brindarle los estudios necesarios a sus hijos ya que anhela poder brindarles un mejor futuro en el cual puedan salir adelante y defenderse por sí solos.
texts.en:
Norma Guadalupe C. D. J. is 38 years old and lives in the Soyapango municipality, located in the San Salvador department. Her family unit is comprised of her four children, all younger than 13 years of age, who are all in school. She has a store selling perishable products, located in her own home. In this business she sells milk, bread, sweets and other such merchandise. She is requesting a loan that will allow her to supply her business, especially with basic home products. She wants very much to improve her sales since she is the one in charge of paying all the expenses of her home and her four children. She is a single mother and is the one who watches over all the existing necessities of the house. Above all else, she wants to proviD. for the education of her children, giving them a better future in which they can get ahead and stand on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple products.

loans.name: Arlen Ivette

texts.es: La señora Arlen Ivette, es dueña de una tienda de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Es casada, tiene dos niñas las que se encuentran en el preescolar y primaria, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia como transportista brindando el servicio de taxi. La señora necesita de este financiamiento para aumentar su tienda, comprar más ropa y poder atender los encargo de sus clientes, y de esta manera poner generar mejores ganancias y darle mejores condiciones a sus hijas, como también la educación.
texts.en:
Arlen Ivette is the owner of a store that sells clothing for men, women and children. She is married and has two daughters who are in preschool and primary school. Her husband works as an independent driver providing taxi services. Arlen Ivette needs this financing to expand her store, buying more clothing so that she can fill her customers' orders, and thus generate greater profits and provide a better quality of life for her daughters and pay for their education.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gai

texts.en: Gai T. N. is 49 years old. She lives in Luc Canh village, Xuan Canh commune. She has three children who all attend school. Gai T. N. grows rice and also sells mang (bamboo shoots) in the market. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND for her small business.

loans.use: for her small business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
To make a better living, Josefina owns and operates a business where she raises pigs to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns good profits from the income generated by these activities.

In 1997, Josefina joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI and she received a 100% credit rating. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Josefina is requesting a new loan of 44,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and additional piglets so she can earn more revenue. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Josefina from ASHI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. This will allow Josefina to grow her hog raising business further so that her four children can fulfill their dreams of managing their own business someday. Josefina wants to give her family a decent life.

Josefina's long term goal is to continue to build her secondary fishing business. She wants to purchase additional raw materials for her fishing business so she can expand it. This will allow her to sell more fish in the local community and in the surrounding neighborhoods. She also hopes to have successful pig farm someday.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and additional piglets

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto S. is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his family in Chillanes in the Bolivar Province. He has 3 children, ages 9, 8, and 5. 

Roberto is a member of the rural loan group ¨San Jose del Eden.¨ The group is located about an hour and a half from the town of San Jose del Tambo. The group consists of 20 members, the majority of whom work in agriculture.  

Roberto also works in agriculture. He has been growing cacao, corn, coffee and rice for the past 13 years. He also raises pigs. He does the buying and selling of his products in the nearby town of Matilde Esther.

Roberto plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his crops. His goal for the next five years is to have his own house and to keep advancing in his agriculture. 

He enjoys the community festivals of the Patron Saint San Jose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for his crops

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La señora Lilia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal San Eduardo que se reúnen cada  quince días en la calle del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Portoviejo cerca de un hermoso parque llamado “El Mamey “.

Esta casada y tiene tres hijos y tres nietos, dos de hijos viven con ella. Es modista desde muy joven, estudio corte y confección en la Academia Esperanza Sacoto. Donde aprendió a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa aunque lo que mas le gusta es  hacer ropa de  mujer, dice que también hace camisas para hombre pero comenta que es mejor coser ropa de mujer ya que hay mas variedades.

Trabaja todos los días cuando hay bastante trabajo, tiene dos empleadas que trabajan con ella en su taller que está en su casa.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y otros productos que se requieren para la costura.
 
Sus sueños son que nunca le falte trabajo y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Lilia is a founding member of San Eduardo communal bank which meets every two weeks on San Eduardo Street in Portoviejo near a beautiful park called “El Mamey.” She is married and has three children and three grandchildren; two of the children still live with her. She has been a dressmaker since she was a young woman. She studied dressmaking at Esperanza Sacoto Academy where she learned how to make all kinds of clothes although what she likes best is to make women’s clothing. She says that she also makes men’s shirts but she comments that making women’s clothing is better because there is more variety. When there is enough work she works every day. She has two employees that work with her and her workshop is in her home. The loan will be used to buy fabric and other dressmaking supplies. Her dream is that she always has work and good health.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh T. N.  is 36 years old. She has two children who are attending high school. Being an experienced farmer, her main activities are growing rice and vegetables and raising pigs for meat. She has created daily income from selling these agricultural products for many years. Joining with our credit program in 2004, she  has used loans effectively in her business and repaid well. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 5,450,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) to buy fertilizer and food for the pigs.

Hong T. N. is 39 years old. She has three children who are at both high school and secondary school. She is running a small restaurant that serves breakfast to the local residents. She wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in her business.

Dien T. N. is 36 years with two children who are in secondary school. She is building a new house. She needs 4,142,000 VND to buy more construction materials.

Tue T. D. is 44 years old with three children, two of whom are in high school. She is running a shop that sells bicycle parts to repair bicycles. Currently, she needs to have a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop.

Son T. N. is 54 years old with three children. She is a farmer. Currently, she is raising pigs for meat and buffaloes. She wants to have a loan of 5,450,000 VND to invest  in buying food and a part of it to improve the house for them.
 
Hoan T. N. is 26 years old with two children who are still small. She is making protective gloves under the order of some factories. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 2,398,000 VND to buy cloth as a raw material.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Sheridan

texts.en: Sheridan E. is a 38-year-old mother of three children. The eldest, 16, is a college student and the two youngest, 9 and 11, are elementary grade pupils. The family’s main source of income is the salary of her husband, but the cost of living in the city is so expensive that she decided to help her husband with their financial needs. She looked for people to help her financially and she found Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner of Kiva in the Philippines. She was encouraged to join because of the principles and program that the institution offers. She consulted her husband about her plan, he approved, and she became a member in 2004. She used her previous loans to start a small store business. Her husband is grateful because his wife now helps to support the family. Sheridan is happy as well because, as years passed, her customers have increased and she is earning more. Now she is applying for another loan of PHP 23000 to buy more grocery products. She wants to buy more sacks of rice for retail, soft drinks, liquors, canned goods, assorted snack foods and noodles, kitchen ingredients and personal beauty products. She will be delighted if Kiva lenders will assist her financially. She is hoping that the partnership of ASHI and Kiva will continue and prosper.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery products for her store

loans.name: Fatalisho

texts.ru: Сарбаландов Фаталишо проживает в районе А. Джоми. Возраст, 44 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена работает в средней школе учительницей. Сам Фаталишо имеет средне - техническое образование, бухгалтер-технолог. По профессии не работал. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. У него продуктовый магазин. Кроме того Фаталишо занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для перепродажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 18 лет. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en: Fatalisho S. lives in the A. Jomi district.  He is 44 years old, married and has 6 children.  His wife works as a teacher at a secondary school.  Fatalisho has a secondary-technical education, as an accountant-technologist.  He never worked in that field.  He is currently involved in retail sales and has a food store.  Besides this, Fatalisho is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds livestock for future resale.  He has been involved in this business for 18 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: David Enguza

texts.en:
David J. aged 32 years is married to Lydia Kwamboka and together they have one child named Jane.He lives in Kangemi estate and his business is in the Nairobi Masai Market which is in the town centre. He sells  curios made of stone and also practises farming as his secondary business.

David who was introduced to KADET LTD by another Kadet client has been running this business for five years and he makes a monthly profit of Kshs. 6,000. Masai market is a very busy market so David  has been selling his curios both to locals and to tourists who have great interest in the market. With the loan he plans to buy more  curios for sale and with the extra income generated, he will expand his business. David is hard-working.

David's plan for the future is to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more curios and stone carvings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood and nails

loans.name: Nuo

texts.en: The two people shown in the photo are Mrs. Nuo S. T., 28, and her husband, age 31. They currently live in Kompong Cham province. Mrs. Nuo S. earns a living by planting rice with her husband. They spend most of their time with the farming business. In addition, Mrs. Nuo S. T. also raises a few pigs behind her house. They have three children, who are all single. At present, Mrs. Nuo S. faces difficulT. with transportation and always has to hire a taxi when she needs a ride. To reduce the cost of transportation, she would like a loan to buy a new motorbike for her family's needs. She will use the remaining funds to purchase more pigs to feed for sale.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her family's needs and to purchase more pigs

loans.name: Wilmer Donaldo

texts.es:
Wilber de 31 años de edad, habitante de Col. Rio Plata labora como asesor pedagogico del Ministerio de Educaciòn desde hace 11 años desempeñandoce como una persona trabajadora y muy responsabl.

solicita su septimo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de sus vivienda la que vendrá a darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. En su colonia dan buenas referencias personales de él, también en el trabajo como una persona responsable en sus compromisos y de muy buenas costumbre.  

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y que no les haga falta  lo basico en el hogar, solicitamos al comité de crédito la aprobación de su préstamo
texts.en:
Wilber is 31 years old, a resident of Col. Rio Plata, and has worked as a pedagogical advisor for the Education Ministry for eleven years acting as a hard-working and responsible person.

He is requesting his seventh loan in order to invest it in the improvement of his house which he will sell in order to give better living conditions to his family. In his area, they give him good personal references. Also, at work, he's considered a person who is trustworthy and has good manners.

His greatest dream in life is that his family remains united and that they don't lack for the basics in the home. We are requesting that the loan committee approves his loan.

loans.use: Home repair.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. This young man works in a local mini market. His work is very important because with this income he is able to satisfy his needs and help his parents pay for his university fees. As with the majority of Lebanese students, he is faced with the day-to-day challenges of working while at the same time pursuing an education. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his courses at the university. He is studying biochemistry and this is his second year. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a laboratory to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: To pay for his courses at the university

loans.name: Maranatha 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yaque is one of the members of the Maranatha 1 & 2 Group where almost all of the members are Haitians. They are located in La Romana, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Yaque is a single mother of 5 and she makes her home here in a simple structure in a rural community surrounded by sugar cane field, This village is part of Bateyes noted for it's sugar cane industry, in the tourism city of Romana.

Yaque is excited about seeking her first loan with Esperanza. It will enable her to expand her business, started 2 years ago with own savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of Second hand cloths, by purchasing bags of used cloths in good conditions. Also, she will buy curtains, bedlinen and other decoration products. Her profits will be use to supply their family's need.

loans.use: to buy second hand cloths

loans.name: Ma. Belinda

texts.en:
Ma. Belinda is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store and a livestock and sugarcane farm. Her husband, Jose Danilo V., is 47 years old. He works as a welder and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have two children who are 7 and 9 years old. 

Ma. Belinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Belinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 3,000 PHP, improving the family's standard of living.
