This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as capital for business operations. Her goal is to continue to save up for children's education in the future. Ma. Belinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For business operations

loans.name: Zaida

texts.en:
Zaida is 38 years old.  She sells bags in the Nyabugogo district of Kigali, Rwanda's capital city.  She runs a well-organized store, which she has had for 5 years.  Currently she employs one other person to help her in the business.

Zaida plans to use this loan to expand her business by purchasing more bags to sell.  In the future, if she makes a profit, Zaida dreams of opening a similar business in another part of Kigali.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
Juana de 53 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy dedicada a lo que le gusta ya que comenzó a realizar pinturas ya que había tomado un curso de arte. 

Decidió tener su propio negocio de pinturas para obtener dinero de lo que le gustaba hacer. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta 17h00pm. Vende los cuadros a $ 25.00, centros de mesa a $ 12.00 y floreros a $ 20.00. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que hace lo que le gusta y gana dinero. 

Por eso quiere continuar con su negocio para seguir trabajando y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Con el préstamo quiere comprar pinceles y herramientas para sus cuadros y artes manuales. Una de sus metas es tener una galería con sus cuadros.
texts.en:
Juana, 53, is a hard working woman who is very dedicated to what she enjoys.  She started making paintings after having taken an art course.

She decided to turn the paintings into a business to earn her own money doing what she liked to do.  She currently works from 8am until 5pm.  She sells the paintings for $25.00, table centerpieces for $12.00 and flower vases for $20.00.  She has many hopes for the business because she does what she enjoys doing and makes money at it.

Because of this she wants to stay in business to continue working and help her husband with household expenses.  She will use the loan to buy paint brushes and tools for her paintings and manual arts.  One of her goals it to have a gallery for her paintings.

loans.use: Paint brushes and tools.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. María Elena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martín. Está casada, tiene 46 años y es madre D. 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios (hasta el 2do año).

La necesidad D. hacer algo para sacar a su familia adelante, buscando siempre estar cerca D. ella, llevo a María Elena, con la ayuda D. su hermana, a abrir un pequeño puesto D. venta D. salchipapas (comida al paso) en la puerta D. su casa. Con el paso del tiempo y con la gran habilidad D. María Elena para los negocios y el comercio, cambió el puesto D. salchipapas por una pequeña bodega; negocio que empezó a crecer hasta parecerse a lo que es ahora, una bodega surtida en la que sus clientes pueden encontrar desD. la leche y el pan para su desayuno, hasta el gas para sus cocinas; siendo su principal clientela, sus vecinos y  transeúntes que normalmente pasan por allí.
  
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará: Leche, huevos, pan, café, azúcar entre otros insumos comestibles así como también artículos D. oficina como papel, cartulinas, lápices, lapiceros y cuadernos para aprovechar al máximo el inicio D. la campaña escolar.

María dijo también que se siente muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que brinda a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. María Elena is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) which is in the District of Tarapoto, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old and the mother of two children. María Elena completed her education through the second year of high school.

She always looked for ways to be near her family yet still do something to help them get ahead. With the help of her sister, María Elena opened a sales stand on the doorstep of her house where she served sausages and fried potatoes (which is considered a fast food dish). After some time passed, she used her business abilities to convert her food stand into a small general store. Her business started to grow to the size it is today. Her customers can find everything from milk and bread for breakfast to gas for cooking in this well-stocked store. Travelers who normally pass through the area and neighbors make up her usual clientele.

With this loan of 1500 PEN, María Elena will buy milk, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar and other food products. In addition, she will purchase office supplies such as paper, cardboard, pencils, pens, and notebooks to take advantage of the start of the school year.

María says she is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the assistance provided to women like her so that they can have opportunities to move forward.

loans.use: To purchase milk, eggs, bread, coffee, sugar, and office supplies.

loans.name: Sorphuon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorphuon M. (in the photo) is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Samit M. is 47 years old. They live along National Road No. 1 approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have six children--three sons and three daughters. 
 
Sorphuon and her husband are rice farmers. When free from farming, Sorphuon has sold porridge and noodles or "Kuyteav" in her village for almost ten years; her husband does construction work as well. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to repair her porridge and noodle shop.

"Kuyteav" is Khmer sounds meaning "the noodle with soup".

loans.use: To repair her porridge and noodle shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his children's lodging while they attend school away from home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Marlon Gonzalo

texts.es:
Don Marlon, es agricultor, el siembra café, tiene 30 años de edad, es originario de la comarca el Consuelo localizada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es padre de familia, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. El hace 10 años viajo a Costa Rica fue a trabajar y ahorro gracias a eso pudo comprar 3 manzanas de tierra y un terreno donde construyo su casa. Así fue cultivando café poco a poco con ayuda de su señora quien lo ha apoyado desde el principio, cuando se pone un poco baja la temporada de siembra el se dedica hacer trabajos jornales en fincas aledañas. 
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de abono, insumos, pago de mano de obra, insecticida, fertilizantes para la siembra de café. El espera sacar una buena producción de café con buenos rendimientos que le permita vender el quintal de café a un buen precio, así mismo pagar los gastos de producción. Desea seguir sembrando más café, tiene como meta próxima sembrar 1 manzana más de café orgánico.
texts.en:
30 year-old Marlon is a coffee farmer.  He is from El Consuelo, in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí.  Marlon has two children aged 8 and 3.  Ten years ago, he travelled to Costa Rica to work and save some money.  As a result, he was able to buy three 'manzanas' of farmland (one 'manzana' = 1.68 acres), and a plot of land where he built his house.  He grows his coffee with the help of his wife who has supported him from the beginning.  When work is slower during the sowing season, he works as a day laborer on neighboring farms. 

Marlon requested this loan to buy manure, supplies, insecticides and fertilizers for his coffee crops, and to pay laborers.  He hopes to achieve a good crop of coffee, with good yields which will allow him to sell a quintal of coffee for a good price and cover his production expenses.  He would like to continue sowing more coffee.  His goal is to sow one additional manzana (1.68 acres) with organic coffee.

loans.use: to buy manure, supplies, insecticides and fertilizers for his coffee crop, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Katherin Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es una madre joven de 21 años de edad, tiene un hijo con el que vive en casa de sus abuelos ubicada en el distrito de San José en Pacasmayo – La Libertad.

Gabriela se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (arroz, huevo, aceite, azúcar, fideos, etc.), golosinas y bebidas en una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Su bodega cuenta con una gran demanda para la satisfacción de Gabriela.

Gabriela solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para invertir en el surtimiento de su negocio. Ella desea comprar nuevos productos y de marcas variadas para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.

Gabriela desea obtener mayores ganancias para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su pequeño hijo. Ella es muy conocida en su zona y es una persona de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young mother of 21 years of age. She has one son and she lives with him in his grandparents house in the district of San José in Pacasmayo-La Libertad.
Gabriela works selling groceries (rice, eggs, oil, sugar, noodles, etc), candies, and drinks, in a store that she runs in her home. To her satisfaction, there is a lot of demand for her store. 
Gabriela has requested a loan of $450 from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can supply her store. She wants to buy new products and more brands so she can keep her customers satisfied.
Gabriela wants to increase her income so that she can have a better quality of life for her and her little son. She is well know in her neighborhood and has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to supply her store.

loans.name: Na We Cam-Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Na We Cam II” group. They are smallbusiness women based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to expand their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Emma. Emma is 40 years old.  She was born in a town called Port Loko but is currently residing in Makeni city with her husband and 5 children. Her husband is an architect and her children are no longer attending school. For 5 years now, Emma has been selling palm oil and fish. With this loan, she will improve her business by buying palm oil and fish in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and fish

loans.name: Vuffie

texts.en:
Vuffie is 35 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Vuffie is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in Surallah, South Cotabato. They grow rice crops to sell. Vuffie also manages a sari-sari store where she sells items like noodles and canned goods.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and to pay allowance for schooling. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and allowance for schooling.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old. She is married with four children. She operates St. Luke Academy so as to earn a living. The school has been operating for one and a half years. She has managed to grow the school because of the support from Faulu Kenya.  

Esther hopes to grow the school and add more classes in the future. She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy the school compound.

loans.use: to buy the school compound.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. For the past 3 years he has had a junk shop where he buys & sells recycled plastics & bottles. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more recycled plastics & bottles.

Brian is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more recycled plastics & bottles.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling school supplies business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more school supplies to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for three years. Rosita earns more income from a carinderia (local eatery).

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel trabaja como chofer propietario de un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros y es socio del sindicato de choferes Eduardo Avaroa. El crédito lo requiere para la reparación de su vehiculo; específicamente del motor que a veces tiene un ruido muy raro y hace que el vehiculo se plante. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Villa San Juan en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no  tiene  hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel Ángel works as an independent driver and has a vehicle for transporting passengers. He is a member of the Eduardo Avaroa taxi drivers union. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the engine of his vehicle, which has been making a strange noise and has been causing his vehicle to stall. Miguel lives at the home of his parents in the District of Villa San Juan in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to pay for engine repairs and general vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Nizom

texts.ru: Низом тридцати двухлетний мужчина, проживающий в районе Дангары. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его дети учатся в средней школе. Низом имеет среднее образование. Он занимается торговлей панелей телефонов, батареек для пульта, заколок и бижутерии. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки косметики и аксессуаров.
texts.en: Nizom is a thirty-two-year-old man living in the Dangara district.  He is married and has three children.  His children attend a secondary school.  Nizom has a secondary education.  He is involved in sales of telephone panels, remote control batteries, hair accessories and jewelry.  He has been in this business for ten years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cosmetics and accessories.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past four years, Phiona has been working hard to manage her small shop, which rents videos to customers. 

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy another computer to help her do other work, like secretarial services, and video movies. And it will help Phiona to keep track of rentals and to excel in her studies. Phiona hopes that in the future she will be able to set up another video rental store in town. 

Phiona is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Phiona who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy another computer for keeping track of video rentals

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro tiene 11 años en su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Mercedes es una persona emprendedora las ganas de salir adelante y proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios han hecho que ella siga luchando por los objetivos que se propone. El financiamiento es para la compra de variedad de productos como sabanas, bolsos, calzado, manteles, cosméticos, ropa en general entre otros.
texts.en: Mercedes del Socorro has been in business for 11 years selling general merchandise. Mercedes is an enterprising person who wants to get ahead and to provide her family with the necessary income they need which is why she works hard towards the goals she sets. The funding is for the purchase a variety of products like sheets, bags, footwear, tablecloths, cosmetics, clothing in general, and other things.

loans.use: to buy sheets, bags, footwear, tableclothes, cosmetics, clothing in general, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonilla is married to a tricycle driver. They live in the village of Villa Marzo Cordon. The couple have been blessed with six children. 

For the past five years, Leonilla has operated a transportation business, particularly motorcycle transport. Every day her husband wakes up early to transport the passengers going to and from the market. 

Leonilla faces a major challenge, which is renewing her franchise of motorcycle transport. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for additional capital from the lenders amounting to P30,000. This will help her business grow because her operation will not stop just because she doesn't renew her franchise. 

She also feels that she could make her motorcycle more comfortable to the passengers so that they could always rent it when they travel to nearby areas of the community where they live.

loans.use: to be used in renewing the franchise of motorcycle transport.

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr:
Oumarou est un homme âgé de 28 ans. Il est marié à une commerçante. Il a 03 enfants, dont 02 à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier 02 ans.  
Oumarou gère un commerce d’alimentation et des cartes de recharge depuis 1996. Il  vend (des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile…) à toutes personnes dans sa boutique. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est liée au stockage des marchandises.
Oumarou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des cartes de recharge téléphonique. Il veut réinvestir ses profits supplémentaires dans son commerce de cartes de recharge. 
Dans les prochaines années, Oumarou voudrait rendre son activité pérenne. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit de s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Oumarou is a 28-year-old man who is married to a merchant.  He has three children, two of whom attend school.  His eldest is 10 years old and his youngest is 2.  Oumarou has been running a business selling food products and top-up cards since 1996.  He sells bags of rice, cans of oil, etc. to the general public in his store.  His main problem right now is keeping his store stocked with merchandise.

Oumarou has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy general food products and top-up cards for phones.  He would like to re-invest his extra profits in his business selling top-up cards.

Over the coming years, Oumarou would like to work to ensure his business is viable in the long term.  He says that he plans to use the profits he makes to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy general food products

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 53 years old and a widow with three children, aged 30, 26 and 20 years. She owns a retail shop and has been a green grocer for the past eight years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.


This is her fourth loan term with KADET. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase sugar, wheat flour, kerosene, sodas, tomatoes and vegetables.


She will use the anticipated profits to educate her grandchildren. Her dream is to open another shop for her son to manage.

loans.use: to buy sugar, wheat flour, kerosene, sodas, tomatoes and assorted vegetables

loans.name: Ana Delis

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de frutas y hortalizas, vive con cuatro hijos y su esposo, dos de sus hijos están casados; Ana se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y hortalizas, tiene 20 años en el negocio, por el momento sus hijos que aun dependen de ella le ayudan  a atender el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de uvas, fresas, manzanas, lechugas, rábanos, pepinos, chiles entre otros que son frutos frescos para ofrecer a los clientes,  esta inversión le ayudara para adquirir estos productos y poder fortalecer el negocio.
Su aspiración es que sus hijos menores, puedan continuar estudiando, que se superen y en su momento que formen sus propios hogares, por el lado del negocio quiere continuar creciendo y mejorando la atención a la clientela.
texts.en:
Ana sells fruit and vegetables.  She lives with four children and her husband.  Two of her children are married.  Ana is a fruit and vegetable merchant; she’s been in business 20 years.  For the moment, the children who still depend on her help her tend to the business.

She is asking for a loan to buy grapes, strawberries, apples, lettuce, radishes, cucumbers and peppers, among others which are fresh fruit to offer her customers.  This investment will help her acquire these products to strengthen the business.

Her hope is that her younger children will be able to stay in school so that they will improve themselves and in time form their own homes.  With respect to the business, she wants to continue to grow and to improve customer service.

loans.use: to buy grapes, strawberries, apples, lettuce, radishes and cucumbers.

loans.name: Rémède Plus Group

texts.en:
Riddy is the leader of the Community Bank named “Remède Plus”. It is consists of 17 micro-entrepreneurs jointly united for the same goal- to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Riddy has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2006. He runs a drugstore in the eastern and most populated area of Kinshasa. He has already received two loans from microfinance institution HOPE DRC and successfully repaid them. With the next loan, he is planning to increase the inventory of his business by buying more antibiotics and medicines needed by his customers. His business brings in 50 USD of profit each week. His ambition is to open another drugstore. His strength is purchasing the appropriate drugs for his customers. Riddy is 30 years old, married and the father of two children; ages 1 and 3.

loans.use: to purchase more antibiotics and medicines needed by his customers

loans.name: Katty Vilma

texts.es:
Katty Vilma tiene 18 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Katty se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos hace 8 años y a la siembra de maíz, cacao, cría de ganado y gallinas.

Las compras y las Ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para la agricultura siembra y compra productos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir aumentando la agricultura.

El sueño es tener una buena producción. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas , En el tiempo libre le gusta estudiar.

CON LA AYUDA DEL CREDITO ANTERIOR ha podido sembrar maíz y ha podido mejorar el estado económico porque le ha servido de mucho y ha salido adelante.
texts.en:
Katty Vilma is 18 years old, single, and has no children. She lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The San Jose Communal Bank is located in neighborhood of El Rosario, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Katty has spent the last eight years devoted to the household chores. She also grows corn and cacao and raises cattle and chickens as well. Katty buys her supplies and sells her products in Ventanas. The loan she is requesting will be used for planting crops and purchasing farming supplies. With the help of this loan, she can continue increasing her agricultural output.

Her dream is to have good production. She does not face any problems at the moment. In her free time, Katty enjoys studying. With the help of her previous loan, she was able to grow corn and improve her financial state. The loan served a great purpose and enabled her to move forward.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for the planting season.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is 25 years old and still single. He is engaged in buying and selling different food supplements in his community. His ambition in life is to build his own house and become financially stable before he settles down. In this regard, he aims to improve his business buy selling different kinds of food supplements to satisfy his customers' needs. 

Due to inadequate capital, he is asking for an loan of P50,000 to buy additional stocks of food supplements like vita plus, Vitamin B complex and other vitamins for sale. He believes that he can make an improvement in his business for he has no competitors in the area. He hopes that someday, he can expand his business as he continue to work and manage his business well.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of supplements for his business.

loans.name: Antik

texts.en: Antik lives in Yerevan with her husband, son and daughter. She trades in fruit and vegetables. Antik has applied for this loan to expand her business. Antik plans to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. This will increase sales and get additional income. This is vital for Antik's family, as she will be able to renovate her house and improve her household's conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and four children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari or variety store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Analyn joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with eight children, three of whom attend school while five have graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business selling groceries at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of market price fluctuations. Mwaka dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demand. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Hiba

texts.en: Hiba is a 24 year old married woman from Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy a new sofa set and curtains to make her home a better living space. Since Hiba is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan. She prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her huband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar appreciates the previous loan that helped her expand her business.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 34-year-old divorced woman. She was happy with her children and her husband, a tractor driver. After 8 years of marriage, she got separated her husband due to some personnel reason. At that time, she had a son aged seven years and a daughter aged five years. She has been struggling since then to support her family. She started a snack and tea stall at her house, which is located quite close to the market. She cooks and sells local snacks and tea in the mornings and evenings, the general hours for such a business. She sells pan at a small scale during the rest of the day to fill her day and support her income. She hopes for a bright future for her children. With the three years of experience in running the shop, she wants to expand her business to meet customer demand. 

She needs a loan of 35,000 INR to buy some utensils and stock up on raw materials like besan and oil for cooking her snacks, as well as buy new products like packaged snacks and wafers to stock in her betel shop. She also plans to buy some furniture to seat her customers as she sees an increase in her customer base. She says that the increased cash flow can change her life and provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for benches to seat her customers and to buy utensils and raw materials like besan and oil in bulk for her snack stall

loans.name: Rebby

texts.en:
Rebby is a smallholder farmer from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She is into dairy, poultry and horticultural farming. Recently, she started a cereal merchandise business to improve her income. To make a significant amount of money, Rebby is required to buy and sell produce in huge volumes. This is where she needs your help.

Rebby is seeking a loan that she will use to aggregate farm produce from local farmers and sell at markets that offer higher prices. Twenty-seven years strong in farming, Rebby is well aware of the market factors and conditions. She plans to make good use of her experience and character to make the business successful.
Income generated from this trade will help her to repay the loan, grow her farm and provide better lives for her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena sells sodas and other products from her small store. Because her parents ran similar stores, Lorena learned the ins and outs of the business from a young age. She saved $100 in order to start up her operation about 2 years ago. She sells these products from her home to the local community and she is also a distributor for some nearby stores. She is seeking this loan in order to increase her inventory. She wants to begin selling dairy products and eggs from her store as well.

Lorena is 32 years old, she is married and she has 2 school aged children. She is very proud to have a business of her own that allows her to provide an education and food for her children. She hopes that she can continue to improve her store and use the profits for the well being of her family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase her inventory by buying wholesale

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en: Tasi was born 17th June 1967 and is married with four children. She lives with her family in the village of  Solaua. Tasi operates a flea market business, selling handicrafts, such as kava bowls, samoan bags, elei printing and other goods. She uses her income to buy necessities for the family and provide for the two children still in school. She is requesting a loan to buy fabric for making more goods to sell in her stall.

loans.use: 10 rolls of fabric materials

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.en:
Anselmo is married and has three children, ages 2, 5, and 9. He used to have a grocery store, but three years ago, when his last child was born, his wife had complications with the birth and was in the hospital for a while, and the medical bills absorbed all the savings they had, along with any capital to reinvest in the store. At that time he decided to close the store and start selling bedding. He started out offering his products to friends and relatives. Finding good results, he started selling from house to house, taking orders. Fortunately he has seen his business, and his orders, grow.

In order to increase his sales, Anselmo knows that people want to know the quality of a product before they order. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $750 to buy merchandise that he can show to customers. He will pay it back over a period of 6 to 12 months. Your help will contribute to the growth of this business. Anselmo and his family need your support, without a doubt.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Anselmo es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 2, 5 y 9 años de edad. Anteriormente él tenía una tienda de abarrotes, pero hace dos años, al nacer su último hijo, su esposa tuvo complicaciones en el parto y estuvo internada un tiempo, los gastos médicos absorbieron todos los ahorros que tenia y el capital que reinvertiría en su tienda, así que optó por cerrar e iniciar con la venta de blancos, empezó ofreciendo estos productos a amigos y familiares, al obtener buenos resultados, inició con la venta por catálogo casa por casa. Afortunadamente ha visto creer su negocio y sus pedidos.

Para incrementar sus ventas, Anselmo sabe que a las personas les gusta conocer la calidad de los productos y solicita un préstamo por $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder mostrarla a sus clientes, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Anselmo y su familia necesitan de tu apoyo, no lo dudes más.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin S. lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Elvin is 24 years old and single. Elvin has raised cattle for 5 years. He started out with one cow and then began to breed calves. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy fodder and  baling presses, and keep his cattle well fed. Elvin eventually hopes to increase the number of his cattle  to improve his business and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy feed and baling presses for his cattle

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en:
Faleupolu S.’s business is a taro plantation and a fruit farm. Faleupolu is now fifty-five and used to be very bad at counting money. This problem delayed her intention of wanting to start a small business. She has six children who were all raised and supported on her husband’s income of $16 a day from his work. Apart from his work, he also does fishing for extra earning for his children’s school fees. Two of their children have now graduated and are employed in Government Departments.

When Faleupolu actually joined our program, we took extra time to really teach her how to run a business and handle cash. She is now handling her business alone without any help, and is aiming for future improvement in their family business.

loans.use: Buy materials for home improvement and fertilizers for her vegetables

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda H. owns a shop from which she sells cleaning supplies and perfumes. She started her business in 2001, when she and her husband rented a stall and began selling perfume. Umeda soon noticed that that there was a strong demand for cleaning supplies, and decided to add them to her line of goods. This turned out to be a good decision, because today she sells a wide range of cleaning supplies to a large number of regular customers. Because sales are strong, Umeda is able to use her loans to expand her business and increase her income. She has come to us for a loan of $875 to buy additional goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara (her sister is pictured) is a mother of one child. She is 49 years old and lives in Khachmaz town. She has run this business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of  $850 to buy clothes for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.en: E. Abduaziz has been engaged in the trade of flour for over 10 years.  His business place is located in district Rudaki, Dushanbe, Tajikistan, in the food market "Ganjina."  He is married and has 3 children.All of them go to school and he is the one who earns money for family needs.  He attracts many clients with the high quality of his product.  He sells high, first and second varieties of flour.  He buys his goods in sacks by the ton.  Currently he has fast turnover and he needs extra capital to increase his profit.

loans.use: Buying the next batch of flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in merchandise

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Mrs. Pol C., 44, is married with five children and stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her entire family. Her husband works as blacksmith and makes around $25 of revenue. Three of their children assist with their father’s work and two others are students.

To increase the growth of the blacksmith business, the family must purchase additional blacksmith tools. This loan will help them to increase the income of their family and which will help finance their younger children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase additional blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Hilda's Ujamaa Group

texts.en:
Hilda is 40 years old and is a single woman. Hilda is a shopkeeper, and she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

In the past, Hilda has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwamvua, who has a business dealing in fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Isturah

texts.id:
Mrs. Isturah makes and sells krupuk (a popular snack made of fried flower pronounced 'crew-pook'). Every day she goes to the market at 6AM to purchase ingredients. These include flour, peanuts and chicken intestines (for making broth). She must purchase at least 8kg of goods at a cost of 7,000Rp/Kg. When she returns home, her husband Mohammad Najib helps her to fry and package the krupuk. Afterwards, she travels to various small shops and restaurants along Kartini Denpasar Street to sell them. The money she makes is used to pay for her children's schooling and to help meet the day-to-day needs of her family. Mrs. Isturah really hopes she can get help with her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Courtenay Teska Race, Kiva Volunteer.

Profesi yang dijalani Ibu Isturah sekarang ini adalah sebagai penjual krupuk. Setiap hari, Isturah sudah harus ke pasar pukul 06.00 pagi untuk membeli bahan-bahan untuk membuat krupuk berupa tepung, kacang dan usus ayam. Biasanya dia membeli sebanyak 8 kg dengan per kg Rp.7.000.- Setelah itu, dibantu oleh suaminya Mohammad Najib, Isturah menggoreng krupuk tersebut dan setelah jadi kemudian dibungkus lalu diedarkan warung-warung dan kantin-kantin yang ada disekitar tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Kartini Denpasar. Keuntungan yang didapat dari berjualan krupuk dipaki sebagai biaya menyekolahkan anaknya dan juga mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga. Isturah sangat berharap mendapatkan bantuan sebagai tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: to increase funding for her business

loans.name: Thi Nang

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Năng is 26 years old. She's requesting 2.006.000 VND to buy chicks & piglets to raise. She has 2 school aged children. She also works as a construction worker to make more money. Her family income is 100.000 VND a day.

- Mrs Đinh Thị Miền needs capital to open a grocery store.
- Mrs Trần Thị Vân needs a loan to buy basic goods to resell at the market.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Thanh Lâm sells flowers and fruits. - Mrs Kiều Thị Hằng sells wooden furniture.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Năng (MS: 030017), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.006.000 VND về nuôi lợn, gà. Chị có hai con đang đi học. Ngoài chăn nuôi anh chị còn đi làm thợ xây để có thêm thu nhậpcho gia đình. Mức thu nhập của gia đình anh chị là 100.000 VND/ ngày. Chị Đinh Thị Miền (MS: 030018), vay 2.006.000 VND để lấy vốn bán hàng tạp hóa. Chị Trần Thị Vân (MS: 030019), vay 2.006.000 VND để đi chợ mua bán phế liệu. Chị Nguyễn Thị Thanh Lâm (MS: 030013), vay 2.006.000 VND về đi chợ mua bán hoa quả. Chị Kiều Thị Hằng (MS: 030020), vay 2.006.000 VND mua hàng gỗ bán.

loans.use: raise pigs and poultry

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter O. is 30-years-old and single. He lives in Benin City where he sells building materials. He worked in this business for two years before opening his own store in 2003. Peter has been a LAPO client for the past for 4 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase more building materials for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials for resale

loans.name: Amor Y Caridad Group

texts.es:
Hello.  We belong to the Amor y Caridad Group.  Our ages are 58, 42, 46 and 54 and we all reside at the base of Juan A. Lainez Hill in the capital city of Tegucigalpa.  We have known each other for more than 20 years. 
We all work making and selling tortillas.  It’s worth mentioning that the tortilla is a staple food in our city because it always accompanies breakfast, lunch and dinner respectively.  The majority of our population eats tortillas with all three meals.  We sell our product to our neighbors and to nearby eating establishments in our neighborhood.  Around here there are many places to eat because our national soccer stadium is located very close to us.
With our jobs we have helped our families get ahead.  But we need financial assistance in order to increase our production and make more sales and with the earnings be able to feed our families.  Thank you.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.



hola nosotras pertenecemos al grupo Amor y Caridad, nuestras edades son 58, 42, 46 y 54 años, todas residimos en las faldas del Cerro Juan A. Lainez en la ciudad Capital Tegucigalpa, tenemos mas de 20 años de conocernos, todas nos dedicamos a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, cabe mencionar que las tortillas es un alimento primario en nuestra ciudad ya que este se acompaña con el desayuno, almuerzo y cena respectivamente, la mayoria de nuestra poblacion come tortillas en los tres tiempos de comida.

nuestro producto lo vendemos a nuestros vecinos y a comedores cercanos de nuestra colonia, ya que por estos lugares hay bastantes comedores ya que el estadio nacional de futbol queda muy cerca de nosotras.

con nuestros trabajos hemos logrado sacar adelante a nuestras familias, pero necesitamos ayuda crediticia para poder aumentar nuestras producciones y tener una mayor venta, y con las ganancias poder alimentar nuestras familias. gracias

loans.use: Purchase corn, corn meal, firewood, lime, salt and water.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang M., 58, is a rice farmer who lives with one of her four children. Living in Kampong Cham province, she is able to make $1 per day and is aided by her children, who work as garment factory workers. 

Her husband, Phon Phan, 57, has had a business collecting recyclable items since 2007. She told a loan officer that her husband earns little because in her village there are many people who have the same business as her husband. On average, her husband makes $3 of profit per day. 

Mrs. Seang is asking for a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport the recyclable items.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport recyclable items.

loans.name: Teofila Eusebia

texts.en: Teofila Eusebia V. D. H. lives in Ayacucho with her five children. To the delight of her friends and neighbors she not only runs a grocery store where she sells the essentials, she also makes bread and washes clothes. Her loan will be invested in her business by purchasing laundry detergent, paying the water bill, and buying ingredients for her bread. With the income she receives from her businesses she hopes to ensure that her kids are educated.

loans.use: To purchase laundry detergent, pay the water bill, and buy ingredients for her bread.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: El Señor Lucas está solicitando  su crédito para invertirlo en  mejora de su vivienda como es repellar el dormitorio que él habita y así tener un poco de comodidad , trabaja como Auxiliar de Enfermeria, tiene dos hijos: el mayor de 8 años estudia su segundo grado de educación primaria y el niño menor de 4 añitos, su esposa tambien trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeria ambos comparten los gastos familiares. Es importante  mencionar que este joven desde muy pequeño ha apoyado a su mamá,  inició a laborar desde temprana edad ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, él se siente feliz  con su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchas personas de la comarca Jacinto Baca en Nueva Guinea. Es estudiante de Lic. en Enfermeria, vale la pena recalcar que este joven se caracteriza por su sencillez y humildad, pero posee un alto espiritud de superación personal, y aspira llegar a ser un excelente profesional para asi seguir ayudando a su familia y toda la comunidad, su sueño es poco a poco ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Lucas is requesting a loan to invest in making improvements to his home, such as plastering the walls of his bedroom and thus making it a little more comfortable. He works as a nursing assistant and has two children: the oldest is 8 years old and is in second grade, and the youngest is 4. His wife also works as a nursing assistant and together they share household expenses. It's important to mention that since Lucas was very young he has supported his mother. He started working at a young age since his family has limited economic resources, and carried out his work with a lot of responsibility. He feels happy with his job because he helps many people in the Jacinto Baca region. He's studying for a nursing degree, and it's worth emphasizing that this young man is characterized by his modesty and humility, but he posses a strong desire for personal improvement. He aspires to become an excellent professional so he can continue helping his family and the entire community. His goal is to little by little improve his quality of life and that his family lacks nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the walls of his home

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es: Fabiana tiene 32 años, es madre soltera con cuatro hijos, vive tan solo con tres de ellos porque la mayor se fue a trabajar a la ciudad de Lima. Cuando era muy niña ella ayudaba a trabajar la chacra a sus padres, pero al crecer y tener 2 hijos notó que no le era suficiente, decidió emprender negocio en la crianza de cuyes de raza, gracias a un programa gubernamental le regalaron 2 cuyes; y ella logró aumentar los ejemplares. Ahora se dedica a comercializar cada cuy a S/.12 en Tarma (sierra) y aumenta en el mercado de la selva. Ella los proporciona a cada puesto y a la siguiente semana los cobra, le agrada criar cuyes, ya que le es muy rentable, con ello puede educar a sus hijos del nivel primario. Este es su cuarto préstamo en MFP, ha pagado puntualmente sus cuotas anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita va comprar alimentos para sus cuyes, la otra parte la derivará a la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de papa
texts.en:
Fabiana is a 32-year-old single mother with 4 children. She lives with only three of them because the eldest went to work in Lima. When she was very young, she used to work on her parents’ farm, but as she grew up and had 2 children, she realized it was not enough. She then decided to start a guinea pig business thanks to a government program that gave her 2 guinea pigs. She has managed to increase her herd of guinea pigs. She now sells each one for 12 PEN in Tarma (sierra), and the price increases in the markets of the jungle. She distributes them in each stand, and collects payments the following week. She likes to raise guinea pigs because it is lucrative. With the profits, she can give her children an elementary education. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has paid all her previous loans punctually. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase food for her guinea pigs and fertilizer for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pig food and fertilizer for potato crops

loans.name: Janorys Paola

texts.es: La Sr. Janorys tiene 20 años de edad, habita en el barrio Enrique Smith,  en la capital de Managua, soltera, sus planes es seguir con sus estudios en la universidad y aspirar a mejores opciones de trabajos y proyectos para aplicar dentro de su propio negocio  venta de cereales,  tiene  ocho años en las  ventas. Lo inicio con fondos propio, su madre  la apoyo para que tuviera su propio tramo ya que ella tiene un tramo también  su. Sus metas para el futuro es ampliar su negocio con nuevos productos y la captación de nuevos clientes para aumentar sus utilidades. Con la solicitud del préstamo va a Comprar  verduras, frutas, y granos básicos para tener siempre surtido y ofertar a sus clientes. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra que negocio comercialice a un amplio mercado en lo general.
texts.en:
Señora Janorys is 20 years old and lives in the neighborhood called Enrique Smith, in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is single. Her goal is to continue studying in a university and she aspires to better job options and projects to apply within her own cereal sales business, which she has had for eight years. She began her business with her own funds while her mother supported her so she could have her own sales, and her mother has her own sales now too. Her goal for the future is to expand her business with new products and attract new clients to increase her profits. With the loan she is requesting, she is going to buy vegetables, fruit, and basic grains so she can always have an assortment to offer her clients. Thanks to loans from Afodenic, a partner of Kiva, she will achieve the commercial business to broaden her general market.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar frutas y verduras para surtir su tramo

loans.name: Holberdi

texts.ru: Нодиров Холберды житель города Вахдат. Возраст 45 лет , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Имеет высшее образование. Работает бухгалтером , а так же имеет частную миниферму. занимается животноводством уже пять лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Holberdi N. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 45 years old, married and has six children. He has high education. He works as an accountant and also owns a small farm. He has been in the animal husbandry for five years now. He plans to get a loan to increase the headcount of cattle. Holberdi plans to pay off the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience I. is 48 years old and married with 8 children. She has a tailoring shop where she makes dress and sells tailoring materials. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials. She says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco González se dedica a la venta de partes de carros usados, y su esposa la señora Rebeca Serrato a la venta de ropa usada estos son los ingresos de su familia. Ellos viven actualmente en una casa prestada pero ya les están pidiendo que desocupen la vivienda. Y a su casa le esta haciendo falta la losa pero no cuentan con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora, es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para poder terminar la construcción y así poder abitar a su propia casa. 
La persona que sale en la foto es su esposa la señora Rebeca Serrato, ya que el solicitante el señor Francisco González no se encontraba porque él es la única persona que atiende el negocio, y el de su esposa es más accesible en los horarios de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco González sells used car parts. His wife, Mrs. Rebeca Serrato, sells used clothing. These two jobs provide the family’s income. Today they live in a borrowed home and they have been asked to move out. Their home is missing the slab foundation but they don’t have the money to make this improvement, so they are seeking a loan to be able to finish the construction and be able to live in their own home. The person in the photo is Mrs. Rebeca Serrato, as Mr. Francisco González was not home because he is the only person who works in his business, while his wife’s business is more accessible during business hours.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete slab

loans.name: Annick

texts.fr:
L. Annick est mariée à EUSSOUME Pierre et mère de trois enfants dont deux scolarisés. L. Annick réside à fidjrossè, un banlieue de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. L. Annick vend de bouillie, de gâteaux, de charbon en détail et de l’huile d’arachide. Pour renforcer son capital, L. Annick sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Annick L. is married to Pierre Eussoume and is the mother of three children, two of whom are at school. She lives in Fidjrossé, a suburb of Cotonou, Bénin’s economic capital. Mrs. L. sells “bouillie” (a type of porridge), cakes, coal in bulk and peanut oil. To boost her capital, Mrs. L. is requesting a second loan from Alidé. In Bénin's local language, Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest.” Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next to Nigeria, with a GDP per capita of $1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to the most vulnerable and is part of a group that is about to launch a micro-health insurance program for beneficiaries of microcredit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, corn flour, sugar, peanut oil and coal

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 35 years old and married, with four children aged 15, 11, 6 and 5. She also cares for four additional dependants.

Fatma has sold clothes and snacks in Zanzibar’s Mikunguni neighborhood for six years. She belongs to the Tawaqal group loan (Group code 2018). She works every day and currently earns an average monthly profit of $175.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more clothes and snacks to sell. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to boost profitability and expand her business, so that she can pay school fees for her children and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria S., 20, is single and has no children.  She has 2 years of experience in the canteen business. She sells food to the school children 5 days per week. She has not borrowed from SPBD before. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Samoan Tala (~83 USD). SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase bread, butter, tinned tuna, eggs and plastic wrap.

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es: El Señor Silverio Bermúdez tiene 55 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado, su esposa es ama de casa y tiene 6 hijos ya todos independientes.  Don Silverio trabajador y responsable tiene su propio negocio de venta de granos y lácteos desde hace 17 años de experiencia en servicio al cliente. Trabajaba como agricultor lo cual le permitió adquirir conocimiento útil para la compra y venta de productos básicos. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra vender mayores cantidades de productos, la compra de granos básico como: frijoles, arroz, maíz y trigos. La realización de ventas a diferentes puntos del país ya que realiza viajes a la costa Atlántica.
texts.en:
Silverio B. is 55 years old, living in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He is married; his wife is a housewife and he has six children, all independent. Silverio is hardworking and responsible; he has had his own business selling grains and dairy products for 17 years, and he has experience in customer service. He used to work as a farmer, which gave him useful experience in buying and selling basic products. Thanks to the loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, he will be able to sell larger quantities of products and purchase basic grains such as beans, rice, corn, and wheat. He will be able to make sales in different areas of the country and travel to the Atlantic coast.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing R. is 30 years old and married with four children.  She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs.  Blessing seeks a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more itemsto sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Margarita Z. y su esposo el señor José Lopez tienen tres hijos para los cuales quieren lo mejor.
   A la vivienda le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de la casa pero en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para la comprar el material ya que su esposo se encargara de la construcción.
   Están solicitando el préstamo ya que están preocupados por la seguridad de los niños cuando salen a jugar. Su ingreso proviene del negocio que tiene de tapicería de muebles.
texts.en:
Ms. Sandra Margarita Z. and her husband, Mr. José Lopez, have three children to whom the want to give the best.

Their house needs a front protective wall, but at this time, they do not have the money necessary to purchase the materials for her husband to build it.

They are requesting this loan because they are worried about their children’s safety when they go out to play. Their income stems from a furniture upholstery business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a protective wall in front of her house

loans.name: Deicy

texts.es:
Deicy tiene un puesto de venta donde vende sopa de fideo y silpancho (carne asada con arroz y huevo frito) medio día y por las tardes comercializa productos de Herba Life. Estas dos actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus dos hijos que depende de ella pues es madre soltera. Vive en alquiler ubicado en la Zona Ballivian de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para la compra de insumos (fideo y arroz por cantidad) para tener almacenado, reducir costos e incrementar sus ingresos. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Deicy has a stand where she sells noodle soup and silpancho soup (grilled beef with rice and fried egg) at lunch and in the afternoons which are Herba Life products. These two activities are her main source of income that she uses to support her two children that depend on her since she is a single mother. She rents an apartment in the Ballivian zone in the city of El Alto. The loan will go towards the purchase of ingredients (noodles and rice in bulk) that will be stored in order to reduce costs and increase her earnings. This is the first loan with Kiva partner Impro, but she has completed the assessment to qualify for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of noodles and rice in order to save in the costs of her food selling business.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Олимов Музафар родился 1983 году, он недавно женился. Он занимается продажей мужской одежды.  Он торгует на рынке "Станция" г. Вахдат. Музаффар  закупает товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. Он ездит за товаром 2 раз в месяц. Музаффар хочет получить займ 3000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев для закупа партий мужских спортивных костюмов.

loans.use: Закуп мужских спортивных костюмов.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey, a local dish made from corn dough served hot with peppers and fried fish. She buys her ingredients from Kumasi and nearby communities. She sells on a tabletop on the street.

Joyce is 39 years old, married and has three children: one son and two daughters. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Abuakwa in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Joyce works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to buy maize in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Generación está formado por  tres jóvenes emprendedoras,  muy esforzadas y trabajadoras. Ellas son Esthela del Socorro R., Perla del Carmen R. y Dalila Mercedes G. H..

La coordinadora del grupo es Esthela Rodriguez, quien a sus 21 años trabaja exitosamente en la venta de cosméticos de varias líneas de renombre como lo son AVON, Zermat y Vogue. Trabajo que realiza desde hace 4 años. En el cual se a desmpeñado muy bien ya que se encuentra entre las mejores vendedoras de AVON y Vogue.

Éste grupo lleva 3 ciclos con ADIM y están muy satisfechas con el trabajo realizado. Las demás miembras del grupo como los son Perla quien trabaja en la venta de verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 3 años y Dalila quien trabaja en el destace de cerdo desde hace mas de 3 años.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Generación” Group is made up of three young enterprising women who are very strong and hardworking. They are Esthela del Socorro R., Perla del Carmen R., and Dalila Mercedes G. H..

The coordinator of the group is Esthela R., who at 21 years works successfully in cosmetics sales. She sells various renowned brands such as AVON, Zermat, and Vogue and has been doing so for the past 4 years. She does her job well, as she is now among the best AVON and Vogue sellers.

This group has been through 3 loan cycles with ADIM and they are very satisfied with the work done. The other group members are Perla, who has worked in vegetable sales in the Masaya market for 3 years, and Dalila, who has worked butchering pork for more than 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different brand products to distribute them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To extend the area of her restaurant and buy essential ingredients for her cooking

loans.name: Elmith

texts.es: La señora Elmith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Cucardas II”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 04 hijos, los 04 que aun están bajo su cargo.Nos cuenta que se inicio con la Venta de Abarrotes, hace varios años atrás. Estableció su negocio, ahorrando poco a poco y con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 comenzó a comprar mas abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.Hoy sus vecinos, amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca diariamente y esa es una de sus ventajas grandes que tiene, para generar sus propios ingresos y de esta manera ser responsable con sus cuotas.Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará abarrotes como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, paquetes de leches y aceites; también paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Igiebor

texts.en: Igiebor A. is married with seven children. He is 57 years old. He has been in the farming business for the past 15 years. He is requesting the loan amount of 30,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more seedlings to plant. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Lacen Kome Tek Atuko Rose Group

texts.en: Rose A., a 30-year-old married mother of three children attending school, deals with used clothes and shoes. She has been conducting this business for over five years and is now requesting a loan to purchase more stocks of used clothes and shoes to expand her enterprise. Rose is an active and promising lady who hopes to complete her house in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of used clothes and shoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Luy S. is 42 years old and lives in the province of Kompong Tom, Cambodia.  She and her husband own a plot of land next to their house and grow  rice and vegetables. Luy S. also braids traditional mats for sale. She is a devoted mother to three children, who are no longer in school. Two of them are employed: one is a garment worker and one works in construction. Luy S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for growing potatoes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for growing potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has owned a shop in his town, since 2007. He sells CDs and DVDs. He’s 21 years old and he lives with his parents. He helps his father in the household. Today, Ali is asking to borrow $600 to buy more merchandise and to make some renovations to his shop.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise and to make some renovations to his shop.

loans.name: Hishigdulam

texts.en:
Hishigdulam is 24 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her two young sons both attend kindergarten. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent. 

Hishigdulam is planning to operate a milk-trading business with the loan that she is requesting from Xacbank, a Kiva partner. Previously, in 2006, she managed a consumers-goods trading business at a local market. In 2008, she had to stop her business operation because of her pregnancy. She has worked hard and today she has gained much experience in conducting business. 

Hishigdulam is a very open-minded and hardworking businesswoman and she has many plans for the future. She hopes to continue to increase her earnings and improve her family's quality of life. Hishigdulam is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan to start her milk-trading business.

loans.use: To start a milk-trading business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 46, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. S. is in a business of weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of about $8 per day. She has been in this business since 2007. Her husband is a skillful blacksmith, earning about $3 per day. 

S. and her family members try to work hard and help each other to ensure a good standard of living for the family. They are seeking to improve their businesses as well as to deal with the necessary daily expenses. Therefore, S. is requesting for a loan of $1000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw silk to produce Cambodian traditional silk for her new and existing customers. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: buy raw silk

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 3 hijos; Jhonatan de 17, Luis de 14 y Miriam de 2 años. No está casada y debe afrontar sola las necesidades de sus hijos, por el momento vive en la casa de unos familiares.

Las circunstancias de la vida la llevaron a realizar diferentes actividades, pero donde se amoldó más es en la venta de ropa. Su modalidad de trabajo es visitar en sus casas a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos, y ofrecerles sus prendas directamente. Lleva cerca de 15 años en esta actividad y le ha resultado muy rentable. 
Hace 2 años tenía un puesto en el mercado de su localidad, pero tuvo que dejarlo porque su hija se enfermó, posteriormente le fue imposible recuperarlo. 
Yesenia es muy conocida en su barrio porque los precios que ofrece son cómodos, pues compra la ropa al por mayor y a bajos precios.
Para el futuro, quiere comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su casa propia para el bienestar de sus hijos.

Este es su noveno crédito con MFP y asegura ser puntual, como hasta ahora lo ha sido, en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no le gustaría defraudar a sus compañeras de grupo, con quienes ha ido progresando de manera solidaria. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de su capital para comprar ropa de moda para la época de verano.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a very enterprising woman. She has three children: Jhonatan is 17, Luis is 14 and Miriam is 2. She is not married and she has to faace alone all her children's needs. For the time being she lives with some family members. Her life circumstances led her to deal in different activities, but where she felt more at home was selling clothes. She visits her friends, family members and neighbours in their homes and offers them her clothes in a straightforward manner, She has been for 15 years at this activity and it has turned out to be quite profitable. Two years ago she had a market in her hometown market, but she had to leave it because her daughter got sick, and later it was impossible to get it back. Yesenia is very well known in her neighbourhood because the prices she offers are good, since she buys the clothing wholesale and cheap. For the future she wants to buy a piece of land where he can build her own home for her children's wellbeing. This is her ninth credit MFP and she assures she will be punctual, as she has been until now, in her repayments, since she does not want to let her group partners down, with whom she his progressing shoulder to shoulder. The money she asks for will be invested in increasing her capital to buy fashionable clothing for the summer season.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: clothing

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
Nourn K., age 34, is married and resides with his wife in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has two children. He works in the agriculture sector, farming with his wife and earning an income of approximately US$3 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover his family expenses, especially for the children’s education. He has been farming since 2000.

The family's standard of living has improved since K. has been in this business, so he wants to have a loan to expand his business. K. is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike to transport fruits and vegetables for sale at the market when they are available from the fields. This is his first loan from CREDIT, Kiva's partner. (K.'s wife is pictured)

loans.use: buy a motorbike to sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina C., 55, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Widowed and blessed with nine children, she makes sure that she earns well so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Josefina has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

Now, with your help, Josefina would like to obtain a PHP 21,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more quantities of products to be incorporated into her current inventory.

Josefina dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products for her general store

loans.name: Ruqaiya's Group

texts.en:
Parveen wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Gulzar wants a loan to buy electric supplies (wires, switches, and tube lights) for her electrical supply-selling business. Majidan wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Ruqaiya is the group leader of the afore-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city named Lahore, a city famous in Pakistan for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Ruqaiya is a 48-year-old married woman. She has a two-room house and has been living in it with her family for the past 40 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a mason by profession. She is the mother of five kids: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is involved in a furniture-making business. The one after him does embroidery on clothes. Her elder daughter helps her by dealing with the customers. The others don’t do anything. She is applying for a loan to buy bedsheets in bulk to expand her bedsheet-selling business.

loans.use: To buy bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Diana Ivon

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es el esposo.
Diana Ivon y su esposo es una pareja joven que empieza a formar un patrimonio para su familia. Es por ello que en este momento quiere un préstamo para poder construir un cuarto en la planta alta de su vivienda para poder realizar este proyecto es comprar material y pago de mano de obra. Esta joven pareja se preocupa por el bienestar de su único hijo más que todo darle una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The person who appears in the photograph is the husband. Diana and her husband are a young couple who are just starting to form a family. It's for this reason that they are requesting a loan at the moment, so they can build a room on the top floor of their home by purchasing materials and hiring labor to complete the project. This young couple worries about the well-being of their only son and want to provide him a better quality of life more than anything.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room on the top floor of their home

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Susana is married and has 3 adult children. Susana owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Susana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Susana is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en:
Yolanda M. is from the town of Palagao Jones. She is 49 years old. Yolanda is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yolanda M. Group.

Yolanda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2006, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
